story:
VOUS AUSSI DEVENEZ PRODUCTEURS D'ART LOOP !!!!!!!!!! 

CONTRIBUEZ À ART LOOP, L'AVENTURE CRÉATIVE ! 

(English follows !) 

Nous sommes heureux de vous présenter notre projet !! Nous sommes Yasser et Noémie, vidéaste et photographe, passionnés par les artistes et la création. Nous nous sommes lancés dans la réalisation de ce projet qui nous tient vraiment à coeur :)  

UNE SEMAINE - UN PAYS - UN CRÉATIF 

Une chaîne entre 10 créateurs de différents pays, différentes disciplines et différentes cultures. Nous allons documenter le processus créatif d’artistes issus de différentes disciplines. Nous allons observer les détails de conception, de production d’une œuvre mais aussi les doutes et les réflexions de l’artiste. Nous voulons dresser le portrait d’artistes d’aujourd’hui avec les difficultés et les particularités que cela implique selon les différents pays et contextes sociaux.

 

COMMENT ÇA MARCHE ? 

 

DEVENEZ PRODUCTEURS D'ART LOOP ! CE DONT NOUS AVONS BESOIN POUR RÉALISER LE PROJET ! 

Nous avons besoin de 3500 € = 4662 $US pour réaliser le projet dans de bonnes conditions. Si nous atteignons l'objectif, grâce à vous chers producteurs du projet, l'argent servira pour les dépenses suivantes : 

- Participation aux dépenses de transport des deux réalisateurs et du transport des oeuvres (nos dépenses totales seront de 5000 € = 6660 $US)

- Participation aux dépenses pour l'équipement vidéo et photo

          - Objectif photo-vidéo grand angle : 600 € = 800 $US

          - Objectif photo-vidéo polyvalent : 500  € =670  $US

          - Batterie supplémentaire : 100 € = 135 $US

 

En devenant producteur d'Art Loop, vous ferez partie intégrante du projet, vous recevrez du contenu inédit, des clins d'oeil, des surprises et vous serez nos partenaires privilégiés tout au long de la chaîne créative ! 

 

L'AVENTURE ART LOOP C'EST NOTRE PROJET À TOUS !  

Grâce à votre contribution, vous nous permettrez de réaliser notre projet dans de bonnes conditions, de vous montrer de belles images et de dévoiler au grand jour le talent et la créativité de 10 artistes de 10 pays différents. De développer avec vous et avec les artistes des réflexions sur le processus créatif et sur le rôle de l'art dans la société selon les cultures.

RETROUVEZ-NOUS, PARTAGEZ LIKEZ : 

 

- La page Facebook d'ART LOOP 

- Le site internet du projet : www.artloop.project.com 

 

 ❤ L'ÉQUIPE D'ART LOOP VOUS AIME !!! ❤  

 

----

ENGLISH TRANSLATION 

 

CONTRIBUTE TO THE ART LOOP CREATIVE ADVENTURE!

 We are pleased to present you our project! We are Yasser and Noémie, videographer and photographer, passionate by artists and creation. We started this project and It's really important to us :)

 

 

ONE WEEK - ONE COUNTRY - ONE ARTIST

A chain between 10 designers from different countries, cultures and practices. 
Our goal is to document the creative process of artists from various artistic disciplines. We wish to view design phases, work's production and observe the doubts and thoughts of the artist. We also want to portray today’s artists with their specific difficulties and peculiarities that entails in different cultures and countries and social contexts.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

 

 

BECOME AN ART LOOP PRODUCER! WHAT WE NEED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT!

 

We need 3500€ = 4662 $US to make the project : If we reach the goal, thanks to you dear producers of the project, the money will be used for the following expenses:

- Participation in the transportation expenses of the two directors and transport of the works of art : 5000 €

- Participation in expenses for the video equipment and photo:

           - Video camera lens wide angle: 600 €

           - Camera versatile lens  photo and video: 500 €

           - Additional battery: 100 €

 

By becoming an Art Loop producer, you will be part of the project, you will receive new content, links, surprises and you will be our preferred partners !

 

THE REWARDS 

 

10$ = ART LOOP FAN!

Congratulations! You're Art Loop fan! We'll send you a surprise virtual postcard during the loop! Your name will be among the contributors to our website! ❤

20$ = ART LOOP BIG FAN!

Bravo! You're a Art Loop big fan! We'll send you a  surprise virtual postcard during the loop! Your name will be among the contributors on our website and on our facebook page! You'll also receive an exclusive and funny video during the trip! ❤

35$ = ART LOOP LOVER!

Yeah! You're an Art Loop lover! :) You'll receive a mini package with: an Art Loop sticker and a 4X6 limited art photography print at the end of the project. Your name will be among the contributors on our website and on our facebook page! You'll also receive an exclusive and funny video during the trip! ❤

45$ = ART LOOP PRODUCER! 

Congratulations! You are an Art Loop producer! You'll receive a package with: an Art Loop sticker and a limited 4X6 art photography print at the end of the project. We'll send you 4 exlusive videos during the project! Your name will be among the producers on our website and on our facebook page! ❤

75$ = ART LOOP SUPER PRODUCER! 

Yeah! You are an Art loop super producer! You'll receive a package with: an Art loop magnet and a limited 8.5 X11 art photography print at the end of the project. 4 exclusive videos of the project! An exclusive thanking video by the directors of the project will be posted on facebook and on the blog! Your name will be among the producers on our website and on our facebook page! ❤

200$ = ART LOOP BIG PRODUCER! 

Wow! You are a BIG Art Loop producer! You'll receive a package with: an Art loop magnet and a limited 8.5 X11 art photography print of your choice at the end of the project. We will send 10 exclusive videos of the project! An exclusive thanking video  for one of the artists of the project will be posted on facebook and on the blog! Your name will be among the MAIN producers on our website and on our facebook page! ❤ Only 20 available!

650$ = ART LOOP HUGE PRODUCER! 

WOW! You are a HUGE Art Loop producer! You'll receive a package with: an Art loop magnet and a limited 12X18 art photography print of your choice at the end of the project. A thanking video made with the 10 artists will be posted on our social networks and our blog.Your name will be among the PRINCIPAL producers on our website and on our facebook page! And ...You will meet the two directors of the project over a good glass of wine! ❤ Only 5 available!

 

ART LOOP IS ALSO YOUR PROJECT!

With your contribution, you will allow us to realize our project in the right conditions, to show you beautiful pictures and openly reveal the talent and creativity of 10 artists from 10 different countries. Develop with you and the artists reflections on the creative process and the role of art in society in different cultures.

 

JOIN US, SHARE, LIKE:

-  Facebook : ART LOOP 

-  www.artloop.project.com 

 

 ❤ ART LOOP LOVES YOU !!! ❤

story:
Good day,

My name is Margo Miller, executive director of the Appalachian Community Fund. I became a member of Alternate ROOTS in 1993 and have been a part of the ROOTS family ever since. The organization means so much to me as a cultural activist who wants to be connected with others who are working at the intersection of arts and activism.
 
As you know, we are fast approaching, the 37th Annual Meeting and Artists' Retreat - Unpacking the Journey. This week is a time to renew yourself, connect and reconnect with friends old and new, and to recommit to the journey of creating a better world as artists and cultural organizers together.
 
The subsidy committee met last week and distributed the last of the funds available to help those who need assistance with attending the annual meeting.
 
As a current donor, I will not only continue supporting Alternate ROOTS’ operations with my monthly donation, but I will also donate additional money to the subsidy fund so more folks can take part in a transformative experience!
 
Will you join me? Every bit counts. Your donation could be the difference between one person having the time of their life and only hearing others talk about it.  ROOTS WEEK is only 4 weeks away. We have $3,110 more to raise to fully subsidize all that have applied for assistance.   Please donate today and help someone else participate in a week of retreat, performance, visual arts, meetings, and peer connections in the journey to create a better world together.
 
Peace, love and light,

Margo Miller

story:
Once again Street Souljas Productions is participating in this year's 48 Hour Film Project, and we are bringing a bigger team than ever before. 

Each and every team member is working on a volunteer basis, and we could not appreciate their 110% effort enough. But the bottom line is, feeding a large team gets expensive, and this is where WE NEED YOU! Help us FEED OUR TEAM!! Check out the donating options and the perks that go along with it! You can be a Producer, or even an Executive Producer of our film, promote your business during the project, or see your name in the credits on the big screen. 

We cannot begin to explain to you how grateful we are for your contributions. Our entire team and every one involved with this year's project owes you a big wet one!

story:
Stories shape our culture. With an over saturation of gloomy dystopic narratives streaming throughout American screens, it is no wonder why so many of us feel paralyzed by the inevitability of war, poverty, climate disaster, and robot overlords.  While these stories can be an important tool for staying informed and presenting the possible dark futures, there are few stories engaging the public imagination for how different social norms, shared values, and systems for organizing society could uplift humanity.

Bright21st is a nascent multi-media organization focused on stories set in inspiring futures and alternate realities.  Our first project was a short story contest wrapped-up in the winter of 2020.  You can read the winning entries as well as a few other selections at www.bright21st.com.  These stories will also be produced into podcasts narrated by voice actors. The $1,250 combined prize money for the top two stories was self-funded to build a proof of concept.

Now we are looking to you, the audience, for contributions to incentivize the next round of fictional stories set in inspiring futures or alternate realities where reparations for African Americans and  Native Americans have been made, or are somewhere on the path to being made. 

The $1,400 ask is to cover prizes for the top two entries, $750 1st prize and $500 2nd prize, as well as the fees for fundraising on Indiegogo.  Money raised beyond the goal will be used as stipends for judges, and for costs of producing voice actor narrated podcasts of the stories.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Shengzhang Gu, a Chinese graduate student from Arts Administration Master of Arts Program at Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD). In order to fulfill the requirement of Arts Administration program and finish my Arts Administration final project, I will curate a thesis exhibition titled Perceptions of Savannah from August 5 to 7 at Historic Kennedy Pharmacy, Davenport House Museum, at 323 E. Broughton Street in Savannah, Georgia. It is my first time to plan, prepare and curate an event individually and I will take charge for all aspects of the event in order to ensure the success of this exhibition.

What is the show displayed about?

Established in 1733, Savannah is known for its stunning coastline, rich history, and warm southern hospitality. As one of the original 13 colonies and the oldest city in Georgia, Savannah is endowed with a culture focused on art. From the beautiful Historic District, to River Street, every small angle gives visitors a sense of art. Perceptions of Savannah is a visual arts exhibition showcasing artworks concentrated on drawing the artists’ recognition and interpretation about the art elements embedded in Savannah’s history, culture, architecture and social life. These descriptions in artworks will take the viewers on a unique journey through lovely Savannah from an artist’s point of view. The artworks will be selected through online call for submissions, selecting 7 artists from SCAD Savannah campus to showcase their interpretation of the beauty of Savannah through their artworks. These artworks may be realistic or abstract, embodying the high artistic techniques and unique perspective of Savannah through artists’ eyes.

The show will take place at Historic Kennedy Pharmacy, Davenport House Museum in Savannah, Georgia August 5-7 with opening reception the night of August 5 from 5-9 pm. 

The opening reception will open to the public, featuring with free food, happy music and gorgeous artworks.

What will we need?

This indiegogo campaign will not only help me to cover budget of the event, but also to advertise and promote this exhibition to a wider range of audience. The money we get from this indiegogo campaign will be completely used for the expense of exhibition, making sure to provide best environment, facilities, and food and beverage for the people who attend my exhibition.

The perceptions of Savannah total needs to raise $1,200 for the exhibition, and the budget is broken down as follows:

$400 for three days Kennedy Pharmacy rental fee

$104 for private event liability insurance

$105 for 1,000 postcard printing

$140 for 50 poster printing

$215 for 50 catalog printing

$40 for artworks transportation

$50 for exhibition Installation facility

$200 for food and beverage

$100 for other expense.

Total expense is $1354, and I hope to get $1,200 from this indiegogo campaign.

If you donate my campaign, you will receive the following perks as return.

$5- You will receive a faithful appreciation from all staffs, artists and curator of Perceptions of Savannah. Thanks for your generous support and we will shout out your name on our Facebook page  and event.

$10- I will write and send you a personalized e-mail to appreciate your generous support.

$15- You will receive a personalized thank you e-mail as well a shout out on the Perceptions of Savannah Facebook page and event.

$20- You will receive all $15 perks and a postcard of Perceptions of Savannah with best wishes from curator .

$50- All $20 perks will be included and you will also get a full-color catalog with your name. (please attach your personal information while making contribution.

$100- As this level, you will receive all perks of $50 as well as a limited edition T-shirt with Perceptions of Savannah's logo. (please attach your personal information as well as the size of the T-shirt)

$200- You can receive all items from Perceptions of Savannah and you name will be printed on all Perceptions of Savannah’s marketing materials. The curator, me will provide you a private VIP tour of the exhibition. 

In the end, please don't forget to support the perceptions of Savannah's social media pages on Facebook and Instagram.

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/perceptionsofsavannah?fref=ts 

Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/1423784484614037/

Instagram: Perceptions of Savannah

story:
The Dream: 

Moving to Uganda in June of 2016 surprised me.

I saw beautiful kitenge fabrics- East African cotton prints in bright, bold patterns. 

I started becoming a bit obsessed with kitenge. I have everything from kitenge curtains to kitenge peacoat jackets in my apartment. I even have kitenge oven mitts. 

My dream is to launch Kawa: An online marketplace linking Ugandan kitenge fashion to the world that empowers Ugandan women and girls.

What is Kawa?

                                     

Kawa: A common phrase in Uganda is “Everything is kawa”. Kawa is slang in Luganda, one of the local languages in Uganda, for “cool”, “original” and “easy”. Kawa the brand embodies that by keeping our clothes cool, original, and easy-to-wear.

Kawa is dedicated to:

  1. Sending gorgeous, cool, one-of-a-kind, easy-to-wear clothes that are made in Uganda directly to your doorstep
  2. Easy, no-hassle customer service
  3. Empowering Ugandan women by working with tailors and fashion designers to grow their businesses and empowering Ugandan girls by donating 10% of all profits to a scholarship fund for Ugandan girls

Kawa will give people get more color in their wardrobes while employing hundreds of women across Uganda and enabling thousands of girls to get an education. 

What We Need & What You Get:

To make this dream a reality, I will need $3,000 in funding to cover initial start-up costs like business registration fees, one-year membership for a online store, an online marketing campaign, and operational costs in Uganda. 

To cover those costs, I will send you original, one-of-a-kind clothing from Uganda! These clothes are hand-made with beautiful kitenge fabrics by three different teams of Ugandan designers.

Here are the designers making each of the pieces. 

1. Susan Namirumi- Peacoat master

Susan is the first designer I started working with. I saw a peacoat she made for a friend and was completely blown away. She says she "wants to make clothes that will send shivers down your spine". 

2. Wookuri Sandra- Hoodie-designer extraordinaire

Sandra has been working in fashion and design for the last five years. I have fallen in love with her hoodies. Sandra dreams of owning her own tailor shop in Uganda and traveling the world. 

3. The Women of Change a Life Uganda- Pillow and scarf-making champions

Change a Life Uganda, an NGO created in the US, started a tailoring program in Nakasongola District in Uganda. Nakasongola District has a dark reputation in Uganda. Nakasongola District is in the drought corridor of Uganda; many women living in poverty turn to sex work to support themselves and their children. Change a Life Uganda is running an annual seamstress program for women to learn how to support themselves and their families. I loved the scarves and pillow cases this spirited group has designed and want to help them find markets for their products once they have finished their program. 

I will ship the clothing made by my teams of designers from Uganda directly to your door step.  

Our Pieces: 

We are starting with four pieces- infinity scarf, pillow case, hoodie jackets, and peacoat jackets. 

The Infinity Scarf: 

The Pillow Case: 

The Hoodie: 

The Peacoat: 

The Impact:

Kawa creates impact in three ways 

1. Bringing Ugandan fashion to the world: Kawa will share the beauty of Ugandan clothes and fashions with the world. 

2. Employment for Ugandan women: Kawa currently gives work to 20 women in Uganda. As Kawa grows, more and more women will have opportunities to work. 

3. Educating Ugandan girls: Kawa will also donate 10% of all profits to girl's education in Uganda. Why girl's education? Girls' education is an investment in economic growth, a healthier workforce, lasting peace and the future of our planet. 

Two of the tailors of Change a Life Uganda in Nakasongola District with one of the daughters of the program who will benefit from the girls' education scholarship fund.

The scholarship fund will initially go to support the primary school education of the daughters of Kawa's designers. After that, we will work with local organizations to find the best scholarship programs to support to impact the largest number of girls possible. 

Why Now?

If not you, who? If not now, when? 

We have gone through eight rounds of proto-typing to perfect these pieces. Now we are at the point where we are ready to share this with the world. Before the holidays is the perfect time to get one of these pieces. Not only will this help more girls in Uganda get an education, but will also help some families have a brighter Christmas. We only have two weeks to reach this goal and see if we can make this dream a reality!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please help us get the word out! You can: 

  • Share this campaign on Facebook! Every Facebook share means the world to us.
  • E-mail this to your friends, neighbors, or your grandma! Imagine how your grandma could rock a kitenge peacoat! Could that be her next birthday present from you? 

Much love and gratitude, 

Julie

story:
What is Taofledermaus?

A YouTube staple, Taofledermaus has been one part ballistics science and one part performance art.  Laid back and eternally curious, Jeff has been willing to load just about anything that viewers have provided and blasted it at a wide variety of entertaining targets.  The results are captured in excellent high speed and given a fair analysis.  

 

 

What is this Poster?

 

Jeff shipped off some of the more exciting user-made objects in pairs, one in excellent condition and the other fired at high speed into what was once a solid object, to his friends Othais and Mae.  They photographed each piece individually and then scaled and assembled them into one collected work.  

 

 

 

Why would I want this?

The poster is a piece of the show you've grown to love and an inexpensive way to help the channel.  YouTube just isn't what it used to be in some ways and despite viewership growing, channels have to find other ways to gain support.  This opportunity is great, as everyone gets something and the show gets a much needed boost!

story:
Aloha! My name is Rose Adare, I’m an evocative artist disabled by a muni train in 2005. To get through the hard times, I began painting truly inspiring, brilliant, out of the box people, and now I have solid offers for shows guaranteed in Oakland, San Francisco, Seattle, AND Brooklyn, NY! But I need your help to get there! 

I’m not asking for plane tickets or hotels. I’ll sleep on couches and eat ramen. But I need help with shipping and production costs.

I’ve had three amazing shows already, at the Hawaii Museum of Contemporary Art,  The J+ Gallery in Holualoa, and the prestigious Maui Arts & Cultural Center's Schaefer Portrait Gallery, but now it’s time to reach the mainland.

Hawai'i is 75 miles across and is 2,467 miles from California.  That's a long distance to move 31 paintings, 5 plexiglass shadowboxes, and 35 plexiglass descriptions—especially when some of the paintings are 10 x 7 feet! The powerful success behind Restraint & Revolution “took a village,” and now it’ll “take a continent” to move across the ocean.  

I paint people—dynamic, fascinating, multicultural role models changing the world through art, music, and social activism. As an educational art tour, Restraint & Revolution shares their biographies with their portraits to begin a conversation with the audience—a conversation about social taboo’s in the 21st century. Sex. Gender. Age. Body Image. Disability. Free Expression. Spiritual Identity. What does it mean to challenge social norms, today? Each mind-blowing model in Restraint & Revolution wears a form of corsetry as a symbol of social restraint and personal revolution.

Some of my 40 inspirational models include:

  • Queer sexologist, Carol Queen.
  • Native American advocate & Academy Award winning folk legend,       Buffy Sainte-Marie
  • One of America’s leading GLBTQ public speakers, Kimberly Dark.
  • Olympic Medalist & Motivational Speaker, Annetta Lucero
  • Body-Mod artist & Guinness World Record holder, Kala Kaiwi
  • Epic Burning Man sculptor & founder of American Steel, Karen Cusolito
  • Whirling Dervish and founder of Velocity Circus, Gregangelo.
  • Astounding visual makeup couture, Devin Mohr
  • Choreographer & Stanford's Artistic Director of Black Performing Arts, Robert Moses. 
  • Actress and Olympic Medalist, Dreya Weber 
  • Culinary Chef & Food body Artist, Tiberio Simone 
  • Sister of Perpetual Indulgence, Sister Eve Volution
  • Genderqueer adult performer, Jiz Lee
  • And Iconic Singer-Song Writer, Jason Webley

close-up of (left) "Primal Buddha" Kala Kaiwi and (right) "Talk Story" Joshua Lanakila Mangauil

Likewise, just as corsetry evolved from chaste undergarments to scandalous lingerie, Restraint & Revolution reclaims classical portraiture as a new form of evocative art. As an art series, Restraint & Revolution pushes the boundaries of classical and contemporary art by uniting traditional mediums with wild diversity. Portraits you would never see in a museum before, are finally making their entrance.  

 


STRETCH GOAL is $7,550! Only $2000 more!

Help me get these amazing paintings to New York!

I’ve been offered a 2500sq gallery for a month in Brooklyn, with an opening, mid-point event and closing show! This will give me time to court other museums and galleries in New York. AND I will be painting through-out, so people can come and watch me. So New Yorkers, get me to the Big Apple!!!!  I'll even paint one of your own and unveil them at the closing show!!!

  • $1500 for round trip shipping from California, to New York, back to California.
  • $250 for promotional materials for all 3 events in NY.
  • $300 food for 3 events in NY.


My first goal was achieved! Restraint & Revolution from Hawaii, to Oakland, to San Francisco; will fund and promote three events at American Steel Studios, The Academy of Art University, and the San Francisco Center for Sex & Culture; and initial storage.  

  • $750 for packing supplies & to build 2 more shipping crates (5x4x4ft) I have 5 crates already built & paid for! FYI materials in Hawai'i are pricy.
  • $1500 to ship door to door from Hawai’i to Oakland, CA.
  • $1000 for show costs, including fuel (fire performers/flaming sculptures) + permits + security, for all 3 events. 
  • $750 for promotional materials for all 3 events.
  • $500 to transport paintings to each event, including U-haul rental for 3 days + plus gas + help lifting crates.  
  • $1000 Food & Beverages for all 3 events.

Total $5500, for three amazing art shows in California, spreading the message of 40 inspiring people working hard to improve our world.


American Steel Studios. Oakland CA.
Aug 15th 2015

Restraint & Revolution: Burn for the Arts.

A one night extravaganza! This will be the only time Restraint & Revolution will ever be shown in its entirety. American Steel Studios is a 6 acre warehouse of amazing sculptures and fire toys; the Burning Man factory, if you will. There, we will begin with a huge, one night event, so wear your wildest corsets and costumes!


Center for Sex & Culture San Francisco Aug 19th to Aug 30th

Opening, Saturday, Aug 22nd 5:30 – 9:30
Art Talk and Book reading, Sunday Aug. 23rd 2:00 to 5:30
Panel Discussion, Thursday Aug. 27th 6:00 to 9:00                                All Things Yummy, Sun. Aug. 30th, 6 to 9

A special series of events featuring Restraint & Revolution at San Francisco’s amazing Center for Sex & Culture. Combining sensuality, curiosity, and sheer genius, the CSC is a beautiful host in the heart of San Francisco.


Academy of Art University at the Cannery

Sept. 3rd to Sept. 27nd

Opening is Thursday Sept 4th 5:30 – 7:30

A one month exhibition featuring nine originals from Restraint & Revolution at my old alma mater. A classy, high-brow affair, so wear your best!




Risk Evaluation

your perks no matter what! 

If I am running behind I'll let everyone know immediately, I did add wiggle room into the dates and I am good at deadlines too. :)


Other Important Information

  • Shipping is included if you are in the U.S.  For those outside of the U.S, please contact me and I will ship in the least expensive way and take off what shipping would be for the states. Let Restraint & Revolution travel the world!  

  • IndieGogo doesn't let you combine multiple rewards, you will have to complete the process for each reward you want, I am sorry about this, but I greatly thank you for your support!
  • As soon as the campaign is over, I'll start getting the perks out and singing your praises, actually I'll probably sing them immediately with an impromptu dance!
  • Please contact me at roseadare@gmail.com if you have any questions, or comments, I look forward to hearing from old friends and making some new ones!

Other Ways To Help

  • Getting the word out is the big battle, Please pass this to those who like art, those that might like the perks, oh just everyone!  
 At the top of this page you can find Indiegogo's share tools and use them to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Linkedin.  Here is the link to this campaign if you just want to copy and paste it from here:  
https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/restraint-revolution-burn-for-the-arts-tour/edit/
  • I could use help with moving the painting around from town to town
  • Promoting the shows
  • I would LOVE to show in other areas. Museums and Galleries are hard to cold call, it really helps to have an introduction!
  • You can always just donate or be a patron, the arts needs more patrons.


  • To all the Amazing Artists, Performers and Creators in this series, it's because of you that these paintings exist!
  • Corset Designers: Dark Garden and Iris Viacrusis for adding continuity to this series and a splash of "wow"
  • Alex Stitt for your support and help in creating these videos, text and overall well being of my art and health!
  • Liz Ambrose for amazing tech support with Indiegogo!
  • HMOCA: Hawai'i Museum of Contemporary Art and Lourdan Kimbrell for your continued support on the art endeavor!
  • To all my friends, family and family to be, thank you for your love and support!

The BEST part of my life is my friends and family and that includes you!

story:
Get involved!

The Culture for Tolerance Foundation invites you to help in creating Trans*Festival – the first event of this scale in Krakow, entirely dedicated to transgender and gender diversities.

"Trans*" in the name of the festival means all forms of gender identities and expressions which differ from unequivocally male or female, or those who are unequivocally male or female but differ from gender assaigned at birth. For a long time, 'T' has been neglected by the LGBT ( lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender) rights movement in Poland, and we would like to help fill that gap.

One of the most discriminated groups in Polish society are people of non-heterosexual and non-heteronormative identities. Polish law does not sufficiently defend people from discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity. LGBTQ people face discriminatory behaviors in all fields of social life: education, employment, everyday activities.

According to report published by Campaign Against Homophobia in 2012 more than half of LGBT respondents revealed being subjected more than once to various forms of violence based on sexual orientation. Over half of transgender people, who took part in the research, have experienced physical or mental violence because of their transgender identity (Campaign Against Homophobia, "Social situation of LGBT people. Report from 2010-2011", Warsaw 2012). What is worth mentioning here, Poland has not introduced any law regulations which refer to hate speech or civil partnerships yet.  

It is our understanding that insufficient knowledge underlies social exclusion of transgender people in Poland. We believe that increasing awareness of gender diversity will contribute to more critical thinking about dominating gender norms and discourses.

During the festival we would like to address yet another critical issue which is the cisnormativity of Polish LGBTQ community. We want to promote both awareness of unique needs of transgender people and solidarity between groups representing the broad spectrum of gender and sexual diversities here in Poland. 
We strive for visibility of binary and non-binary transgender identities in public discourse, art and culture. The issue of gender non-conformism in public discourse is dominated by medical questions. The motivation of the project is the need of building sustained cooperation within transgender community in Poland and introducing issues of transgenderism to potential trans* allies.

WE ARE CREATING THIS FESTIVAL FOR TRANS*PEOPLE, ABOUT TRANS*PEOPLE, WITH TRANS*PEOPLE. SUPPORT US!


What is Trans*Festival all about?

We want to achieve greater visibility for trans* issues in various ways, combining theory with practice, and bringing academic knowledge face-to-face with the life experiences of guests both from Poland and abroad. The socially-engaged language of photography and film will be paired with workshops for trans* people and their allies.

We have five EXHIBITIONS lined up;

  • Chicago photographer JESS T. DUGAN whose portraits of trans* people we will be showing at the Grey House Gallery on Cracovian Main Square. The opening will take place on the evening of Thursday 28th May.

  • A series of photographs by OLIVIER TOURON from Lille, depicting the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence. Notwithstanding their theatrical appearance, the organisation does charity work, helping people living with HIV/AIDS. The opening of the exhibition will take place during the Queer May Festival at the Barakah theatre; Trans*Festival will organise the grand closing.

  • RYSZARD KISIEL & KAROL RADZISZEWSKI. These historical images are the result of a photo shoot by gay activist Ryszard Kisiel  and a group of his friends in the mid-80s. In an apartment, playing around with props, lipsticks, and costumes made spontaneously from leftover scraps of material, they created their own parallel universe of camp, separated from the realities of communist Poland. We will also be displaying photographs by one of the most prominent Polish artist Karol Radziszewski documenting the making of the film “Kisieland”.

  • IRENA KALICKA, a photographer from Krakow, will put on exhibition prepared especially for Trans*Festival at the F.A.I.T. Gallery.
  • AROBAL, the renowned artist who designed the promotional poster for Trans*Festival, will put on his first exhibition in Krakow especially for our festival.

We will be showing 4 DOCUMENTARIES: “Trans-akcja” - the story of Anna Grodzka, one of the most active ambassadors of LGBT rights in Polish Parliament and first openly transgender MP in Poland, who will be also the guest of Trans*Festival, “Magic Mirror” about French surrealist Claude Cahun, “My Prairie Home” about Canadian artist Rae Spoon…


... and the Japanese film “Miwa: A Japanese Icon”.


If you want to exchange experiences and share knowledge of gender diversity in various political and sociocultural spaces join us, trans*activists, trans*artists and trans*allies, for the TRANS*CAFE – series of presentations, workshops and panel discussions addressing a broad spectrum of trans*topics. We're expecting guests from all over Europe!

You can find more details about Trans*Café on Facebook or on our website.

What will your money be used for?

SUPPORTING TRAVELS OF TRANS*CAFE PARTICIPANTS

Your contributions will help cover the costs of organising Trans*Café, a series of presentations, discussions and workshops on trans* topics. The funds raised from this crowdfunding campaign will allow us to reach an international scale. We will be able to pay for travel for guests from abroad – trans*activists, trans*artists and trans*allies – and purchase materials for our workshops. We are inviting guests from all over the world, help us to make our meeting with them a reality! Let’s talk about transgender and gender diversity from different perspectives.

In order to support travel and accomodation of several guests who are going to participate in the Trans*Café section we need around 1300€.

COVERING COSTS OF TRANSPORTATION OF "SERIOUS GAME" INSTALLATION

The other objective of the crowdfunding campaign is to support financialy Anja Weber and Sabine Ercklentz "Serious Game" audio-visual installation. 6th exhibition during our festival will consist of 26 portraits of trans*activists and their audio testimonies about questionining gender, gender politics and activism. The name of the exhibition was taken from one of the interviews: I think performing gender is a game but it can get very serious.

See more pictures of Anja Weber and listen to Sabine Ercklentz recordings:
http://www.anjaweber.com/portfolio/?item_id=221&s=221

We collect money for transporting installation from Berlin to Krakow and back. We need for that around 400€. We have already booked the gallery in the centre of Krakow and collected money for exhibition fee and insurance.

This crowdfunding campaign will enable us to make Trans*Festival what we imagined it would be. All events at the festival will be free - we believe that a safe space where we ensure non-discriminatory behaviour should also be free of economic exclusion.

Trans*Festival is a wide-ranging, multifaceted action, forming part of the project “Transgender and gender diversity in culture” performed under Citizens for Democracy program financed by EOG Funds. But we would like to organise the festival on a larger scale than initially planned, so with this in mind we are attempting to raise additional funds.

Once the campaign closes, you will receive an email from us describing in details what the funds raised will be used for. For now we can provide an outline of the expenses which will allow us to organise the festival more effectively and raise visibility for our events.

Perks

For perks from 1€ (or more) to 15€ (or more) we offer you virtual gifts via e-mail. Among them - our trans*ZINE prepared for the festival.

For perks for 25€ (or more) and 60€ (or more) we offer you - apart from virtual gifts - trans*festival gadgets:
COTTON BAG...

... and MUG.

For the perk for 120€ you will also receive extraordinary gift - a signed giclee print (70cm x 50cm) of poster illustration by Polish artist Arobal. Check his website and Facebook profile. 


Useful links

Visit our website: http://www.kulturadlatolerancji.org/
Listen to Radio Trans*: http://tinyurl.com/m82osu4
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kulturadlatolerancji
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/cft_foundation

Would you like to know more about Culture for Tolerance Foundation and Trans*Festival? Write us an e-mail on transfestiwal@gmail.com!

Support

The project is performed under Citizens for Democracy program financed by EOG Funds.
Honorary Transonage: Trans-Fuzja Foundation
story_txt:
Get involved!


The Culture for
Tolerance Foundation invites you to help in creating Trans*Festival – the first event of this scale in Krakow, entirely
dedicated to transgender and gender diversities. 



"Trans*" in the name of the festival means all forms of gender identities and expressions which differ from unequivocally male or female, or those who are unequivocally male or female but differ from gender assaigned at birth. For a long time, 'T' has
been neglected by the LGBT ( lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender) rights movement in Poland, and we would like to help
fill that gap.
One
of the most discriminated groups in Polish society are people
of non-heterosexual
and non-heteronormative identities. Polish law does not sufficiently
defend
people from discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity. LGBTQ people face discriminatory behaviors in all fields of
social life: education, employment, everyday activities. 


According to report published by Campaign Against Homophobia in 2012 more than half of LGBT respondents revealed being subjected more than once to various forms of violence based on sexual orientation. Over
half of transgender people, who took part in the research, have
experienced physical or mental violence because of their transgender
identity (Campaign Against Homophobia, "Social situation of LGBT
people. Report from 2010-2011", Warsaw 2012). What is worth mentioning here, Poland has not introduced any law regulations which refer to hate speech or civil partnerships yet.  

It is our understanding that insufficient knowledge underlies social exclusion of transgender people in Poland. We believe that increasing awareness of gender diversity will contribute to more critical thinking about dominating gender norms and discourses. 


During the festival we would like to address yet another critical issue which is the cisnormativity of Polish LGBTQ community. We want to promote both awareness of unique needs of transgender people and solidarity between groups representing the broad spectrum of gender and sexual diversities here in Poland. We strive for visibility of binary and non-binary transgender identities in public discourse, art and culture. The issue of gender
non-conformism in public discourse is dominated by medical questions.
The motivation of the project is the need of building sustained
cooperation within transgender community in Poland and introducing
issues of transgenderism to potential trans* allies.



WE ARE
CREATING THIS FESTIVAL FOR TRANS*PEOPLE, ABOUT TRANS*PEOPLE, WITH
TRANS*PEOPLE. SUPPORT US!







What is
Trans*Festival all about?


We want to achieve
greater visibility for trans* issues in various ways, combining
theory with practice, and bringing academic knowledge face-to-face
with the life experiences of guests both from Poland and abroad. The
socially-engaged language of photography and film will be paired with
workshops for trans* people and their allies.


We have five EXHIBITIONS lined up;

Chicago photographer JESS T. DUGAN whose portraits of trans* people we will be showing at the Grey House Gallery on Cracovian Main Square. The opening will take place on the evening of Thursday 28th May.






A series of photographs by OLIVIER TOURON from Lille, depicting the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence. Notwithstanding their theatrical appearance, the organisation does charity work, helping people living with HIV/AIDS. The opening of the exhibition will take place during the Queer May Festival at the Barakah theatre; Trans*Festival will organise the grand closing.






RYSZARD KISIEL & KAROL RADZISZEWSKI. These
historical images are the result of a photo shoot by gay activist Ryszard Kisiel  and a
group of his friends in the mid-80s. In an apartment, playing around
with props, lipsticks, and costumes made spontaneously from leftover
scraps of material, they created their own parallel universe of camp,
separated from the realities of communist Poland. We will also be
displaying photographs by one of the most prominent Polish artist Karol Radziszewski documenting the making
of the film “Kisieland”.




IRENA KALICKA, a photographer from Krakow, will put on exhibition prepared especially for Trans*Festival at the F.A.I.T. Gallery.


AROBAL, the
renowned artist who designed the promotional poster for
Trans*Festival, will put on his first exhibition in Krakow especially
for our festival.

 
    We will be
showing 4 DOCUMENTARIES: “Trans-akcja” - the story of Anna
Grodzka, one of the most active ambassadors of LGBT rights in Polish Parliament and first openly transgender MP in Poland, who will be also the guest of Trans*Festival, “Magic Mirror” about French surrealist Claude Cahun, “My Prairie Home” about Canadian artist Rae Spoon…



... and the Japanese
film “Miwa: A Japanese Icon”.




If you want to exchange experiences and share knowledge of gender diversity in various political and sociocultural spaces join us, trans*activists, trans*artists and trans*allies, for the TRANS*CAFE – series of presentations, workshops and panel discussions addressing a broad spectrum of trans*topics. We're expecting guests from all over Europe!


You can find more details about Trans*Café on Facebook
or on our website.




What will your
money be used for?SUPPORTING TRAVELS OF TRANS*CAFE PARTICIPANTS


Your contributions
will help cover the costs of organising Trans*Café, a series of presentations,
discussions and workshops on trans* topics. The funds raised from
this crowdfunding campaign will allow us to reach an international
scale. We will be able to pay for travel for guests from abroad –
trans*activists, trans*artists and trans*allies – and purchase materials for our
workshops. We are inviting guests from all over the world, help us to
make our meeting with them a reality! Let’s talk about transgender

story:
Who are we?

We are Annika, Emma, and Aileen. We are a coach, an illustrator, and a writer. We come from Germany, Hungary, and Scotland. 

This project started with a shared realisation that we — all too often — forget how beautiful we really are and how many wonderful resources we have inside us, just waiting to be used. So we decided to join forces to create something special that would help us to reconnect with ourselves and our unique treasures.

  • Annika (driven by her coaching experience) designed questions and prompts that tap into just the right spot in your brain.
  • Emma fired up her creative imagination and channeled her child-like playfulness to paint images from her heart, inspired by Annika's questions.
  • And Aileen worked her word magic between the two, finding the best phrasing to touch your heart or make you laugh.

 

 

Along the way we realised that the cards also have the power to spark meaningful connections. This has become the central part of our broader mission. In fact, it's already been successful in our case: although they haven’t (yet) met in person, Emma and Aileen are already good friends as a result of sharing this project!

We want to use part of the funds we raise to go on a bit of a 'guerrilla' mission to spread the love in our local neighbourhoods, but our longer term ambition is to travel together to different parts of Europe, and use the cards to connect with the strangers we meet along the way.

Ultimately, we hope that — in your hands — these postcards will take on a life of their own.

 

 

What are the cards for + how can I use them?

These cards are a simple tool to spark connection, both with others and with yourself. They speak to the rational and emotional parts of your brain by using thought-provoking questions and playful images to inspire creative answers. 

We've developed two sets of fifteen cards: a kind set and a cheeky set. The images on both sets are the same, but the wording of the prompts is somewhat different! The kind cards are created with soft love and the cheeky ones with tough love. We hope both sets will inspire you and make you smile.

Here’s an example:

 

We’ve designed the cards with both your personal and professional life in mind, so feel free to use these sets as creatively as you like.

On your own you can...

  • use them as journal prompts
  • put them on your wall for inspiration on tap
  • travel with them and give one to someone you meet on the way
  • pop one into a stranger's mailbox and make them smile
  • take the conversation online and share a picture of it using our hashtag: #conversationsparkers 

 

With others you can...

  • send one to a friend via good, old snail mail
  • talk about a few with a friend over a mug of hot coffee
  • use one or two sets to play as a memory card game
  • shuffle two sets and spice up your next party by handing a card to each guest, then wait for some top quality mingling to begin as they search for their match
 

In a professional setting you can...

  • put them to use for a more meaningful team-building session 
  • decorate a corner of a shared work space and let them inspire some lovely tea-break chats
  • use them in a coaching or tutoring session to help your client think and reflect

 

 

Do you have your own ideas? We’d love to hear them!

Share them with us through our hashtag: #conversationsparkers. 

 

What we need + what you get

  • After months and months, our beautiful cards are all designed and ready to go! Now we need customers and money to go for an initial print run in time for the festive season. 
  • When you purchase a perk, it will arrive in your mailbox (or letterbox if you're in the UK!) — sent with love. 
  • If we reach our €1,500 goal, we would be able to print a few hundred extra cards for our 'guerrilla' mission, as well as delivering your perks.
  • If we go past our €1,500 goal, we’ll invest any extra funds into a European journey, with the aim of expanding the #conversationsparkers project by making and documenting connections with new people, using our cards.
  • We’d also really love to invest more of our time and skills to create new cards. 
  • Our favourite perk is The Conversation Sparker: this perk contains both sets of cards (30) that we developed with love.
  • If we don’t reach our €1,500 financial goal, we will just deliver the perks that you have purchased through this Indie Go Go campaign.

 

 

So welcome on board! Pick your perk or share our campaign.

We're glad to have you with us! 

 

Our shared mission: a letter from Annika 

Why the prompts and questions on the cards are so important for me, and what it has to do with my personal life story

 

 

 

 

 

PS. Some other ways to spread the love...

If you can't buy some cards this time round, then here's how else you can support the project:

  • Make some noise about our campaign by sharing it on social media. (Sharing is easy on Indiegogo, simply use the share buttons.)
  • Use the hashtag #conversationsparkers on Instagram or Facebook to join the discussion and show your support.

Our favourite perk is The Conversation Sparker: this perk contains both sets of cards (30) that we developed with love.

We're glad to have you with us!

PS. Some other ways to spread the love...
If you can't buy some cards this time round, then here's how else you can support the project:

Make some noise about our campaign by sharing it on social media. (Sharing is easy on Indiegogo, simply use the share buttons.)

story:
Who we are and why are we doing this?

Check out Livia Rita's music video of her first single SUNSCAR: https://youtu.be/s-952DLbqpY

Livia Rita is an independent musician, designer, composer, writer and artist who has set out to create a 4D explosive art project around her forthcoming debut album REWILD.
After first development at the Barbican, mentored by Lindsay Kemp and Lea Anderson, and a diversity of first performances, Livia Rita has launched her first single SUNSCAR by creating two extraordinary events in London; a warehouse Takeover at Ugly Duck and a Brexit Wedding. Livia Rita’s collaborative efforts in bringing over 50 young dancers, designers and creatives to dissect notions of love and create visions of uncertain futures are tireless.

Livia Rita is currently recording the next songs, realising further ideas for music videos and planning further performances and creative happenings. 

Relying on unstable funding bodies is difficult for independent artists and can hinder progression in work, quality of work and opportunities. 

Livia's creative projects are valuable in that they create spaces for creative and artistic collaboration outside of institutional structures. It is in these in between spaces where artists push boundaries and norms. Livia developed this work through previous public performances at known venues such as the Barbican, Hackney Showroom, the Yard, Ugly Duck, the Total Refreshment Centre and Rich Mix and hopes to continue this progression of REWILD along with your help. 

When Livia Rita performs REWILD in a more 'normal' performance setting, she works with the musician Tom McLuckie and a flexible number of dancers (Eleni Papaioannou, Marysol Martin Del Castillo and Taylor Callum Danson or more). Livia Rita has developed her own eclectic musical style drawing on a wide range of influences and genres spanning electronic, pop, experimental, classical and new wave styles. She subverts the listeners with each song, as wild, brutal textures meet vulnerable, otherworldly melodies in adventurous and emotional ways.

What will your money support?

Artists:

We will use a part of your donations to compensate dancers, sculptures, costume makers, fashion designers, graphic designers, musicians for their creative labour, and material for set and costumes that made up the single launch events this September.

Another part will go into into recording costs for REWILD such as mixing and mastering and into the next single's music video.

The last part will go into getting advice and guidance in promoting with the aim of building up an audience, fan base and a professional team. The goal is to play at a diversity of music festivals next year in the UK and Europe and to build up a sustainable career.

 

Gifts:

There are some lovely little gifts for you, but also feel free to drop us an email at rewildconcert (@) gmail (dot) com.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any effort to let people know about this project is a huge help! Please share this crowdfunder and let people know about this project!

Find us here:

www.liviarita.ch

Music video: http://bit.ly/2xeDOdR

https://www.facebook.com/liviaritamusic/

https://www.instagram.com/rewildmusicart/

https://www.instagram.com/liviarita/

Spotify: http://spoti.fi/2wT24QD


Meet the creative gang

Music, Singing, Costumes & direction: Livia Rita
Live music & additional composition: Tom Mc
Set: Jack Needell & Cat Attaway

Production: Anjali Prashar Savoie
Movement: Livia Rita devised with Eleni Papaioannou, MarySol Martin Del Castillo & dancers
Costume making: Livia Rita, Eleanor Tipler, Sarah Louise Renwick, Rike Zöllner, Sabrina Hasan
Make-up & Hair: Diandra Ferreira
Fashion performance choreography: Taylor Callum Danson

Dancers: Eleni Papaioannou, MarySol Martin Del Castillo, Fraser Buchanan, Alex Tinney, Danni Spooner, Ruby Portus, Kat Collings, Laura Lorenzi, Monique Jonas, Maria Jansson Lothe, Ena Lily Yamaguchi

Designers Fashion Performance: Livia Rita, Siân Naomi Dorman, Diana Burch , Chloe Miller, Auguste Greiciute, Charmaine Hung, Laura Albeck, Andrea Vargas 

Fashion Performers: Xanthe Wilson, Riccardo Tarocco, Sarah Maria Cook, Michelle Rose, Hannah Parsons, Hugh Hathaway, George HW

Thank you soooo much to Ugly Duck, your space has been a little paradise!

Thank you to Lones Muaka for the sound!
Thank you to Thomas Rosser for the poster photo!
Thank you to Cecilie Tchikai for the graphics!

Thank you to Fringehire for light!
Thank you to Orlando Callegaro for the photos.

Please share this crowdfunder and let people know about this project!Find us here:www.liviarita.chMusic video: http://bit.ly/2xeDOdRhttps://www.facebook.com/liviaritamusic/https://www.instagram.com/rewildmusicart/https://www.instagram.com/liviarita/Spotify: http://spoti.fi/2wT24QDMeet the creative gangMusic, Singing, Costumes & direction: Livia RitaLive music & additional composition: Tom McSet: Jack Needell & Cat AttawayProduction: Anjali Prashar SavoieMovement: Livia Rita devised with Eleni Papaioannou, MarySol Martin Del Castillo & dancersCostume making: Livia Rita, Eleanor Tipler, Sarah Louise Renwick, Rike Zöllner, Sabrina HasanMake-up & Hair: Diandra FerreiraFashion performance choreography: Taylor Callum DansonDancers: Eleni Papaioannou, MarySol Martin Del Castillo, Fraser Buchanan, Alex Tinney, Danni Spooner, Ruby Portus, Kat Collings, Laura Lorenzi, Monique Jonas, Maria Jansson Lothe, Ena Lily YamaguchiDesigners Fashion Performance: Livia Rita, Siân Naomi Dorman, Diana Burch , Chloe Miller, Auguste Greiciute, Charmaine Hung, Laura Albeck, Andrea Vargas Fashion Performers: Xanthe Wilson, Riccardo Tarocco, Sarah Maria Cook, Michelle Rose, Hannah Parsons, Hugh Hathaway, George HWThank you soooo much to Ugly Duck, your space has been a little paradise!Thank you to Lones Muaka for the sound!Thank you to Thomas Rosser for the poster photo!Thank you to Cecilie Tchikai for the graphics!Thank you to Fringehire for light!Thank you to Orlando Callegaro for the photos.

story:
Welcome Dragon Watchers & Cat Cuddlers!

I'm Jessica Feinberg, an illustrator who loves bringing creatures to life in detailed, vibrant paintings.   We've done a few "loot" kickstarter projects, but you keep asking for more! So I'm offering ten of my most popular dragons & cats on stickers, prints, art bags, pendants, bracelets, and keychains.

On indiegogo you can fully customize your reward set when you pledge! Just pick a pledge level to start with, then you may add-on as much loot as you want  during pledge check-out!  Pick a little or a lot! It's up to you! Specs for all the different loot items can be found below.

Prints

  • 5x7 or 8.5x11 inches
  • High color saturation & vibrancy
  • Satin textured, soft gloss finish
  • Lasting & Durable

New! T-Shirts!

New T-shirts with global fulfillment to save international backers huge shipping costs!

  • Black with vibrant full color artwork
  • Sizes S to 3XL
  • Fairly heavy 100% ring-spun cotton
  • Double-stitched neckline and sleeves for durability
  • Pre-shrunk for extra durability

Art Bags

Many rewards come with a 4x6 velvet drawstring bag with high quality heat-transferred artwork. These are great to hold all your loot, but if you want more you can add on as many as you like :)

Pendants

  • Metal with 25mm domed glass over artwork of your choice.
  • On black cord with adjustable catch.
  • Deluxe pendants feature a  silver crescent border with stars and a charms of your choice.
  • Simple pendants come in silver, bronze, or black colors.

Keychains

  • Metal with 25mm domed glass over artwork of your choice.
  • Durable chain & ring
  • You pick a silver key charm or dragon charm (charm designs vary slightly as they come to us in variety packs).

Bracelets

  • Bronze colored metal with brown PU Leather/wax cords and butterfly/infinity charms
  • OR silver colored metal with black PU Leather/wax cords and love/infinity charms
  • Metal with 25mm domed glass over artwork of your choice.

Stickers

  • 3x3.75 Inches
  • Rounded corners & vibrant colors!
  • Intended for indoor use (notebooks, laptops etc).

The Magnets

  • 2.7 x 1.7 Acrylic
  • Art of your choice

story:
The Paint Crate

Are you feeling bored, stuck at home, or at a loss of creative ideas?  Looking for a solution to creative self-care without spending a tonne of money on full size art supplies that you may not ever use again?  Are you wanting to experiment with new art media, but again, nervous to spend the money on full size materials without knowing how much you'll enjoy using them? 


I have a solution for you!!!  How would you like to receive a Paint Party Kit to your door?!

The other day, I was struck by a moment of inspiration.  I miss teaching my painting and art journaling classes in person.  And then...subscription boxes popped into my head.  I did some research.  Most art related subscription boxes send you miscellaneous supplies that you have to create your own project with, should you accept the challenge.  You may or may not fall in love with the full size supplies that you receive, and your project is 100% up to your creativity.

WHAT IF a box existed that included everything necessary for a single complete art project, AND you got to tune in to a virtual paint party (or the recording of the paint party) with guidance, just like attending a live class, but in the comfort and safety of your home?  Would you be interested? 

I am committed to creating an amazing service for you and the creatives you love!  To give you single servings of art supplies to experiment and play with, and lessons to support connection and inspiration. 

Preorder your first Paint Crate today!  

Thank you for your support!

I look forward to creating with you!
 

A Bit About Liz

Hello!  Thank you for supporting this initiative!  I am committed to supplying international creatives with samples of art supplies and lessons to spark their creativity from the safety and comfort of their homes.

I am a self-taught artist.  Following a head injury, I fell into depression.  I discovered art as a method of self-care and self-discovery.  It was therapeutic for me in many aspects.  And as I learned more, I recognized and experienced more benefits of a creative practice. 

And now, here I am...an entrepreneur and full time artist.  I am beginning the journey of weaning off depression medication (with medical support, guidance, and blessing).  And I am working towards supporting and helping others to create a meaningful creative self-care practice in order to fill their self-care cups, so that they may go out into the world with joy and share that joy and love with the people around them.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal:

  • $3000 CAD - enough to create the first 50 boxes, and gain bulk discounts so that I can pass along the savings to you!

There is A LOT more cost than I had realized...

  • small containers for the paint
  • seals for the containers
  • labels
  • brushes
  • canvas or other substrate for creating on
  • large containers of paint
  • packaging, including boxes, tape and tissue paper
  • shipping (I need a prototype to calculate shipping costs)
  • other art supplies for future boxes (I have a huge variety of ideas!)

IF my goal is not reached, that is ok!  I will order and deliver what is requested.  Some supplies have different prices for different quantities, so I have some flexibility.  Don't worry.  You will receive your products!

The Impact

  • There are SO many people at home right now, bored and lonely and low on money.  This initiative has so many amazing benefits to those people.  In practicing creative self-care, we improve our mental health, and can therefore give to others in a kinder, gentler, loving way.  You get to experiment with many different samples of art supplies and techniques to see what you like, and what speaks to you, BEFORE spending money on full size art supplies that you may find you don't resonate with.  As the boxes evolve, you will also get to experience different colours of media...I will start with the basics and move into my favourites first...so again if you have something you're curious about, we get to test it first!!!  And then you can decide if it brings you enough joy you'd like to invest in it!  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Not creative?  (I would argue that point as I believe that EVERYONE is creative...but it's ok!  You can still help!)  Share this campaign with your friends and family.  You never know who could benefit from receiving a parcel with beautiful art supplies and connecting with others on a virtual paint party!  
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart!

story:
By using repurposed scrap metal i can create a subversive and interactive experience designed so that participants can go inside the RUBBISH  and become enveloped under it by walking thru the 'mine shaft ' that supports the 60,000 lbs distributed above their heads.

Your donations are the support this project needs. It's also a way to spread the ecological message that RUBBISH can make in other countries next year. Im very proud that Burning Man has allowed me to debut it in august 2019 !

I will be gifting shirts for donations above $30, and original paintings for the $1,000 and over Angels.

Feel free to e mail direct with any questions. 

I've been told that I'm all over Google as a "Contemporary Artist".   I'm alive so that's High praise indeed !

story:
A Most Accidental Beginning

In July of 2017, I stumbled into the world of candle making because of an article I read at the barbershop about a local company.  All I was interested in was making something special for my Mom's birthday, as well as for my special someone, so I inquired. Within a month, I was apprenticing for the founder of said candle company, and shortly after, was encouraged to come up with my own line. A holiday candle I created all on my own had an initial run of 100, which sold out within two weeks.

Sadly, it was too good to be true. In early 2018, it became apparent I wasn't getting paid what I was owed or receiving proper credit for what I'd created. Worst of all, I had convinced friends and family to buy from this company, and now I felt like a chump. Cheated, stolen from, and humiliated, I took my wax and went home. Until I realized: FORGET THAT MESS.

Accidentally, I had found a unique skill that could become a going concern. Something to make and be proud of; and a way to be creative and show people the world as I feel it through our most powerful sense - smell. I have one sensitive schnoz. I have a passion for music & literature. And I have one big crazy, sentimental, geeky heart. By combining all these and putting aside the fear I've always had in asking for what I want, I'm beyond excited to welcome you to the world of STRANGE GENT CANDLE CO.

I'm asking for $3,000 to help me get this baby up and running. I feel confident in saying that those of you reading this who have gotten the candles I've made have been big fans of my work. (And not just because they were free!) So now I'm asking, can I get your help? Raising this money will help ease my financial burden and keep me from accruing more debt.

What I Need To Make The Donuts (Candles)

  Initial Batch of High Grade Organic Oils (the smelly stuff!):  ~$800

  Initial Batch of High Grade Soy Wax (approximately 200 lbs): ~$200

  Initial Candle-Making Hardware (pitchers, burners, wicks, extension cords, etc.): ~$450

  Labels, stickers, boxes, vessels, final design logo: ~$300

  Website domain purchase,contract, and online store set up: $150

  Stamps.Com Set up and account: TBD

  Rental of work space: ~$150/per month

And so on. I'm asking for a little over what I need initially so I can have some reserve, as supplies go quickly. I have to spend money to make money, and as many of you know, that's not always easy. So in my asking you for help, I've got some really amazing perks to hopefully entice you to help this strange gentleman out. Any and every little bit will help.

Your Impact And My Promise

My candles are made from 100% soy wax, which is better for the environment than beeswax.  I know there are a plethora of candles already out there, but I feel that with my nose, know how, work ethic, good taste, and unique sensibility, I won't fail. As you can see from the pics of my prototypes, these 8oz beauties look pretty darn cool, with an understated, timeless appeal, and burn for up to 40-50 hours, depending on how you care for them.

Even if I don't reach my entire goal, any funding I do get will help, regardless. The good thing about learning from someone (no matter the end result) already in the business, is that I know retailers and wholesalers who would be interested in what I have to offer and are eager to work with me, specifically. I know how to handle projects like this because I've successfully produced plays in both NYC and LA, and, in this endeavor, I'm only responsible for myself and the product. Every project I've ever produced has come in under-budget, and I take people's belief in me seriously.

It's also important for me to keep prices low. Candles aren't a necessity, but they sure can make a difference in your state of mind, as I've learned. By raising this money, it will help me offset market costs, and keep things reasonable for consumers. Some candles cost $2 and some cost $200. I truly believe that you pay for what you get, but $200 is totes crae, bae. I want Strange Gent to be for everybody.

A Challenge For Any Gent

I can't lie. Starting any business, big or small, is a huge risk. But I know two things:

1. I make really great candles and have a unique personality that I feel could stand out and be successful.

2. I wouldn't be able to look at myself in the mirror if I let myself quit just because someone stole my work and cheated me out of my money, and more importantly, proper credit.

Other Ways You Can Help A Strange Gent Out

Even  if you can't help monetarily, you can support by spreading the word to others who like stuff that smells good. Real good. I'm talking real, real, REAL good.

Spread the word on Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Snapchat, etc.

Follow my progress by following and re-tweeting me on Twitter. (@StrangeGentCC)

Follow along visually on Instragram (@StrangeGentCandles)

I quit facebook (because it's breaks your heart), but I intend to set up a page for SG soon!

My website, strangegentcandles.com, will be live November 1st.

 

THANK YOU.

With gratitude & love,

Travis York

story:
MY FIRST MURAL IN THE MISSION DISTRICT IS NOW 16 YRS OLD

                            Bryant and 20th street in San Francisco

HELP ME UPDATE THIS MURAL

I would like to update the mural to better connect with the current political landscape of San Francisco. The new proposed mural entitled "The Disruption," speaks to issues  of police brutality, gentrification, the income gap, and social justice. 

PROJECT LEAD

               

My name is Sirron Norris and I’ve been an artist in San Francisco for 19 years – throughout that time, I’ve had the honor of creating murals throughout the city, most of which are in the Mission district.  

COMMUNITY IMPACT 

In order to ensure the mural has an eye towards equity, it’s important to hire local students and artists to help paint the mural. It’s an opportunity to support local youth financially and promote skill building. A large majority of my murals have used this same strategy of collaboration with local artists and supporting local aspiring artists and students.  

The best demonstration of this is located at the corner of Bryant and 18th.

The Calumet building: Bryant and 18th in the Mission district

PROJECT BUDGET

I am requesting $5000 to pay for project lead's time, artist stipends, and art supplies. The duration of the mural will take three weeks to start this September 2016. 

THE PERKS

Get a signed 18"/24"poster or high quality print of the new mural, mailed to your home. 

SERIOUSLY

Your contribution either financial or simply by spreading the word about this campaign will serve as invaluable support towards supporting our local community.  

Together, we have an opportunity to make a statement by supporting this campaign. 

In Community Spirit,

story:
Short Summary

My work is impacted by the connections and the relationships sustained from peoples all over the globe. “Home is where the heart is”, and I am constantly searching for the idyllic notion of what it that means to different peoples.  I have always admired the art of a good story and my mission is to share those stories. 

During my residency with the GOAT COLLECTIVE, I will need to reflect my work in a final public exhibition. I will be working at the residency August 24th through September 4th and updating the events on my website for donors to see.  The close of this project will be an installation that emulates the living conditions and personal environment of refugee persons. I anticipate meeting and creating portrait pieces of resettled refugees living in Germany. I would like to exchange experiences, drawings, and personal artifacts that reveal the intimate history of the memories associated with their object.  This installation will be a collection of these objects and recorded accounts allowing viewers to connect and gain insight into the complicated ordeal confronted by the displaced. All drawings are to be gifted to these contributors after the exhibition.

In the second portion of the project, I plan on integrating print making with stop motion animation techniques to relate stories of attitudes towards refugees. The goal is to visit with activists and organizers as well as directly volunteering in communities with asylum centers in both Munich and Berlin.

What We Need & What You Get

The monies earned in this campaign will offset the costs of art and building materials, travel expenses, shipping and insurance, production/construction, and all other fees related to the project.

 No donation is too big or too small. I would like to provide an incentive to everyone that donates!

$5 donations will receive 3"x 3" sticker with the Unknown Salts logo.

$25 or more: Receive a handmade monoprint of the "Damascus Series". Each print is painted using a brayer technique, and over layed with a hand drawn tile design. Prints are 10" x 12"

$50 or more: Receive a tshirt with the Unknown Salts Logo. Shirts are white and available in Sm, Med, and Large. Please be sure to mention your size when donating.

For contributions over $100  you will receive a sticker, t-shirt, and 16" x 20" monoprint of the "Damascus Series" pieces. All works are individually created on acid free Rives BFK cotton quality paper.

The Impact

Your contributions make all the difference! Its hard to do anything alone with limited resources, but each donation brings me a step further to developing relationships with peoples around the globe.  As an artist, I believe it is my duty to share my talents with communities. Civilizations have been built through creative endeavors, and the social construct is always in flux. Art has had a crucial role in society and is becoming less and less a priority with institutions. Private initiatives still sustain, but are always in need of help from individuals.

Risks & Challenges

One of the greatest challenges regarding this project is being able to create lasting connections. I understand that I am asking questions that may be difficult to discuss.  However, the strengths in this project are those based on communication, respect for cultural nuances, and the acceptance of one another. I firmly believe that through acts of kindness,  the constructs of trust will follow. It is not only the mission to create a visual component, but to integrate myself into the community by volunteering where I am necessary, and developing the project with those that are interested.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would like to thank each and every one of you for taking the time to look at my latest endeavor. All donations are appreciated! Feel free to pass this along and share with others!

 

Unknown Salts is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Unknown Salts must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt: Short SummaryMy work is impacted by the connections and the relationships sustained from peoples all over the globe. “Home is where the heart is”, and I am constantly searching for the idyllic notion of what it that means to different peoples.  I have always admired the art of a good story and my mission is to share those stories. During my residency with the GOAT COLLECTIVE, I will need to reflect my work in a final public exhibition. I will be working at the residency August 24th through September 4th and updating the events on my website for donors to see.  The close of this project will be an installation that emulates the living conditions and personal environment of refugee persons. I anticipate meeting and creating portrait pieces of resettled refugees living in Germany. I would like to exchange experiences, drawings, and personal artifacts that reveal the intimate history of the memories associated with their object.  This installation will be a collection of these objects and recorded accounts allowing viewers to connect and gain insight into the complicated ordeal confronted by the displaced. All drawings are to be gifted to these contributors after the exhibition.In the second portion of the project, I plan on integrating print making with stop motion animation techniques to relate stories of attitudes towards refugees. The goal is to visit with activists and organizers as well as directly volunteering in communities with asylum centers in both Munich and Berlin.What We Need & What You GetThe monies earned in this campaign will offset the costs of art and building materials, travel expenses, shipping and insurance, production/construction, and all other fees related to the project. No donation is too big or too small. story:
The Uncomparable Bennie Allain and his artistic attempts presents:
What a Bunch of Cards!

(view the cards! just go to the gallery at the top of the page)

This August, I'll set out on a hitchhiking trip across Canada to participate in a residency in Vancouver, BC and I want things to get weird.  I'll be documenting my trip with short videos, photocollages and sketches, which will be completed in the fall during my residency.  I'm bringing a deck of cards and a crib-board which I'll use to annoy strangers but hopefully talk to them and maybe even learn some of the stories about wherever I may find myself. As my first fundraiser, I'm offering decks of cards I made this past winter. To view them, just go to the gallery at the top of the page.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise any amount I can to assist me in getting from Prince Edward Island to Vancouver, BC. I plan to hitchhike as much as I can, but will need to purchase food, pay for lodging, buy art supplies, and make more decks o' cards which I'll be using as extravagant thankyoucards to the kind folks who lodge me, give me rides, share their stories and fill my belly. Also I'll need to pay my rent in the meantime, which is low, but exists nonetheless. Finally, the residency offers me lodging for five days and a space to work for a month or so, so i'll need to procure and pay for a room the remainder of the month, as well as all my living expenses.

You can help me ALOT by contributing anything you can.  Or TELLING YOUR FRIENDS especially those who may have an addiction to poker (I would not advise using this deck for anything high stakes - they're all hand-cut and slightly different dimensions. There are two or three cards whose identities are AMBIGUOUS AT BEST.)

In return, the following could be yours:

- hand-cut prints of the 52 drawings I made this past winter, with reproduced linoleum-cut backs, complete with the box I designed, a write-up on the history of the project and all alternate titles for each card
- single cards with linoleum-printed backs
- 8 x 10" signed prints of each individual cards 
-2x3" ORIGINAL drawings
-one in five orders shipped will have a 8x10 ORIGINAL drawing included

This whole idea - not just this project - is important

It's hard to get a grant for hitchhiking across the country to make an ambiguous body of work. It's also nice to be supported by real people who see something they like in your work rather than relying on a government that very very clearly doesn't give a care about the arts. You are playing a vital role in the continuation of arts in this country by supporting, in any way, emerging artists.

It's not only about funds. I'd love to hear any suggestions on where to go while on my trip. It would be a huge help if you shared this with anyone who may be interested. 

You must really be something.
