After the event has finished, proceeds will be split, we will retire to bed, perhaps some breakfast the following morning and some proper goodbyes to send us off to the next destination. 
We will be stopping off in the following locations beginning April 26th 2014:Vista, CA | Los Angeles, CA | Death Valley, CA | Flagstaff, AZ | Albuquerque, NM | Austin, TX | New Orleans, LA | Savannah, GA | Wilmington, NC | Outerbanks, NC | Virginia Beach, VA | Richmond, VA | Washington, D.C | Philadelphia, Pennsylvania | Brooklyn, New York | Chicago, Illinois | Coeur D'alene, ID | My team and I will be transforming nail beds into "canvas" to showcase art during a gallery opening and the weeks following. A portion of the proceeds from our contribution to the event will be split between the featured artist, and the local artist community. We will be working on the road to help artists better organize their event, and work harmoniously with their venue provider and their community.Paradise is a two lane black-top away, and we can't wait to meet you there...Please help fund the dream that keeps on giving.If you're strapped for cash, ANYTHING would help...!! Recommendations of where to camp, cool must see's along the way, events relating to our project, trust worthy mechanic friends along our route that will help fix our car if it breaks down, your Auntie who makes an amazing portuguese bean soup, mix cd's (zip files), friends to meet, artists/art district recommendations that would care to be apart of this project, bands to see, words of encouragement...xoxo See yah soon!Links:Website: 78westcollectiveco.comInstagram: 78westcollectiveE-mail: 78westcollective@gmail.comIT'S NOT TOO LATE TO REQUEST US TO PLAN AN EVENT IN YOUR CITY!! Artists, and venues who wish to be apart of our nationwide effort to strengthen the artist community, please contact me at the following e-mail as soon as possible: 78westcollective@gmail.com

story:
My dearest friends, family and lovely strangers (future friends!),
 
I was accepted to the graduate program at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts for this coming fall and am delighted with the opportunity to attend!   I have long considered the opportunity to teach new and aspiring artists as one of my greatest hopes for the future, and to do this, I need to expand my own practice and go to graduate school.


I am confident that I have found the right school to expand and nurture my body of work.
The one drawback for me at the moment is the financial responsibility inherent in throwing myself back into school debts and uprooting myself to a new state.  Although PAFA's fees and tuition are comparable to other programs, it is a small school, and they are not able to offer as much relief as larger state schools.


It is my greatest wish to attend PAFA and have the opportunity to profit from the wide range of successful artists that are teaching therein, and hope I will be able to study under Sidney Goodman before he retires and take advantage of Vincent Desiderio's talks and studio visits.



I am coming to you for help to make my dream come true!


In return for your help, I am offering some really great gifts: I will be printing up greeting cards on lovely, archival paper as well as small digital prints of some of my best and most recent drawings and paintings to share with you!  I will also be making lovely handmade sketchbooks and albums with vintage or specialty covers and gorgeous, smooth artist quality papers. I am also offering some original, editioned etchings and lithographs I completed at Pratt as well as my contemporary work, which you can either chose from my website or come for a private studio visit where I will bake you a lovely cake and we can have tea and chat!  Fun!

 

Thank you all so much for taking the time out to look at my project!  I appreciate any pledge that you would be willing to give and hope you will take the time out to forward this page to your friends.


My very best,
Daria Souvorova

 


Find out more about my work:

-You can check out my work on my website: www.DariaSouvorovaArt.com
-You can also see some of the other cool stuff I can make on my blog, if you have any special requests you can shoot me an email and we can work something out: www.SweetDarias.blogspot.com
-Email me at: DariaSouvorova@gmail.com

story:
"A poetry slam is a competition at which poets read or recite original work. These performances are then judged on a numeric scale by previously selected members of the audience."-Wikipedia

 

There are those who believe life, history and many of the traditions we adhere to today were passed down through spoken word. We still hold the art of speaking Truth in high regard. For the last 11 years the Fort Worth National Poetry Team has brought the magic of spoken word into the lives of thousands of people across North America. This summer the poets Fort Worth are taking their spoken word spectacle on the road as they travel throughout the nation leaving no stage un-turned! All funds will go towards the tour costs of lodging and transportation. The tour will begin in North Texas dancing across the Lone Star State and culminating in the National Poetry Slam Championship Competition in Charlotte, North Carolina. All funds will go towards the costs of lodging and transportation.

We want desperately to share the gift and joy of Poetry with you. Help Us with this project and bring poetry to life.

story:
Project Background

Warnayaka Art represents nationally and internationally acclaimed painters (e.g. Lily Nungarrayi Hargraves, Judy Napangardi Martin, Rosie Napurrurla Tasman and many more). Our new project is building on this impressive artistic legacy by providing a platform for a new generation of talented, young artists, many of whom are seeking new forms of expression in new media technologies.

YAMA, the Warlpiri word for 'reflection' or 'mirror', is an experimental project combining elements of new media, digital art, and installation with traditional indigenous artforms of song, ceremonial dance, and Jukurrpa (dreaming) painting.

YAMA, is a collaboration between Warnayaka Art Centre (especially younger artists like Isaiah Jungarrayi Lewis, Neil Jupurrurla Cooke, Sharon Nampijinpa Anderson, and Rebecca Napanangka Farrell), the Lajamanu community, and key external collaborating artists, like German-based, Australian artist Gretta Louw. The project will result in a large-scale multimedia installation, along with a new body of digital, video, and printed works that will be exhibited throughout Australia and overseas.

The project has already received partial sponsorship from the highly competitive Australia Council Indigenous Experimental Art Forms fund - but we need your help to raise the additional funding we need to fulfill the project's potential to be a truly landmark work in indigenous Australian art, as well as digital and new media art worldwide.

The Specifics

In this initial round of fundraising, we need to raise funds to send the two lead Lajamanu artists - Isaiah Jungarrayi Lewis and Neil Jupurrurla Cooke - on their first trip overseas! The artists, with art centre Manager Louisa Erglis, are heading to Germany for a two-week intensive video and digital art workshop with multimedia artist, Gretta Louw. The trip will include visits to new media and video exhibitions, meetings with industry contacts, and of course lots of work with video cameras and video editing suites!
 
In return for your support, we are offering lots of great incentives - you can have your own piece of Lajamanu art for an affordable price, or pick up Warnayaka's recently released book and DVD 'Warnayaka Art Centre: Life in the Digital Desert' (the art centre's first publication!).
 
Every little bit helps, and we - and all the artists at Warnayaka Art Centre - appreciate not only your contributions but also your sharing our campaign with your networks.
 
Should we raise more than the stated target (fingers crossed!), the money will go towards much needed additional, on-site media and technology training opportunities for Lajamanu artists, and purchasing necessary audiovisual equipment for the art centre. We want the new generation of indigenous artists to have the skills and equipment they need to be able to express their traditional and contemporary stories in any medium they choose, and to lead the new charge of indigenous, digital art!

story:
About the "Free to Form" Project

Hi! I'm Lex Casciato - the artist and creator behind the "Free to Form" Project. The "Free to Form" Project consists of eight unique, mixed-media mannequins each displaying a different stage in which an exploited victim experiences through their trafficking. By combining these eight mannequins into one grouped exhibit, my mission is to showcase the effects that human trafficking has on its victims, while also:

             - educating our society on and spreading awareness of sex trafficking, CSEC                       (commercial sexual exploitation of children), and the manifestation of                            trauma from abuse

             - sharing with our world solutions on how to abolish trafficking and how we                         can help victims of abuse and trauma

             - giving a voice to the voiceless by bringing to light an under-served epidemic                       and the victims it creates

  • This campaign is important to me, because I believe that every human was created to be free. As long as there are people enslaved and exploited, we have a responsibility to help free others. 
  • As a contributor to this project, you will be spreading awareness of sex trafficking on our own local streets, helping sexually exploited youth by giving them a voice and a donation, and aiding in trafficking-prevention -- all with the overarching goal of us working as a community to abolish trafficking altogether.

What Does "Free to Form" Mean?

I started using the phrase “Free to Form” to represent a positive take on the concept of non-conformity — but avoiding “non” and “anti.”  “Free to Form” implies that we are all created equal, and we were created to be free — slaves to no one and to nothing, free from pain, fear, addictions, etc. We also have the freedom to form groups and communities together, to form theories, ideas, thoughts, and concepts, and to form into our unique selves. Human trafficking victims lose this freedom, which is why it is so important that we continue to shed light on this wide-ranging problem.

What Your Contributions Mean

Over the past 15 months, I've completed two of the eight mannequins in the series, with others in progress. The candy-coated mannequin and mosaiced mirror mannequin have cost approximately $500. Your contributions will allow me to finish the remaining six in the series and will be primarily used for the following:

  • The bulk of the $1,250 in contributions will be used for material costs for the remaining six mannequins in the series. It's amazing how quickly mannequins, hot glue, resin, glass, grout, metal bits n' bobs, paint, and such add up! 
  • Additionally, your contributions will assist with marketing materials to promote the series and transportation costs to physically get these mannequins into galleries where more and more people will be able to experience the installation and the message will get disseminated further and further.
  • The remaining costs will be to satisfy rewards and for Indiegogo fees.
  • In the circumstance that the full goal is not reached, I will complete what I can of the mannequin series. This final mannequins will be presented at this year's GirlFestNW - a concert designed to spotlight female musician and artists - on September 27th.

What You Get in Return

I am SO stoked to offer some amazing rewards for your donations!!! As a contributor, you are helping spread awareness of sex trafficking on our own, local streets and helping sexually exploited youth by giving them a voice. In addition: 

  • Every donor gets their name listed in the "Free to Form" brochure which will be handed out as part of the showcase as well as social media shout-outs!
  • Additional perks range from getting a special "Mad-Lib" style email to a Health and Wellness consultation from a professional Master Herbalist to a one-of-a-kind stained glass mannequin that can be lit from behind to add some glowing vibes to your life! 
  • As an additional perk, donors get the satisfaction knowing that 10% of proceeds will be donated to the Sexual Assault Resource Center (SARC) - a non-profit helping to fight CSEC (for more info: http://sarcoregon.org/)
  • The rewards share the "Free to Form" theme which represents that all individuals ought to experience freedom. These perks offer inspiration, beauty, healing, and gratitude that are designed to contribute to your joy, vitality, and motivation in life!

The Impact

"Free to Form" has already been asked to premiere at this year's GirlFestNW in Portland, OR on September 27th, 2015. This showcase will open up conversation around the subjects of sex trafficking, CSEC, abuse, and trauma. The overall goal is to educate our communities and spread awareness in order to learn how to help victims and create measures, systems, and support networks in our cities and globe to eventually abolish this modern form of slavery.
  • If fully funded, there will be eight mannequins in this series. The eight mannequins in the series focus on different stages in the sex trafficking process for the victim. Each mannequin will be comprised of a different art medium. These mediums are:

             1. Candy - representing the viewing of a victim as a pleasure object 

                  * completed*


             2. Mutilated Dollars - depicting payment for a victim's body for another's                          satisfaction * in progress *


             3. Paint - showing the different abuses a sexual assault and/or trafficked                            victim experiences * in progress *


             4. Broken Mirrors - expressing the fracturing of one's identity and psyche as                    a result of continual trauma and abuse * completed *


             5. Metal - depicting the hardened exterior one develops to protect oneself                          from further abuse and trauma * in progress *


             6. Fabric/Embroidery - representing assembling our brokenness into                                   something stronger and more beautiful * in pre-production *


             7. Moss/Plants - representing growth, healing, rejuvenation * in progress *


             8.  Stained Glass - exhibiting that while we all have our own stains, the light                       (the good) can still shine through us * in progress *

Risks & Challenges

So far, some of the challenges I have faced are hot glue gun burns and my hamster trying to eat my candy mannequin. But the real challenges are:


1) Finding affordable ways to complete this project:

I have completed two of the eight mannequins, already spending $500 of my own non-profit job money, so the major challenge I face is coming up with the financing to complete the other six mannequins in the series.


2) Learning how to use new mediums:

I have never worked with moss/plants, metal, and candy in an art project, so each mannequin I work on has its own set of unique challenges. For example, you need a different type of glue for metal than you do for glue.


3) Getting its message disseminated through showcases:

I have already developed a plan for showcasing my "Free to Form" series once all eight are completed. The first showcase will be at this year's GirlFestNW event in Portland, OR. I have also been in discussions with other resources to display the finished line of mannequins.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to contribute financially, there are still amazing ways you can get involved:

  • Share my project using Indiegogo's share tools and on social media! The more people who know, the merrier! I'm trying to spread a powerful message out into the world about this topic, and the more people who share, the more people will be informed.
  • Donate your old clothes to a local non-profit or shelter working with sexually exploited or homeless youth and/or adults or your local abuse resource center. These places are also in constant need for new underwear, bras, and socks, due to clothing items being taken as evidence in sexual assault cases. Donating gift cards to such facilities is also hugely helpful for the victims of exploitation, abuse, and trauma.
  • Volunteer :) Money helps, but giving your valuable time is life changing! Find something you're passionate about or think about the problem that bothers you the most, and volunteer to help make a difference. Your voice, your time, and your actions are powerful!!
  • Donate materials or your "mutilated dollar" as materials to this project :) Message me on my Facebook page for more info (link below)
  • Follow me to stay up to date with this project: 

            Blog: http://lexcasciato.wordpress.com
            Instagram: http://instagram.com/lexcasciato
            Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/lex.casciato
            Twitter: http://twitter.com/lexcasciato/

  • Read about the issue. Some great resources are:

             The Polaris Project: http://www.polarisproject.org

             Do Something: http://www.dosomething.org

             International Justice Mission: http://ijm.org/ 

             SARC: http://www.sarcoregon.org

             Abolition Now: http://www.abolitionnow.com

story:
Hello 

My name is Raul Tumba. I´m a digital artist.

story:
WHAT I DISCOVERED:

Upon reflecting this Creative block with one of my mentors, she asked, " What was the relationship I had with my father when it came to my creative process?" It dawned on me that everything I did before his death was for his approval. 

It became evident in that moment in order for me to continue my growth as a MAN and challenge myself as an ARTIST, that I would have to LET GO! 

MY DESCION:

I’ve decided to give myself a challenge for the month starting on the day of  his passing,..letting go of all of my Art pieces and sharing the most prized ones in order to create a new body of work excited to come through. I have two multi-media projects both dealing with kids and their interactivity with adults.

                                                           PROJECTS 


1.) VEENICE  is an animated short film and interactive story book about and old saying my grandmother said, everytime her grandchildren mis-behaved, "IT'S NICE TO BE IMPORTANT but IT'S MORE IMPORTANT TO BE NICE". This interactive tale is a cross between MADELINE and CURIOUS GEORGE.  Vee is the Curious Magical little village boy, who looses his front teeth and saves his village with his Magical tears of LOVE when he discovers he's unable to pronounce the phrase "BE NICE". His tears floods the village, creating one of the most romantic cities known today, Venice.

The animation style is represented in the Gallery 2 link above, Created by Justin Kowalec

2.)  RAINBOW  is a coming of age animated short, about an unsual looking dog' name rainbow and his first day at school.  Rainbow has a gigantic rainbow spot on his belly among other oddities, one floppy ear vs one pointed one, patches of wiry fur vs patches of smooth.  He is one unique character! When Rainbow gets excited his rainbow glows. Similiar to that of Rudolph the red nose reindeer ,he's challenged with being different until his difference saves the day. 

The animation style is represented in the Gallery 2 link above.  Created by Justin Kowalec

REASONS OF WHY NOW?

Looking back as an adult, I realized everything that's made me the person that I am was once frowned upon in my youth. My sensitivity to plants and people, my effeminate mannerism, my intense curiosity about everything and even my flamboyant ability to dance, all of which has shaped me as an Artist.

I don't have any kids of my own yet, but I often times feel so connected to their journey. I can only imagine what you as a parent might feel wanting nothing more than to protect your prize treasure ( your children) from the outside world.  

Through these short films and interactive story telling, I am creating a world for eveyone to see the otherside, hoping the bullies will think twice and the unique creatures, our children, won't have to think at all... only be themselves. 

There is no safe way to protect someone but the one way that I know is through sharing by storytelling...Thank you for helping me bring these stories to life and to the children and Adult-children around us.


LIST OF PERKS with IMAGES of ART POSTERS


As I discover more of my passion as an ARTIST, I realize that my biggest goal is to find safe ways for kids to explore who they are before the outside world dictates that for them.


WHAT CAN YOU DO?

I am asking you my peers to endorse me in a sort of CROWD FUNDING – SOUL FOUNDING project. 

1.) You can donate! No sum is too small or too large for me to be grateful for.

2.) You can SHARE this link to any and everyone who you might know have been creatively blocked because of a death, a lost dream, or just plain LAZY! LOL!

3.) You can donate a 125.00 donation for a 12x16 signed print to a high school, synagogue or community center that fosters and endorses healing of Self through Art expression.

4.) You can donate and enjoy one of my creative pieces in your home. 

5.) OR you can simply call me up and encourage me to continue this most exciting journey that I am on that sometimes scares and thrills me all at once. Whatever you do, please keep me in your thoughts. Thanks..


MY CREATIVE GOAL

 My creative goal is 65,000 of which will go to fund my two multi-media projects, designed to keep children inquisitive about question without having to be right.

 DREAMS are real and I’m going to start today by re-investing in that dream and I hope that you will join me and others in this process. 

My grandmother once said, “Lonnie, it’s impossible to be lost, you just have to look around where you are, adjust your focus, give yourself a new destination, and start walking…” I’m walking grandma, I’m walking… And thank you to all those who are listening…

LIST OF PERKS with IMAGES of ART

story:
Needle Prick Project - Rio Grande Valley

Discussions about what it means to be HIV positive today affect us all.  The Needle Prick Project is a nationwide editorial campaign written to elicit a candid and open conversation on what it means to be HIV positive today.  

Currently, the Rio Grande Valley is one of the highest areas of new infections, natiionwide.  On June 27, 2013, KGBT Action 4 News reported that one new HIV diagnosis is reported every day in the Valley.   It is the goal of this campaign to reduce the stigma and intiate conversations about what it means to be, know, or love someone with HIV.

This event will raise funds for the Needle Prick Project and its fundraising beneificary Camp Starlight, which provides a safe, caring and fun summer camp experience for children whose lives are affected by HIV/AIDS.

JOIN US AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE

DATE: Wednesday, July 24, 2013

LOCATION:  The Reese, 201 S. 1st Street, Harlingen, TX 78550

TIME: 5:00 - 7:00 PM

On Wednesday, July 24th at Harlingen's hisitorically renovated The Reese buliding in downtown Harlingen you can come by for an opportunity to have your own professional Needle Prick Project photograph taken by NPP founder Tyler Curry.  And, stay with us for a bit of discussion with Tyler who is also a regular correspndant to The Huffington Post, HuffPost Live, and a contributor to The Advocate.

Only 30 limited Needle Prick Project photographs will be pre-sold online for $25 each.   Just like in the promo video, you and your friends/family (up to four people) may pose in a photograph that Tyler himself will expertly refresh and make available to you. 

After your purchase of a photo shoot by contributing here online, you will get an email with information on how to prepare for your big photoshoot!

And while you are waiting for your turn before the camera, Colletti's restaurant will have its bar and menu available for you to purchase food and drinks while socializing.

BE A PART OF PROGRESS AND DISCUSSION

With your help as a participant or contributor to this event, you are telling everyone you know that you stand up to fight HIV stigma and want to contribute to positive discussions about health, wellness, and community.

Even if you don't want a photograph, you can still contribute!  If you want to give more, accompany the event as a co-sponsor, or simply make a contribution in a greater amount - you can!

All contributions raised will go to the Needle Prick Project and Camp Starlight.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Share this campaign by email and on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms.

Come by at the event and socialize, meet and greet, and say hello!

This event is sponsored by The Roddy de la Garza Real Estate Group.

story:
Shapeshifters is Expanded Cinema

Shapeshifters Cinema highlights the work of experimental artists working in “expanded cinema,” a term that encompasses a wide range of exploratory practices that transgress the boundaries separating media. All programs in the Shapeshifters series feature a live presentation of (or about) the moving image with music or sound art and other live performative elements. Some part of the presented work is expected to be created live, with a certain element of improvisation. This might include a score or sound track created live from composed or found material, the manipulation of imagery as it is projected, live interaction with audio or visuals or any number of other possible actions. In this way, each Shapeshifters presentation is a unique experience, for both artist and audience.

About the Series

Shapeshifters programs are presented free of charge on the second Sunday evening of every month at the Temescal Art Center in North Oakland. The series is curated and administered by Gilbert Guerrero and Kathleen Quillian, both long time participants in the Bay Area media arts community with close ties to Artists’ Television Access, San Francisco Cinematheque, the Illuminated Corridor and Temescal Street Cinema.

Since we started in May of 2012, Shapeshifters has presented 12 programs by local, notable artists working in the field, including the cinepimps (featuring filmmakers Alfonso Alvarez and Keith Arnold with musicians Suki O’Kane and Wayne Grim), filmmaker Paul Clipson with musician Evan Caminiti, animator/musician Jeremy Rourke, filmmaker Kerry Laitala with musician/filmmaker John Davis and collaborator Neal Johnson, video-poet Tommy Becker, filmmaker Sylvia Schedelbauer, filmmaker/musician John Davis with sound artist/musician Josh Churchill, video/performance artist Jen Cohen with sound/performance artist Guillermo Galindo, analog media artist Lori Varga & filmmaker Paul Baker, multimedia artist Jim Haynes, multi-dimensional provacateur Josh Kit Clayton and film/sound makers Beige. And we have many more superb artists lined up to present over the coming months. Find out more about past and future shows on our web site: http://shapeshifterscinema.com/

How Your Contribution Will Help

Shapeshifters has been largely a self-funded project (meaning, most expenses are paid out of our own pockets) with the help of small donations given here and there. We've come to recognize that this does not shake out to be a very sustainable business model. Each show costs us about $200 to put on--not a lot, but more than we can afford every month as working artists ourselves. So we are turning to our community for help!

The majority of funds raised in this campaign will go toward stipends for the artists who present in the series because we believe all artists should be paid for what they do. The rest of the funds will go toward rental of the Temescal Art Center and miscellaneous supplies needed to keep the show running. 

Thank you!

Thank you for supporting Shapeshifters Cinema! We look forward to continuing the series to highlight the many artists working in this dynamic and evolving field. With your support we can keep it going. 

We have a bunch of fun, hand made gifts to give you in return for your generous donation including post cards, tote bags, T-shirts a DVD compilation and an exclusive film, food and craft beer salon!


Hand Printed Tote Bag


Hand Printed T-Shirt

Don't miss out on the fun!

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

As a GREAT BIG THANK YOU to all of the wonderful contributors to the campaign thus far, Proceed and Be Bold!, (the feature length documentary about my life and work) is being posted online for free for everyone to watch for the remainder of the campaign. Thank you, 20K Films. Please enjoy and share with your friends.

http://youtu.be/i251DDffUzY

Here’s the doc website too:

www. proceedandbebold.com

I am letterpress printer, Amos Paul Kennedy, Jr., and I am asking for your support to help me build a printing plant in Detroit, MI for people who are interested in letterpress printing and need a space to practice it.
 
When I first started printing, it was the generosity of older printers that helped me grow and develop and I think it is now my responsibility to pass on this generosity to others.
 
What I want to do is develop a space that if you have an interest in letterpress printing, you can come and experience it and decide if this is what you want to do with your life. 
 
We all have dreams and aspirations of doing things, and this is about helping people accomplish their dreams. 
 
 
What I want to do is have people help me create a model for sustainable industries built to human scale. I want others to explore this model so that they too can pass on your love and devotion of a craft.
 
The Detroit Printing Plant is about sustainability: it's not about being so big that you have to maintain your bigness, it's about being just big enough that your craft can maintain you. 
 
If we reach our fundraising goal to create The Detroit Printing Plant, then you know we can make your dreams happen too. 

If we make MORE than the fundraising goal, we will also create an on-site printer's hostel and bakery. 

To serve as a model for developing human-scale, sustainable industries and to also provide a model to make a living by following your dreams and to affirm that you can make living from your craft. This is a place for stuff makers. (Stuff is material to be worked upon or to be used in making something.) We are printing, but we are not confined only to printmaking. This is an open-source model to help you create your own sustainable space.
 

1) Print Shop

The print shop will have multiple printing presses, printing equipment, and space where people can come to share their ideas and get their print on.

 

2) Book Bindery

The book bindery will be a space to learn the craft of bookbinding and to manufacture handmade books.

 

3) Handmade Paper Mill

The handmade paper mill will be a small paper mill for people to experiment with papermaking. 

APPRENTICES!
 

(Like this 23 year old from Maine.)

 

STUDENTS!

(Art students @ St. Benedict and St. John's University, St. Joe, MN)

 

OTHER PRINTERS!

(Shout Out to Bruno Press!)

 

ANYONE AND EVERYONE WHO WANTS TO PRINT! 

(Like this fine young man sitting on my lap.)

1) Follow Kennedy Prints on Facebook

2) Share the campaign on your facebook page

3) Tweet it

4) Blog about it

5) Send the campaign out to your letterpress, craft, and art news groups

6) Volunteer to help me move at the end of this year

7) Buy more Kennedy Prints! Online

8) TRUST IN YOURSELF

Use the power of the social network to make good things happen!

The Economist Blog

American Craft Council

Garden and Gun Magazine (p.68)

Fine Books and Collections 

Printinteresting

Tuscaloosa News

Eddie Campbell's Fate of the Artist Blog

Kennedy Prints! 

Proceed and Be Bold!  

 

 

 

 

ABOUT PERKS:

We guarantee that we have underpromised and will overproduce the perks.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matt Schaefer.

  • I attended grad school at the University of Kansas
  • I currently run a gallery in a small town, Aberdeen South Dakota
  • For 3 years I have been actively promoting emerging artists and using social media to do so.

I have many contacts through this social media network I have created and look to bypass the "who you know" element of art galleries and offer the best art there is to the public regardless of name.

What We Need & What You Get

Due to this being a small town, I can't offer the best there is in art due to population size, money available, local aesthetics.

  • For around $5000 plus everything else I have, I know I can open a quality space in a larger city, to compete with other galleries.
  • The difference between myself and other gallery is that I am an artist as well. I keep the commission structure down to make the art both affordable and give the artist most the profits for the sale. (they made it, so why not?)
  • If I do not make my goal, the funds will go to the artists of my gallery.
The Impact

The Impact will be that many emerging artists will get their chance, both national and international, to hang in a gallery in a major city.

  • It will get unknown artists names out.
  • My gallery currently and my social media presence already promotes this ethos.
  • I'm already doing this, but I'm asking for help to transform this into it's full potential.
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you can't give, share this with as many people as possible
  • Indiegogo share tools!

Help make my dream and many others, a reality.

story:
Do you ever think about how we read now? 
How reading affects our brains? 
What does this mean for the publications we know and love? 
How are they changing?

If this intrigues you, then please read further about
what we’re trying to do.

+++++++++

Print publications have been a cornerstone of graphic design practice since its infancy. Thanks to the rise of digital media, the iPad and mobile devices, publication design is in the midst of an exciting evolution. Print won’t go away, but it is most certainly shifting  and changing in response to the ever expanding digital frontier.

We are an advanced graphic design studio at California College of the Arts attempting to interrogate the "state of the publication" by producing our own super-awesome printed publication that addresses these concerns.

Unfortunately:

We do need some financial help! Similar to every other print publication that manages to exist today, we also need a way to help fund our publication. 

We are not here to make money, we just need a little help from you guys to solely cover our production costs.

Fortunately (the good stuff): 

If you donate any amount at all, we would be excited to return the love, and here are the specific rewards:

$10 you will get your own pristine copy of the just released "State of the Publication" + plus our undying gratitude.

$25 you will get TWO pristine copies of the just released "State of the Publication" (one for you, one for a friend!) + plus our EXTENDED undying gratitude.

$50 and above you will get TWO pristine copies of the just released "State of the Publication" + plus our EXTENDED, EXTENDED undying gratitude + a SIGNED copy of course instructor Eric Heiman's SF SOUND poster originally created for McSweeney's. (Images of poster here)


"State of the Publication" will be interrogating how we as readers and authors are grappling with the current conditions and transformations of the publication today. While these technological and behavioral changes may seem transparent, we feel we must address this revolution that is occurring in both the print and digital worlds.

If you believe in the publication as much as we do, we would love your help! Thank you! 

------


If you aren't able to donate, we would love if you could help by sharing this to others through all your social media outlets! Go nuts.

story:
Your Help

Miniature Tale and his sculptor Stavros Zouliatis, proudly presents their first campaign for a figures range. "The Steampunk League" are 54mm model kit, including figures, vehicles and bases.Your contribution is very important in order for the whole idea to be utilized and for the figures to be molded, copied, packaged and released.Either project funded or not, you ll get your copies, middle December and will send them by register and signed for, including tracking number. All perks, includes shipping cost.

Baron Humphrey Roth

High Quality Resin Casting, 54 mm, 4 pieces kit (figure, 2 wings/hands and base).

Base scenery included.

Lord Cornelious Wood

High Quality Resin Casting, 54 mm, 5 pieces kit (3 parts for bicycle, figure and base).

Base scenery, bicycle included.

Duke Fergus Stone

High Quality Resin Casting, 54 mm, 5 pieces kit (2 parts for bike, figure, hand and base).

Base scenery, motorbike included.

All figures, bikes sculpted by Stavros Zouliatis.

What you get

story:
Who We Are

We are a group of 12 women in the Pacific Northwest making and selling a “muffstache” calendar for 2014. Inspired in part by the "Movember" movement for prostate cancer awareness, and in part by the impressive facial hair sported by many of our male friends, we started to wonder how we might use our own follicular bounty for good. We began growing "muffstaches" or moustaches out of our pubic hair, in the fall of 2012. Over the past year, we shot a series of pin-up style (i.e. sorta sexy, kinda cheesy, and Not Pornographic!) photos featuring our pubic coifs, and incorporated them into a unique and professionally designed calendar. Our goal is to share this creative project with our friends and fans, while raising money for a great program that supports women's reproductive health in the Portland area.

The Cause

  • Net proceeds from sales of the 2014 Muffstache Calendar and additional donations will go to Planned Parenthood of the Columbia Willamette to fund their cervical screening program. This program allows local women, many of whom are low-income and/or uninsured, to obtain screenings that help prevent HPV and cervical cancer.
  • The cervical screening program is one of Planned Parenthood's less visible services, so it is chronically short on funding. With your contribution, we'll be able to give this program some much-needed community support!
  • More than 12,000 women in the US are diagnosed with cervical cancer each year. This disease kills more than 4,000 women in the US annually, yet it is one of the most treatable types of cancer if it is caught early. Visit http://www.nccc-online.org/index.php/cervicalcancer for more information. 

Where Your Donation Goes

Upon launch of this campaign, we have received a generous investment to complete a first-run printing of the calendar, and we are raising funds through Indiegogo to recoup those costs so we can allocate additional donations to Planned Parenthood. Our goal of $1900 reflects printing costs for our first 500 copies plus calendar shipping, as well as merchant fees from Indiegogo and its payment processor.

  • If we don't quite meet our goal of $1900, 88% of your donation will go toward printing costs and the remaining 12% will go toward administrative fees. We wish this figure was lower, but unfortunately credit card companies aren't in the practice of making it cheap to interact with them.
  • If we do meet our goal, 88% of your donation will go toward printing costs, 7% will go toward administrative fees, and 5%, or $97 total, will go directly to Planned Parenthood.
  • If we surpass our goal, 100% of additional donations will go directly to Planned Parenthood. The more you donate, the more we can do together to help prevent cervical cancer!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

  • Visit our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/muffstachecalendars
  • Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/MuffstacheCals
  • Visit our website at http://www.muffstache.org/
Be a muffstache ambassador!

  • Grow your own muffstache, consider donating annually to Planned Parenthood's screening fund, and for those of you with cervixes, be sure to get regular pap smears! (Visit http://www.uspreventiveservicestaskforce.org/uspstf/uspscerv.htm for recommendations on frequency of pap tests for different age groups, as researched and reported by the US Preventive Services Task Force.)


*Note on Shipping and New Year's Discounts

  • We will do our best to ship all orders submitted before December 15th in time to arrive by Christmas, and by New Year's for orders submitted between December 15th-20th. Any orders made after December 20th may not be filled until the first week of January or later. This campaign is set to run until January 20th - if you donate on that day your calendar will be shipped by January 29th at the latest.
  • Reward levels may be changed after January 1st to offer discounts on the calendar (likely offering the calendar at $20 instead of $25) but this is not guaranteed. Stay tuned to our facebook page for updates about calendar discounts.

story:
The Structure

The Temple of Liminality is unique structure with many entrances, exits, and thresholds. Where spaces are separated, but still open. Where curiousity can lead you deeper inside, or just around  the perimeter. Where exploration is encouraged, but interpretation is your own.

Maquette built by Kale Parsons & Melanie Neves

This project was designed and conceptualized by a small team of artists and builders, many of whom are involved in the implementation of stages and production projects in events throughout Toronto, and festivals in Ontario. Most of the team also designed and built the Temple for Hyperborea 2017.
We're all very passionate about making every aspect of this design a reality, but it is an ambitious project and we will need your help to make it happen!

What We Need

Even with a generous grant from Hyperborea, we've calculated that we will need much more funding to make this project possible. As this is a non-for-profit, community based endeavour, we guarantee that every donation will be going directly into covering the many costs of building this structure.
Among the many costs, here are some of the more important things this crowdfunding campaign will help to fund:

  • A large assortment of lumber, including structural elements
  • A scaffold and/or lift system for safely building and placing the roof sections
  • Power and fuel, both for the construction portion, and for the burn
  • CNC routering for the decorative screen sections of the walls
  • Metal hardware to ensure the structure is safe and secure for all attendees
  • Transportation costs for all equipment, hardware, and building supplies during prefabrication

Every little bit counts, and the more we can raise, the more we can build!

Concept art for lattice by Anthony Alves
 

The Team

Project Leads: Kale Parsons & Melanie Neves

Production Lead: Gary Capon

Art Lead: Anthony Alves

Build Team: Eli Paper, Kalen Davidson, Bryan Reid, Angela McQueen, Snappy Homefry.

Special thanks to: Rehanna Devraj-Kizuk and the incredible art committee team

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're financially unable to donate to this project, there are other ways you can help!
The best way to assist would be getting the word out about this crowdfunding campaign and help us achieve our goal by letting other people know about it. Please feel free to share this project on Facebook, and with your friends!

story:
The Cube Garden is a collection of 50 translucent, glowing cubes on Esplanade and around the frontage of our village, The Institute.  The cubes are designed to be large enough for people to sit on (and quite comfortable!) but small enough that they may be picked up and rearranged. A multitude of sensors inside each cube allow them to light up and change color patterns depending on how users move or interact with them.  We are building a series of interactive games and behaviors for the curious to discover. The garden of the future both encourages and rewards play and experimentation.. you'll have to try it for yourself to learn the secrets of the cubes!

Brought to you by some of the same people behind Dr Brainlove, heart and Institute blinky badges and the best damn takoyaki on playa, we envision the Cube Garden traveling with us wherever we go.  We plan on bringing part or all of the installation to temporary and fun locations for beautiful, audio-reactive and interactive seating.. imagine rolling up to an art car in deep playa and seeing the most comfortable place to sit pulsing to the beat!  It's also built on top of the technology used in The Institute LED badges, so those who previously purchased those badges will be able to communicate with the cube garden!

 

What We Need

The individual cubes of the cube garden consist of two core components - the base cube, which is a durable rotationally molded LDPE, and the custom designed PCB, including various sensors and board-mounted LEDs:

  • Electronics: $5000 (64 units, incl assembly and handling and China taxes, charging banks for the cubes)
  • Plastic cubes: $2000 (50 units, including lens assembly, battery, screws, gasket, USB cable, power jack and switch)
  • Freight for cubes: $1500
  • Setup fees: $400
  • Test jig: $500 - used for programming, customized for cube boards
  • Shipping of the cube PCBs to USA as well as prototype shipping: $500

Total: ~$10,000

What’s not listed here is time spent writing custom drivers to run the hardware, creating interactive effects for the cubes, and assembly, storage, and transport for the cubes to playa. All hardware and software design is being done for free by team members who have devoted many hours to making the cubes' magic come to life.  Our team is also working on finding zero-cost logistical solutions.

 

Stretch Goals

  1. $300 each - two additional secret magic lighting effects:  There are additional sensors and electronic components that were too expensive to include in the main board design, but can be incorporated into one-off cubes that could be featured in the center of the Cube Garden at a cost of about $300 per magic effect (the cost is only for the electronics needed). 
  2. Because the cubes are portable, durable, and reusable, if we receive more money than the cost to build the cubes, we can also use that extra money to help pay for transportation to events beyond Burning Man.  Whether it's a local festival or community event, we would love to be able to share the cubes with more people, and additional money would help make that easier for us.

 

Potential Risks

Our team is highly experienced in blinky manufacturing and plastic molding. In order to cut down on costs, we have found the most cost efficient suppliers in Guangdong, China for both the cube and the custom PCB.  The hardware design is already finished, software development has been in progress using prototype boards, and we already have a minimum viable software release for the interactive cubes.  Our members also have experience in delivering both art and commercial products in multiple successful crowdfunding campaigns. There are always risks and chances of disaster but we feel that risk has been minimized through these measures and look forward to sharing The Cube Garden with you all!

story:
This is an improv test between a painter and cellist.


Title: Could it be?  36"x48"x2.5"  This painting has a dual french cleat system on the back and was painted compositionally to work hung as you see it here or flipped 180 degrees. This is the TOP perk on the list!


MY WHY

The work I create in Finland will be brought back and installed as part of a group exhibit titled "Noisemakers" an Art's Fund Raiser for the Norman Arts Council. I'll be presenting a video projection mapped sculpture as well as physical works for purchase. Opening reception is December 13 at Mainsite Contemporary Art in Norman, Oklahoma. 


Hello, 

My name is Chad Mount and I'm a visual artist and I am honored to announce the renowned international art residency program Arteles recently selected me as one of eight artists chosen among hundreds of applicants from around the world to participate in their November 2013 artist in residency program. This is my first art residency to participate in, As a resident in Haukijarvi, Finland, I will paint my unique blend visual constellations(Blooming Currents), capturing the process in HD video. Then using a combination of video mapping software I'll be able to project these "Blooming Currents" seamlessly across unconventional three dimensional forms evoking wondrous illusions. Working in Finland will give me the unique opportunity to delve into landscapes of snow and forests, lands foreign to where I typically pull my inspiration which is largely from the ocean. I also pull much inspiration from the celestial and am fascinated by the almost symbiotic relationship between the celestial and the aquatic. 

I aim to capture the parallels of these two realms, and hopefully raising the emotional state and sense of wonder in the viewer.  I have no doubt that exploring Finland's winter landscape especially at night with the snow covered landscape backlit by a clear open sky caressed by the occasional wafting northern lights, will inspire new motifs in my work and I'm am ecstatic about that idea! My process in creating these anomalies uses the pooling of composition colors via underpainting, combined with my own unique chemical blend of solvents and emulsifiers. I'm currently experimenting Cymatics in part if the creation process which has added another exciting layer to this painting process. Arteles has two Reed Organs and I've already been dreaming up ways of incorporating their haunting sounds into my creations while there.


WHAT I NEED

I was given just a few weeks notice about being selected for the Nov. residency, which doesn't leave much time to cover all the financial bases.  Arteles provides a grant for half of my program costs, and I am hoping for your help in raising the remaining fees. By funding this project, you not only help see this vision through to it's fullest potential but also help me in joining  together with creative minds & professionals from all over the world, while also contributing to the continued advancement of art in Oklahoma. Your support in helping me advance my work is greatly appreciated, and I look forward to sharing my art with you all through out the process!  

The financial assistance will be used towards, residency fees, travel expenses, food, project tools, shipping fees, materials and building the final installation. Should the campaign be successful, any additional funds raised will be applied further development of these concepts.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you're not in a place to financially contribute, please help me MAKE SOME NOISE!

  • Please share this campaign with anyone you feel would find it interesting.
  • Be sure to use the built-in Indiegogo share tools to make sharing easier!


I am truly grateful for your generous support and believing in me as an artist.

You can find out more about me and view more of my work at the following links.

https://www.facebook.com/tribalbot

http://tribalbot.tumblr.com/

Thank you all!!!!

Cheers,

Chad
story_txt:
This is an improv test between a painter and cellist.



Title: Could it be?  36"x48"x2.5"  This painting has a dual french cleat system on the back and was painted compositionally to work hung as you see it here or flipped 180 degrees. This is the TOP perk on the list!

MY WHY
The work I create in Finland will be brought back and installed as part of a group exhibit titled "Noisemakers" an Art's Fund Raiser for the Norman Arts Council. I'll be presenting a video projection mapped sculpture as well as physical works for purchase. Opening reception is December 13 at Mainsite Contemporary Art in Norman, Oklahoma. 


Hello, 



My name is Chad Mount and I'm a visual artist and I am honored to announce the renowned international art residency program Arteles recently selected me as one of eight artists chosen among hundreds of applicants from around the world to participate in their November 2013 artist in residency program. This is my first art residency to participate in, As a resident in Haukijarvi, Finland, I will paint my unique blend visual constellations(Blooming Currents), capturing the process in HD video. Then using a combination of video mapping software I'll be able to project these "Blooming Currents" seamlessly across unconventional three dimensional forms evoking wondrous illusions. Working in Finland will give me the unique opportunity to delve into landscapes of snow and forests, lands foreign to where I typically pull my inspiration which is largely from the ocean. I also pull much inspiration from the celestial and am fascinated by the almost symbiotic relationship between the celestial and the aquatic. 
I aim to capture the parallels of these two realms, and hopefully raising the emotional state and sense of wonder in the viewer.  I have no doubt that exploring Finland's winter landscape especially at night with the snow covered landscape backlit by a clear open sky caressed by the occasional wafting northern lights, will inspire new motifs in my work and I'm am ecstatic about that idea! My process in creating these anomalies uses the pooling of composition colors via underpainting, combined with my own unique chemical blend of solvents and emulsifiers. I'm currently experimenting Cymatics in part if the creation process which has added another exciting layer to this painting process. Arteles has two Reed Organs and I've already been dreaming up ways of incorporating their haunting sounds into my creations while there.
WHAT I NEED
I was given just a few weeks notice about being selected for the Nov. residency, which doesn't leave much time to cover all the financial bases.  Arteles provides a grant for half of my program costs, and I am hoping for your help in raising the remaining fees. By funding this project, you not only help see this vision through to it's fullest potential but also help me in joining  together with creative minds & professionals from all over the world, while also contributing to the continued advancement of art in Oklahoma. Your support in helping me advance my work is greatly appreciated, and I look forward to sharing my art with you all through out the process!  
The financial assistance will be used towards, residency fees, travel expenses, food, project tools, shipping fees, materials and building the final installation. Should the campaign be successful, any additional funds raised will be applied further development of these concepts.



OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you're not in a place to financially contribute, please help me MAKE SOME NOISE!

Please share this campaign with anyone you feel would find it interesting.
Be sure to use the built-in Indiegogo share tools to make sharing easier!





I am truly grateful for your generous support and believing in me as an artist.
You can find out more about me and view more of my work at the following links.
https://www.facebook.com/tribalbot
http://tribalbot.tumblr.com/
Thank you all!!!!
Cheers,
Chad

story:
Uratz Studios presents

 

Tech Skull Helmet

Featuring:

  • ALL Clear Polycarbonate visor 3mm thick (Airsoft safe)
  • Lithium battery powered Micro USB Charging
  • Mini Fan in chin area
  • LEDs strip light inside helmet cheeks
  • Dual white lamps in front chin.
  • Carbonfiber Inner Skull Mask
  • Back plate also made of Carbonfiber
  • Swivel Top function

Shipping Late November 2018.

story:
Hello Darlings! 

My name is Su-Shan.  I am a salon owner Manayunk, PA.  For almost 10 years I've had the great pleasure of knowing artist JD(not putting his full pen name in order to keep this a surprise).  For the past 4 years, I've had the honor of seeing him grow as an artist, leaving behind a creatively stifling corporate design job in favor of his own imaginings.

I've been helping to organize fundraisers for non-profits since I was 15.  I previously ran a successful campaign on Indiegogo for my salon.  This is only my second time organizing a fundraiser for someone I know personally and the first time through a group funding site, so this is an experiment for me.  Better than just providing financial assistance, fundraisers exemplify unity toward a common goal, make you feel good when you're able to help someone, and hopefully inspire more benevolence.  

Because this campaign is happening in secret to JD, it will be presented to him as a challenge once the funds are raised, that he can choose to accept or not.  He will be asked to produce 5 original designs between 1/3/14 to 2/7/14.  Four of the designs will be to establish his brand.  The 5th design will be to benefit Project Anti-Bully. If JD accepts the challenge the funds may only be used toward the production of the new designs and art supplies to help the process and $1 of every $20 will go to Project Anti-Bully in addition to the proceeds of the 5th design.  If he doesn't accept, all of the funds raised will go to Project Anti-Bully outside of the cost of taxes, campaign fees, and providing incentives. I chose Project Anti-Bully because they are international and run for students by students.  Also, JD was bullied as a kid, making him the sensitive and thoughtful person he is today.  I hope knowing that he can help raise awareness against bullying will make him more likely to accept the challenge, but either way your donations will go toward a statement of furthering kindness through acceptance.  

I am intentionally keeping the incentives low in cost because ideally I would rather see a lot of people contribute a little bit in show of support.  In return you get art and a discount at my salon.  I wouldn't have been able to accomplish starting a business without the help of those who believe in me and I just want to pay it forward to someone dear to me.  JD did an awesome job raising funds for a St. Baldrick's event held at my salon without expecting anything in return.  I am trying to net $1000(which is about the amount he had raised) toward his branding to show him good deeds can get repaid and I honestly think he would get nervous accepting more.  

So, at this point Indiegogo requests that I detail more precisely where the funds will go. If we raise the full $1500 initially about $290 will go toward taxes and $135 toward the fees of running the campaign.  In accepting the challenge, $75 will go to Project Anti-Bully until their design is created.  Beyond that, it's somewhat theoretical, but a run of 24 Tshirts costs about $200. With 4 new designs that's $800 and the remaining $200 could go toward producing paper prints.  I believe I will be able to have the run of Tshirts for the 5th design donated or severely discounted by the printer. 

For your incentives, you can check out JD's Etsy page: (http://www.etsy.com/shop/johnnydestructo?ref=se...)

and choose from singular paper prints that are not labeled "Orginal" Ink or Drawing or choose from the designs from this campaign once they are completed.    

And now, I'm asked to tell you the impact of this campaign.  Beyond helping Project Anti-Bully, I don't know for sure.  I'm hoping to build momentum to help a friend further use his talent.  The idea that it takes a village to raise a child has always resonated with me.  I think being a part of a village can and should last throughout our lives.  There is a time to help and a time to be helped.  There is a time to give and a time to receive.  If you support JD, he'll turn it into something good and keep it going.  We can all be a part of that good.  

To help with the surprise, please don't post this to Facebook walls.  Please send it through messages or e-mails.  The salon discounts can be redeemed at any time after a donation is made, the prints will take longer.  Thank you!

story:
The campaign is closed... but:

The Guild Wars 2 Artist Collective continues to make projects, all sponsored by ArenaNet. We give to good causes (such as with our $42,000 USD donation to IFAW in November). The decks are no longer available, but our current projects, including the Wintersday Zine, still are.

Have an error in your order/shipping? Email us! >> gw2collective@gmail.com.

Feel free to follow us on Tumblr, Twitter and Instagram for more updates! 

You’ve come so far – far from the bustling life of the cities, the quiet strength of the trees, the warmth of home. You’ve adventured and battled, waged war against creatures darker than the night, brighter than the day. You've carved a legacy to stand against the passage of time. Now, the world calls on you again. Alone or together, you cannot fall.

Tyrian Tarot is a 78-card Marseilles-based deck created by the Guild Wars 2 Artist Collective, under the summer charity project called the GW2 Tarot Club. All of the contributors are fans just like you – people who have traveled through the game and experienced its story – and individuals who really wanted to create something to remember under the name of the game they love. Every one of them have put their all into the project, and we’re sure you’ll see it reflected in the cards.

The first card, The Faceless Commander, puts you on the path through the Major Arcana, while each of the following cards depict important characters, events, locations and parts of the game that shape the experience of the Guild Wars 2 journey. The artists have all come together to paint what ties us all together, all while supporting the International Fund for Animal Welfare charity with the net proceeds of our project.

Whether you’re a Guild Wars player that’s been with the game since its first launch thirteen years ago, or you just picked up its sequel recently, we all share a love for this game, and we hope you’re able to support these fantastic contributors and the project.

With all current unlocked stretch and pledge goals, the current bundle for The Fool now comes with a physical hardcover book, two postcards, two extra vinyl stickers and a free pin, along with the deck being fully gilded in a 2-piece foiled box with 105 cards. 

Featuring illustrations from 68 artists from around the world, the Tyrian Tarot deck is comprised of 78 main cards (the 22 Major Arcana and the 56 Minor Arcana), along with  25 unlocked Wild Cards - achieved through the pledge & stretch goals.

The cards measure at 2.75”x4.75” (standard tarot size), printed on 330 gsm black-core stock with a matte anti-scratch finish. They are gilded and in a custom foiled 2-piece box, designed by Weston T. Jones - another goal achieved through the stretch goals of the campaign. The card back designs (both variants) are designed by Qesque. 

The Book

The companion guide is a 264-page resource that comes with every deck purchase. It is physically printed as a 5.5"x8.5” book that is foiled, debossed hardcover. Converting from a PDF to the foiled, debossed hardcover was another stretch goal the campaign achieved.

The book includes passages to explain the meanings of the cards and interpretations, as well as artist commentaries on their pieces.

The cover is designed by the lovely Isvoc, with foiling and adjustments by the moderation team. 

The Shipping Conundrum - Solved

We happily ship worldwide! Our rates are normalized to $9 shipping in the U.S., and $12 shipping for the rest of the world. In addition, we'll be paying for any EU Customs (if you're outside of the EU/US, normal customs will still apply).

How did we do this? We'll be shipping ordered decks to a distributor in the EU that will ship full packages out, paying for the base shipping expense along with the initial customs fees - it reduces the costs by at least $15 per package. 

Please note that if you order a copy after our initial campaign/post-campaign store and initial shipment and need it shipped internationally, the price will be around $35 to ship both the box and the book.

Please note that all card previews are subject to change. We have, however, attempted to portray as many of these pieces as accurately as we could.

Add-Ons

We have partnered with Backerkit, a company that helps with backer support, and will be doing surveys (including add-ons) and the pre-order/post-order store through their services. You will be emailed a link to a survey to fill it out and, at that time, you'll be able to add any extra selections you'd like. TL;DR: You are not adding these now, and can adjust your number and quantities in the days after the campaign! :)

The pricing list is below for your reference! The below are unlimited but we will not be able to reproduce them after the campaign (they are pledge exclusives). All selections made within the campaign were reset with the import.

  • Postcard Signature ($3): We’ll personally address your postcard to whoever you’d like.
  • Extra Postcards ($2 each): The backs will be blank, so you can do whatever you’d like with them.
  • Extra Vinyl Stickers ($2.50 each): Raptors and quaggan/choya; one is included with physical packs if unlocked by default
  • Stickers ($4): Ranger Tarot pets and Breakfast Mounts, 1 sheet each
  • Standard Pins ($7): World Completion (additional – one comes standard with the Tyrian Tarot deck), Res Me, Mastery/Laurel pin, baby catmander griffon, black lion trading coin pin, Apples for Tybalt - 1.25"
  • Specialty Pins ($10): Eternity – 2", rainbow anodized; [Coming soon!] - 2", glow in the dark
  • Digital Pack ($5): Includes the cover as a wallpaper, the card backs as phone res items, a few cards as wallpapers and (potentially) some desktop wallpapers from the book designs
  • Prints ($10 for 5"x7" on archival, fine art quality): Additional sizes will be available dependent on region.
  • Tarot Cloth ($13): As voted on by the community, we'll be making a Omadd's Map cloth - available only through the surveys as add-ons (material pending dependent on swatches - we're discussing with some pros on how to make this work to get the best options available to us)

Pin Selection

Final selections are made through the add-on survey that will be sent out to all backers at the end of the campaign. You can make all adjustments and additions at that time!

There are two default pins that you can pick from, as well as four additional pins that are unlocked through goals and Eternity. There is one last pin unlockable in the final stretch goal.

  • Stretch Goal: World Completion Pin -- Now added to all Tyrian Tarot packages!
  • Selection I (available): Mastery & Laurel Pin (ideas & designs by the mods)
  • Selection II (available): "Res me" halo pin (ideas & designs by the mods)
  • Selection III (available): Black Lion Trading Coin Pin (idea submitted anonymously, designed by the mods)
  • Selection IV (available): Catmander Baby Griffon (idea submitted by MuffinWifey, designed by the mods)
  • Selection V (available): Apples for Tybalt (idea submitted by Digital Flower, designed by the mods)
  • Selection VI (available as add-on only): Eternity (note: made of rainbow anodized metal - each one is unique, 1.75")
  • Selection VII (available as add-on only): Flameseeker Prophecies (note: 1.75", glow in the dark)

Note: All images are still in production.

Print Choices

Final selections are made through the add-on survey that will be sent out to all backers at the end of the campaign. You can make all adjustments and additions at that time!

For the print add ons, you’re able to select a print of one of the following. It will be updated if any participants add their images to the list (and the images will be updated to reflect progression - many are still works in progress). You'll be able to see full mini-previews during selection in the surveys in May.

  • These are unlimited and printed on 5"x7” paper, shipped with the packages in August.
  • Options will be available in the survey for selection, but also for a larger size (for framing)
  • Artists offering prints were allowed to decide if they'd donate their "net" or keep it. This is up to their discretion and not disclosed.

LARGER PRINTS will be available starting June 16. We are currently evaluating EU orders.

Commission Opportunities

Commissions are offered through the campaign for select artists who have opted in. These commissions come with the deck and any unlocks, as well as a printed copy of your illustration (and digital). We will put you in contact with your artist so that you can come to an agreement on ideas, and your commission will begin shortly after the conclusion of the campaign (so we can pay them). There are five tiers, listed below, with the artists who are available/reserved. 

NOTICE: All 23 commissions are reserved.

Reserved Commissions (Reference)

  • Tier 5: H1fey (Wojtek Depczyński); Tier 5: Casondra Logan; Tier 4: H1fey (Wojtek Depczyński); Tier 4: Casondra; Tier 3: Ohm; Tier 3: Ranya Ni; Tier 2: H1fey (Wojtek Depczyński); Tier 2:  Celebril; Tier 2: Shahina; Tier 2: Sketching Sands; Tier 2:  Thavie; Tier 1:  Celebril; Tier 1:  Sketching Sands; Tier 1:  Rusavia; Tier 1: Ohm; Tier 1 (x2): Shahina; Tier 1 (x3): Kyla Frank; Tier 1 (x2): Route 13; Tier 1: Diana Glebowicz

With the Indiegogo campaign, we’ve designed a variety of goals in three categories. We recognize that our community comes from all over, and there are a number of places you could come from, and we wanted to make this experience a fun one. Please note that once we unlock a goal, it gets added to physical decks or becomes an option without any adjustment from you. There's no need to adjust your pledge. 

Stretch goals are the traditional type of funding goal, directly coming from the monetary value involved with the campaign. These goals only happen after we are fully funded for the base production of the decks.

Pledge goals are our spin on community goals. Every pledge, whether it’s $1 or $100, counts to these, and there are a lot of great unlocks here. Dominantly, the team have come together to create extra cards including gods, dragons and characters they really wanted to see in the deck.

Social media goals started on April 20th. We have two stickers that will be posted to social media (one for each platform). If they hit the requirements listed, they’ll get unlocked for every Tyrian Tarot bundle.

Our wonderful contributors of the GW2 Tarot Club project began work on the deck early this year, pouring their love for the game and creative power into the pieces for this collaboration. Both new and returning artists were specially selected, aiming to create a cohesive deck in appearance, with care and consideration for the world we are representing. 

See below to visit their professional profiles - for their various social media platforms, please check out our full contributor listing on Tumblr.

Moderation:
Mel Sayre (Zorav) ◊◊ Angelique van der Mee ◊◊ Aun Hana ◊◊ Sara Danger ◊◊ Thunderpot

Artists (including participating moderation):
Alassa ◊◊ allpurposepanda ◊◊ Andrés Agostini ◊◊ Anez ◊◊ Angelique van der Mee ◊◊ Anneliese Mak ◊◊ Aun Hana ◊◊ BleachedRainbows ◊◊ Casondra  ◊◊ Celebril ◊◊ Changer the Elder ◊◊ Chilkat ◊◊ chrisqi ◊◊ Cortez ◊◊ Diana Glebowicz (Larea) ◊◊ Elodie Mondoloni ◊◊ evermeer ◊◊ Evi ◊◊ Favena ◊◊ Fell ◊◊ Flutti ◊◊ gears2gnomes ◊◊ Grise ◊◊ Htg17 ◊◊ Isvoc ◊◊ Jem ◊◊ Josephine-frays ◊◊ Juuni ◊◊ Katalean ◊◊ kingbaest ◊◊ kinixuki ◊◊ KoboldArt ◊◊ Kyla Frank ◊◊ Landylachs ◊◊ Lemoncholy ◊◊ Mamath ◊◊ Marta Milczarek ◊◊ Mike Nash ◊◊ Ohm ◊◊ Owlma ◊◊ PlaviGmaz ◊◊ Ragous ◊◊ Ranya Ni ◊◊ Route13 ◊◊ Rurush_Ichi ◊◊ Rusavia ◊◊ Sara Danger ◊◊ Sarianne ◊◊ Sayael ◊◊ Shahina ◊◊ Shunkaku ◊◊ Skaven Zverov ◊◊ Sketching Sands ◊◊ Sleepsunn ◊◊ Smirtouille ◊◊ sockpoppet ◊◊ Tealful Eyes ◊◊ Thavie ◊◊ Thunderpot ◊◊ Tim Kaminski ◊◊ Travis Purvis ◊◊ Veer ◊◊ Weston T. Jones  ◊◊ Wojtek Depczyński ◊◊ Yakitty ◊◊ Yanli Wang ◊◊ Yazzart ◊◊ Zaara

Writers & Editors:
Ben Lee (Incendium) ◊◊ Kora (GuildLores) ◊◊ Mel Sayre (Zorav)

Promotional Cosplayer:
Enayla (with photography by Al Lin)
 

The Guild Wars 2 story begins with the Commander, pushed into the role of tirelessly saving Tyria time and time again. From the moment we grabbed our first weapon, we led a path of discovery: exploring hundreds of places in the face of gods and dragons, sharing a journey with countless others. However, what made this story great was more than that – it was the stories forged from being in a community many call home. The cards of this deck attempt to encapsulate that story – of places traveled, moments remembered, characters never forgotten.

With this project, we promise to deliver the best project we can, at the highest quality we can afford. These aren’t meant to be “just community projects,” but something that you can pull off your shelves for years to come. We hope the breakdown below can provide any additional clarification on our operations, but elsewise, please let us know so we can address it.

Fund Allocation

Note: The image above is an estimation for sales given a 750 deck order, unlocking at least the 2-piece box and the perfect bound, foiled physical book, as well as the free world completion pin. The charity margin goes up if we increase our deck and print orders.

Notice on 11/2018: A donation of $42,000 has been made to the International Fund for Animal Welfare. This was 33% of our overall budget donated to the cause.

Timeline

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of any project at this size usually falls to logistics and planning. While the moderation team of Tyrian Tarot are by no means immune to potential pitfalls, we have done the best we can to safeguard the project in as many ways as we can.

With a previous project completed, this is the second Guild Wars 2 project led by the same leadership. Sponsored by ArenaNet, we’ll be working to fulfill all of our promised tiers in a prompt and efficient manner - the Wintersday Zine in December 2017 was shipped out only 17 days after orders closed, exactly on schedule, and we aim to keep that promise with this project in staying as close to our dictated timeline as possible. In the event of delays, we’ll always be prompt with updating anyone through the updates on this page and social media.

By the time the campaign ends, all artwork will be completed, and all that remains will be the proofing and assembly of the book. Our ultimate goal is to do right by all of our fabulous artists while giving to a good cause. To foster that we’re working with a high-quality printer that will produce the best deck/book that they can, and have an experienced team to put it all together.

With that, the funding of this project is in your hands, and we love you for considering to support us. If you have any questions at any time, we are always happy to answer them at gw2collective@gmail.com.
