story:
For the past four years, 'Magpie Magazine' has celebrated the new folk revolution in art, writing and music.

Published annually, it brings together a collection of articles, short stories, poetry, illustration, music reviews and interviews. Over the years, Magpie has grown into something inspiring and unique, shaped by the incredible artists, writers and musicians who contribute to its pages. We now have ambitious plans for a fifth edition and need your help to transform our collective ideas into beautiful printed matter.

Please donate what you can afford, any amount will help tremendously, and the Magpie will bring you treasures...

---



Issue Five - Metamorphosis
planned publishing date: January 2012

Proposed Content:

Aspects of Leonora
A series of articles celebrating the life and work of one of the most daringly original, bizarre and visionary artists of the 20th century - Leonora Carrington.

Stories Stitched from String
Magpie investigates a new generation of puppeteers and storytellers, including Wyrd Motion, The Little Theatre of Dolls and Monooka

The Museum of British Folklore
We speak to Simon Costin, the founder of a new museum set up to celebrate the weird and wonderful folk traditions of Britain, and ask why these still matter today

Chrysalis
A review and excerpt of 'Chrysalis' by Kim Todd, which explores the life of a 17th century botanical illustrator and her quest to uncover the mystery of metamorphosis

Storm in a Teacup
Magpie speaks to Verity Flecknell, founder of feminist arts collective 'Storm in a Teacup'

Interviews and Music Reviews

Alela Diane, Odland, Rachael Dadd, High Wolf, Barn Owl, Sunburned Hand of the Man, Jozef Van Wissem and more

Plus: sinister tales and seductive poetry, peculiar illustration, hypnagogic photography, primordial music and much, much more....

Contributors include:

Aela Labbe, Arienette Pyre, Anya Kuts, Amy Goh, Amy Abshier-Reyes, Bianca Stewart, Colette Saint Yves, Cendrine Rovini, Charley Feltham, Chanel Plett, Claire Massey, Claire Hero, Ellene Hera, Fiona Michie, Jane O Sullivan, James Makepeace Boswell, Jennifer Maidment, Jeanne Madic, Jim Voltaire, Martha Verschaffel, Mathieu Mondoux, Marie Letourneau, Laura Makabresku, Kate Haddigan, Helene Renaut, Sara Berger, Vanessa Lovegrove, Zeena Choudhry amongst others




Above Images: Past Issues Three and Four
---

Treasures
Here is a list of treasures Magpie is offering to all good souls who donate

Donate $15 and you will receive a copy of the fifth edition of Magpie Magazine - Metamorphosis once it is printed. It will come delivered to you by Magpie mail, wrapped lovingly, tied with a ribbon and protected in a sturdy envelope.




'We Blossom' compilation CD
We are offering a limited edition and exclusive compilation CD featuring new and recent musical releases, including: Ilya Monosov, Esta Vivo, Helene Renaut, Wooly Mar, Arborea, John Fairhurst, Josephine Foster, Minko, Luup, Festival and other delightful sounds.
Compilation Cover Art by Colette Saint Yves

Donate $35 and you will receive a copy of Issue Four (almost sold out!) along with the fifth edition of Magpie Magazine, once it is printed. You will also be sent a download link to the 'We Blossom' Magpie compilation CD.

Donate $50 and as well as receiving a copy of the fifth edition, you will receive the limited edition 'We Blossom' compilation CD, which comes in a handstitched and beautifully illustrated case.

---

Limited Edition Art Print
We are offering limited edition archival art prints by three artists who have created work especially for this issue of Magpie Magazine. Each image will be printed on beautiful textured Tintoretto Gesso paper at 250 gsm, numbered and delivered to you in a protective plastic sleeve and a sturdy envelope.

Donate $70, and in addition to a copy of Issue Five, you will receive a limited edition archival art print of your choice.

Donate $100 and you will receive one limited edition archival art print of your choice, as well as a copy of Issue Five and the 'We Blossom' compilation CD.

Donate $140 and receive one of each limited edition archival art print (three in total), and a copy of Issue Five - Metamorphosis.

Donate $160 and receive one of each limited edition archival art print (three in total), a copy of Issue Five - Metamorphosis and a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD.

Here are the three art pieces:

Untitled by Aela Labbe





The Fates by Martha Verschaffel





Toutesoie by Cendrine Rovini





---

Donate $150 or more and in addition to receiving a copy of the fifth edition - Metamorphosis, a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD and a limited edition art print of your choice, you can also choose from one of these treasures...


?under the pyramids?
a custom crystal talisman



Each Talisman holds four different crystals selected for their beauty & their power.
It is contained in a glass vial from the 1930s.
The chain is sterling silver.

A little handmade booklet explaining the stones' properties & how to use the Talisman comes with each necklace.

-

Wolf & Moon
Moth Necklaces

Available in wood

Pendants vary in size from approx. 7.5cm to 9cm in width.

Chain is 45cm silver/gold plated (as seen on each pendant in the photograph).


---

Donate $300 or more and as well as receiving two copies of Issue Five, three limited edition art prints and a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD, you will also receive this one off, vintage Butterfly Collector's net, featured in the fifth edition of Magpie Magazine.

this is a one only offer




The Butterfly Collector's Net
Vintage bamboo butterfly collector's net
featured within the pages of Issue Five, in 'the Riflemen' photoshoot by Topsy Design
46.25" height, 14.25" length, 21" width




---

Daphne Descends Jewelry

Donate $500 or more and as well as receiving two copies of Magpie Magazine Issue Five, a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD and all three limited edition prints... you will receive an amazing, one of a kind, handcrafted jewel by Laura Lambroni of Daphne Descends Arts&Crafts. (one chance offer) More information to follow.



---

What you say about Magpie

here are just a handful of responses we've received about past issues...

I'd read the first two issues of Magpie Magazine with great delight but have to say Issue 3 is your best yet. It's simply fantastic! Well done! And long may it live.
--

oh I love reading it! the nest of magpie (the return address) is also very near where i'm from - it was like receiving a letter from home, but a secret letter full of magic and encouragement.
thank you for bringing all this art together.
--

The Magpie's here already, faster than I'd expect if she were coming from the next town over! And the colors are so glorious... I'm not finished reading her yet. I loved the Deer-Woman story, especially the sentence it starts with: I turned back to the previous page three times before I was sure it was really the first sentence.

The interview with Alessi is wonderful. Several of the things she recounts echo in me as a sympathetic vibration. We're so lucky to live in a time when a world-spanning harmonious family like this can be a reality, even though world-spanning horrors seemingly must also exist in such a time.
--


The whole issue is wonderful, like a small breviary for berryhunters and birdwatchers, a refuge for woodlanders and forest dwellers, interspersed with faint hints of music and other tunes much deeper than just music.
It's easily recognizable that you and all others put much effort into it and I know how hard it is to edit a zine these days, to prevent the individual strings of the contributions from diverging.

There is this one line in your interview with Alessi that stands out of the whole magazine: "inserting magic into daily life". Yes, that's what it does. At least for me it did. The story of the deer woman is particularly beautiful.
--

Your Magpie Magazine is very well conceived - It was pretty much what I had anticipated - which is to say every word (and I am alert to the words) seems to promote a way of life ~ an outlook if you will, that I found absolutely delicious, of course, being a writer of fairytales such as I am. And yet you clearly have the one foot firmly placed in the real world. BUT! It's on your terms. And that's what I loved about the magazine. The resoluteness of vision. Soft, gentle yet firm somehow.
--
 
---

What else you can do to help

We greatly appreciate all your support and enthusiasm. Tell all your friends that the Magpie is ready to fly! Share our video and help the spread the word. Thank you.

Please note: prices shown here are in dollars, but we do accept GB pounds and other currencies, please check conversion rates.

        Donate $70, and in addition to a copy of Issue Five, you will receive a limited edition archival art print of your choice.Donate $100 and you will receive one limited edition archival art print of your choice, as well as a copy of Issue Five and the 'We Blossom' compilation CD.Donate $140 and receive one of each limited edition archival art print (three in total), and a copy of Issue Five - Metamorphosis.Donate $160 and receive one of each limited edition archival art print (three in total), a copy of Issue Five - Metamorphosis and  a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD.Here are the three art pieces:Untitled by Aela LabbeThe Fates by Martha VerschaffelToutesoie by Cendrine Rovini---Donate $150 or more and in addition to receiving a copy of the fifth edition - Metamorphosis, a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD and a limited edition art print of your choice, you can also choose from one of these treasures...?under the pyramids?a custom crystal talismanEach Talisman holds four different crystals selected for their beauty & their power.It is contained in a glass vial from the 1930s.The chain is sterling silver.A little handmade booklet explaining the stones' properties & how to use the Talisman comes with each necklace.-Wolf & Moon Moth Necklaces





Available in wood

Pendants vary in size from approx. 7.5cm to 9cm in width.

Chain is 45cm silver/gold plated (as seen on each pendant in the photograph).
---Donate $300 or more and as well as receiving two copies of Issue Five, three limited edition art prints and a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD, you will also receive this one off, vintage Butterfly Collector's net, featured in the fifth edition of Magpie Magazine.this is a one only offerThe Butterfly Collector's Net
Vintage bamboo butterfly collector's net
featured within the pages of Issue Five, in 'the Riflemen' photoshoot by Topsy Design
46.25" height, 14.25" length, 21" width





---Daphne Descends JewelryDonate $500 or more and as well as receiving two copies of Magpie Magazine Issue Five, a copy of the 'We Blossom' compilation CD and all three limited edition prints... you will receive an amazing, one of a kind, handcrafted jewel by Laura Lambroni of Daphne Descends Arts&Crafts. (one chance offer) More information to follow.

---What you say about Magpie

here are just a handful of responses we've received about past issues...

I'd read the first two issues of Magpie Magazine with great delight but have to say Issue 3 is your best yet. It's simply fantastic! Well done! And long may it live.--oh I love reading it! the nest of magpie (the return address) is also very near where i'm from - it was like receiving a letter from home, but a secret letter full of magic and encouragement.thank you for bringing all this art together.--The Magpie's here already, faster than I'd expect if she were coming from the next town over! And the colors are so glorious... I'm not finished reading her yet. I loved the Deer-Woman story, especially the sentence it starts with: I turned back to the previous page three times before I was sure it was really the first sentence.The interview with Alessi is wonderful. Several of the things she recounts echo in me as a sympathetic vibration. We're so lucky to live in a time when a world-spanning harmonious family like this can be a reality, even though world-spanning horrors seemingly must also exist in such a time. --
The whole issue is wonderful, like a small breviary for berryhunters and birdwatchers, a refuge for woodlanders and forest dwellers, interspersed with faint hints of music and other tunes much deeper than just music.It's easily recognizable that you and all others put much effort into it and I know how hard it is to edit a zine these days, to prevent the individual strings of the contributions from diverging. There is this one line in your interview with Alessi that stands out of the whole magazine: "inserting magic into daily life". Yes, that's what it does. At least for me it did. The story of the deer woman is particularly beautiful.--Your Magpie Magazine is very well conceived - It was pretty much what I had anticipated - which is to say every word (and I am alert to the words) seems to promote a way of life ~ an outlook if you will, that I found absolutely delicious, of course, being a writer of fairytales such as I am. And yet you clearly have the one foot firmly placed in the real world. BUT! It's on your terms. And that's what I loved about the magazine. The resoluteness of vision. Soft, gentle yet firm somehow. -- ---What else you can do to helpWe greatly appreciate all your support and enthusiasm. Tell all your friends that the Magpie is ready to fly! Share our video and help the spread the word. Thank you.
Please note: prices shown here are in dollars, but we do accept GB pounds and other currencies, please check conversion rates.

story:
Helen Mary Jones - Tried and Trusted

When Helen Mary Jones was our Assembly member she:
  • Protected emergency services at Prince Philip Hospital
  • Helped deliver a £6.6 million investment for the Breast Care Centre at Prince Philip Hospital
  • Helped to save hundreds of jobs across Llanelli through the ProAct and ReAct schemes
  • Supported local businesses, campaigned for a better deal for market traders and independant shops
  • Helped over 5,000 families across our area

Your opportunity to help elect a local champion in Helen Mary Jones and a new Government for Wales!

We need to raise a minimum of £1,000 via crowdsourcing. All money raised will be used to fund Helen Mary Jones Assembly election campaign.  
Plaid Cymru, unlike all the mainstream parties is dependent on contributions from ordinary people, and every contribution makes a difference to our campaign.
  • £25 will help us print 500 leaflets
  • £50 will give us 20 garden posters - we want to see them up and down the Llanelli
  • £100 will help pay for an on-line advertising campaign
  • £1000 will pay for our NHS leaflet to be delivered during the coming weeks
YOU KNOW YOU CAN DEPEND ON HELEN MARY JONES TO GET THE JOB DONE!

Helen Mary Jones - Profiadol a Uchel ei Pharch

Pan oedd Helen Mary Jones yn Aelod Cynulliad drosom roedd hi wedi:

  • Amddiffyn ein gwasanaethau argyfwng yn Ysbyty Tywysog Philip
  • Helpu cyflwyno buddsoddiad o £6.6 miliwn at Ganolfan Cancr y Fron yn Ysbyty Tywysog Philip
  • Helpu i achub cannoedd o swyddi ar draws Llanelli drwy gynlluniau gweithredu
  • Cefnogi busnesau lleol ac ymgyrchu dros fargen well i fasnachwyr y farchnad a siopau annibynnol
  • Helpu dros 5,000 o deuluoedd ar draws yr Etholaeth

Eich cyfle chi i helpu ethol pencampwr lleol yn Helen Mary Jones a Llywodraeth newydd i Gymru! 

Mae angen inni godi £1,000 trwy ddull a elwir yn “crowdsourcing”.   Fe fydd yr holl arian a godir yn cael ei ddefnyddio i ariannu ymgyrch etholiad y Cynulliad Helen Mary Jones.  

Mae Plaid Cymru, yn anhebyg i'r prif bleidiau, yn ddibynnol ar gyfraniadau gan bobl gyffredin. Mae pob cyfraniad a gawn ni yn gwneud gwahaniaeth i’n hymgyrch.

  • £25    Talu am argraffu 500 o daflenni
  • £50    Talu am 20 poster gardd - hoffem weld y Llanelli yn llawn ohonynt
  • £100  Talu am hysbyseb ar y we
  • £1000 Talu am ein taflen Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol. 


HELEN YW'R UN I GYFLAWNI'R GWAITH!



Political Party Elections and Referendums Act 2000 (PPERA)

Under the Political Party Elections and Referendums Act 2000 (PPERA) you must be on the electoral register in the UK excluding the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man in order to make a donation of more than £500.

If you donate more than £1,500 to the Party, we are obliged under the Political Parties Elections and Referendums Act 2000 to report such a donation to the Electoral Commission, who will publish the fact that you have made a donation over £1,500. For more information, please see http://www.electoralcommission.gov.uk
During the election period we must also record and report all donations over £50.

Masur Etholiadau Pleidiau Gwleidyddol a Refferenda 2000

Yn ôl Mesur Etholiadau Pleidiau Gwleidyddol a Refferenda 2000 mae’n rhaid i chi fod ar y gofrestr etholiadol yn y DU gan eithrio Ynysoedd y Sianel ac Ynys Manaw er mwyn gwneud cyfraniad dros £500.

Os ydych am gyfrannu mwy na £7,500 I’r Blaid, mae dyletswydd arnom, o dan Fesur Etholiadau Pleidiau Gwleidyddol a Refferenda 2000 I rhoi gwybod I’r Comisiwn Etholiadol fyddai’n cyhoeddi’r ffaith eich bod wedi gwneud cyfraniad o dros £7,500. Am fwy o wybodaeth, ewch at http://www.electoralcommission.gov.uk

Yn ystod cyfnod yr etholiad bydd rhaid i ni gofnodi ac adrodd am bob cyfraniad dros £50.

story:
We've reached the goal!! Any contributions above and beyond will be a donation to Millennial Trains Project and the amazing things they do. 

If you'd like to contribute to the project for Look Up Art, visit LookUpArt.com 

You care about the community. You enjoy the beauty of murals, sculptures, and installations. You wish we had vibrant pieces of artwork instead of dull gray walls - or in this case, blank canvases. You want inspirational, thought-provoking, unique public art that engages, builds, and grows the community. 

Now is your chance to make a visible change to the personality of your town. Look Up Art focuses on gathering resources and data that will serve as a foundation for communities or artists trying to create public art. The process for creating such work often consists of many approvals and roadblocks, which prevents many of the projects from happening. I am here to make it easier. I'm here to gather the creative and logistical processes of public art and share them to inform and educate others. I will learn from cities that already have established public art programs and find out how they got there. As a result of this journey, I will package this information for all to learn from and implement in their community! 

Look Up Art

Look Up Art is dedicated to shedding light on how public art comes to life, creatively and logistically. In conjunction with Millennial Trains Project (MTP), Look Up Art will take a multi-city approach to studying current art projects and even those coming to fruition; even looking at the influence art can have on a city and it's surrounding communities. The findings from this trip will be applied locally and turned into an educational resource that provides background information and insights on how to create and expand the presence of public art. With your donation, you are helping to turn this trip and guide into a reality.

About me 

Hello! My name is Matt Bero, and I am an artist and advocate for public art; currently focusing my efforts in my hometown of Green Bay, WI, but with the hope of expanding my message to a wider audience. By day I am a digital designer, by night and weekends, I involve myself in the community and more specifically public art. Supporting it, helping to produce it, and creating awareness are all actions I take on a regular basis. Aside from Look Up Art, I am planning an art show, Catalyst, that will raise $10,000 for Art on Main, a public art program in Green Bay, WI. All of the funds raised by Catalyst will go towards the creation of more public art! 

 I am the creator of "Morty the Moose." Morty is a 63-foot wide mural located in the Arts District of Green Bay. With the help of Art on Main, Au Naturale, and The Production Farm, along with many others, Morty was born in October 2015.


This $5,000 goal for Look Up Art will secure my seat with MTP, and help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs. 

By contributing to this project, you will help to remove the barriers that prevent artists and communities from creating art like Morty, and instead, empower them to help their communities grow and their residents to be inspired. With the experience on MTP, we'll better understand what goes into a piece of public art and how we can create more! 

When starting on the endeavor of creating a 63-foot mural, I wasn't entirely sure how I was going to pull it off. There aren't many resources to teach you how to go about that. I had no idea how to get approval. The path wasn't easy, but I figured it out. My intention is to make this process easier. 

Reflecting on the completion, my eyes were opened to the impact this has on a community. 

  • Connected residents to each other and to the community they live in
  • Inspired other creative minds to take initiative and create a work of their own
  • Brightened up an area with vibrant colors creating an attraction for visitors to the city
  • Displayed an interest in the betterment of the community
  • Increased traffic to a developing area
  • Involved multiple non-profit organizations
    But most importantly...
  • It unites people
With your support, I will also be creating another mural in Green Bay! This mural will embody the energy and enthusiasm from the journey on the train.


About Millennial Trains Project

"MTP is basically a crowd-sourced adventure — that may well become the model for the 'new American road trip'...And it works." - National Geographic 
"MTP is an endeavor founded on the idea that people can change the world through intentional, shared experiences of travel, and that trains can carry and spread ideas as easily as they can grain or lumber, and with the intent of restoring faith in America's future." - Trains Magazine
But in their own words:

"We are an award-winning non-profit that leads crowd-funded transcontinental train journeys for diverse groups of young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers, grow as leaders, and launch projects that benefit and inspire their communities."

The Journey

"Unity" 
August 10-17
Los Angeles >> San Francisco >> Denver >> Milwaukee >> Detroit
At each stop, there will be a local showcase, featuring local innovation and where the city is headed from a creative development perspective. Then, I'll have 5-6 hours to advance the project by meeting with artists and community leaders to learn about their public art and challenges they might have encountered along the way. I'll also be documenting examples of public art, and talking with residents and business owners to discover the impact it made.
In addition to on-train discussions, leadership development, and design-thinking workshops, engagements with local leaders will focus on the communities we visit, and MTP participant projects will focus on opportunities and challenges that participants themselves are seeking to address on a national scale.
To learn more about life on the train and the Millennial Trains Project, visit: http://millennialtrain.co/
What We Need & What You Get
If this campaign is among the first 30 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, they will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs. 
If this project is not among the first 30 applicants to reach the crowdfunding goal, none of the supporters will be charged.

Perks!

  • $5 - Your name will be proudly displayed in blog post on the Look Up Art Website
  • $25 - Sticker pack and postcard


  • $50 - Indiegogo Exclusive - Look Up Art T-shirt
  • $75 - Printed Poster designed by Matt Bero. Includes T-shirt and Sticker pack.


  • $100 - Your Name/organization featured on the Look Up Art "Sponsors" page. Includes T-shirt + Sticker pack.
  • $125 - Limited (10) - Two tickets to Catalyst Art Show (Fall 2016) in Green Bay, WI. Details to follow. Includes T-shirt & Sticker pack
  • $250 - Limited (3) Become a catalyst for public art with four tickets to Catalyst Art Show (Fall 2016) in Green Bay, WI. Includes four Look Up Art T-shirts and sticker packs.

The Impact
  • Creating resources that teach artists and communities how to create public art/public art programs with processes, guides, and information!  
  • A website to host these resources!
  • Upon my return, I will design a mural that will embody the energy and enthusiasm from the journey. The mural will be located in Green Bay, WI.
  • Inspiration! I'm looking forward to sharing what I learn on this adventure in hopes that other artists and communities will make changes to expand public art. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Quantifying the benefits of public art will be difficult, especially in a short period of time, however Look Up Art has no expiration date.
  • Time - I'll only have about 5 or 6 hours in each city to meet with artists, community leaders, and government officials. I'll have to be strategic in choosing who to meet and what to explore.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Don't fret if you cannot contribute monetarily! You can help this project move forward by sharing it! Let your friends and family know, let your neighbors know, let your city officials know, let your schools know, let everyone know that together we can create positive change in our communities. 

You read all the way to the bottom?! You're a rock star. Thank you for you interest and support. I truly believe that public art has the potential to create waves of positive change and you'll be surprised by the impact it makes. 

"The great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do."
- Walter Bagehot

story:
PLEASE SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH

 

"a TRASH OF PEST magazin fővárosunk törött tükre melynek darabjai összeszedve és újraragasztva mutatják be szeretett lakhelyünk mocskos arcát." - Domán Szabó

a magazin ONLINE VERZIÓJÁT ITT tekinthetitek meg 

Kedves kontribútor!

Lili és Domi vagyunk, a Trash of Pest zine képszerkesztője és a Trash of Pest Facebook csoport alapítója! 

„Gyönyörű városunk magában rejti a mocskot és groteszk képeket melyek varázsolják igazán érdekessé és szórakoztatóvá élőhelyünket, sokszor már fel sem tűnik, de ha valami különlegesen ótvart látsz töltsd bátran. „ – áll a FB csoport magyarázatában.

 

És nem is más a Trash of Pest mint a budapestiek által hétköznapokon elkapott pillanatok egyvelege. A másfél éve pár baráttal indult csoport mára 2500 fölötti létszámmal van jelen és ez folyamatosan nő.

Nagy lelkesedéssel vágtunk neki pár hónapja a zine elkészítésének, mert úgy érezzük ez végre valami igazán Pesti, valami ami igazán a miénk. Szennyes, keserédes, humoros, néha bizakodó, néha elszomorító, de tuti, hogy köntörfalazás mentes. 

Az eredetileg csak FB csoportot azért szeretnénk kézzel fogható mini magazinná alakítani, mert minden képet ami egyszer bekerül, like-olnak, love-olnak netán wow-oznak... aztán gyorsan tovatűnik a csoportfal végtelen süllyesztőjében már már megsiratunk. és ez szomorú.

Ezen szeretnénk változtatni és hű helyet biztosítani nekik egy kiadvány sorozatban!

Mint sok dolog az életben, ez is egy nagy akadályba ütközött,

Itt jöttök TI a képbe!

Elsősorban azért döntöttünk a crowd funding mellett, mert imádjuk a projektet és tovább szeretnénk vinni később, egy kiadványsorozat formájában (ahogy föntebb már mondtuk). De akármennyire is trash a trash, MI időtálló, minőségi, precíz zine-t/ket szeretnénk nektek bemutatni, így nyomdában, ujrahasznosított papírra lesz kinyomva minden példány.

Elég nagy volt az érdeklődés ahogy meglengettük a zine ötletét, egy-egy darabot ki tudunk nyomtatni önerőből, de már pl 50-et sajnos nem.

tehát mire is kéne a zsozsó :

- egy példány ára nagyobb példányszámnál , papírral együtt, középtűzéssel - kb 800 huf/db 

ehhez jönnek még a továbbiak:

- boríték - 50 huf/db 

- járulékok - kb 200 huf/db 

- postaköltség  - 170-350 huf/db 

                                                                       

összesen tehát : 1220 - 1300 huf/db azaz kb  €4,2o

Az idő amit belefektettünk pedig nem volt rengeteg, de azért az is ment bele bőven!

Így ti is láthatjátok, hogy nem ezzel fogunk bankot robbantani, viszont egyedül, egyszerre nem tudunk kipengetni annyit, hogy mindenkinek jusson aki szeretne!

A zine-ben természetesen minden alkotó neve aki a képeket készítette fel van tüntetve, nem ékeskedünk senki más tollaival, viszont piedesztálra emeljük az aklotóinkat!

Iszonyú szuper lenne, ha bedobnátok a perselyünkbe egy pár kanyit, hogy mi is és ti is a Budapesti szennyes hétköznapokat hamarosan ne csak onlájn pörgethessétek! 

puszi, pacsi
Domi, Lili 

                                             

“TRASH OF PEST is the broken mirror of our capital, that flashes you our beloved hometown’s filthy face with carefully gathered and re-glued pieces.” Doman Szabo

You can find the magazine's online version HERE

Dear Contributor!

 

We are Lili and Domi, the picture editor of Trash of Pest zine and the founder of Trash of Pest FB group!

“This group is based on our loved cities trash side, if you see something extraordinary feel free to share your experience.“ – states the FB group’s description.

And Trash of Pest isn’t anything else but the collection of snapshots taken on the streets of Budapest by the locals.  The group began with a few friends a year and a half ago, today it has over 2500 members and growing.

A couple of months ago we started taking action with immense amounts of enthusiasm towards making the zine, because we felt like it’s finally something truly Pest, something truly ours. Filthy, bittersweet, humorous, sometimes hopeful, sometimes saddening, but one thing for sure, it doesn’t beat around the bush.

We’d like to turn the originally only FB group into a small format magazine because every picture that has been uploaded once gets “liked”, “loved”, at times “wowed”…then it rapidly evanishes in the infinite countersink of the group’s wall… and we just about wail over them. Now that is sad.

We’d like to change that; give them the celebration they deserve by printing and preserving them for generations in not just one, but in a series of publications!

And like many things in life, this project also hit a snag,

This is where YOU come in the picture!

First of all we have decided on crowd funding because we adore the project and would like to take it further later as a series of publications (as we mentioned above).  But no matter how trash is Trash, WE would like to present you with long lasting, quality, precise zine/s, so they will be printed on recycled paper at a professional printer.

When we first threw in the idea of a zine there was quite high interest by the group members and friends and we could print out one or two copies but we don’t have the resources for for example 50+ copies.

so what we need the moneyz for:

one copy – if printed in bigger amounts, on recycled paper and stitching – approx. €2, 60

some other extra costs:

  • envelope – €0.20
  • charges - approx. €0.65
  • post – €1-€2 (non hun. address)

                                                                                 

all together approx. €4,20 - €5,50

You can see we won’t really hit the jackpot with the profit; but we simply can’t print enough without your support.

All artists are rightfully credited in the zine, we don’t try to show off with other birds shiny feathers!

It would be fantastic if you could drop a few beans into our piggy bank so you and we both could start flicking through Trash of Pest in reality not just online!

xoxo

Domi, Lili
story_txt:

story:
The Ultimate Creation

To some this may not sound like an art project but we can tell you as full-time professional artist this is the ultimate creation. 


Michelle does clothing and painting www.michellelance.com and Roark does sculpture and photography www.roarkgourley.com. 

We have already created two beautiful daughters, currently 16 and 9, and they are our greatest creations… of course they are still a work in process but they are both outstanding artists and students. 

 

 Elle - Artist (check out the shoes) Gamer, Video Editor, Cyber Kid

 

Anya - A+ Student, Actress, Musician, Dancer, Artist

Our new creation was not planned (like a lot of our art pieces) so we were not ready for this one. We never thought we would have a 3rd child and that it would have to be a miracle for something like this to happen. Well a miracle happened! Betty Gourley (Roark’s mom) passed a way in February, 2013 and then Michelle got pregnant shortly thereafter...first thoughts in our heads was it’s Betty Boop!

The baby is a healthy boy per the ultrasound and DNA testing...his name is Morgan Darby Gourley, which means Free by the Sea. He is due March 1st, Chinese year of the horse and Pisces, so our little seahorse!

Baby Morgan- first underwater picture

Surviving as artists in this economy has its up and downs.... We both are very productive but times have been tough. We have insurance but the deductible is a high deductible of $8500.00. Monies need to be in place by week 36. Michelle is 22 weeks as of 10/20/2013. Due date is March 1st, 2014.

In order to have a healthy baby and safe birth, we need your support and participation. Donations will go toward:

-prenatal care
-tests
-the birth

Most of you will be are direct friends and family who we sent the link to this site. We feel this is a very fun and simple way to contribute to Baby Morgan. Instead of a baby present, this is your gift. We HIGHLY encourage you to forward this to your friends and family and people that you know that love the creation of life. Anyone can participate and they can let us know who they are and get some of the fun perks or they can be anonymous.

Your help will be greatly appreciated! If the proceeds to this campaign exceeds the $8500, monies above and beyond will go toward baby well care visits, diapers, etc. as the list goes on...

Perks

We are going to do a special underwater shoot with Michelle pregnant so you have a choice of pictures of Morgan OR Michelle's photo shoot.


1. Pen Pal - $10 listed in Morgan's baby book as a supporter!


2. Playdate Buddy - $20  all the above plus email announcement of birth with online gallery pictures of Baby Morgan and underwater shoot.

3. Cousin- $50  Button with Morgan's smiling little face OR button of Michelle underwater photo shoot AND site access to pictures and video with weekly updates.

or


4. Kissing Cousin- $100  all the above plus Baby Morgan coffee mug OR mug of Michelle underwater photo shoot..

or


5. Big Brother- $250  all the above plus T-shirt with Morgan OR T-shirt of Michelle underwater photo shoot.

or



6. Big Sister- $500   all the above plus 11" x 17" Fine Art print of Morgan OR Michelle underwater photo shoot.

or


7. Uncle- $1000  all the above plus Book of Morgan's 1st 12 months OR book of Michelle underwater photo shoot.

or


8. Aunty- $2500  all the above plus Meet or Skype with Morgan monthly!


9. God Parents- $8500  all the above plus invitational to underwater photo shoot  of Michelle and a special one of a kind book and DVD movie of Michelle's photo shoot underwater and special moments with Morgan.

Special thanks - Lisa Berman at nine months

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone!  We are Mel Dominguez (painter, visual artist, muralist) and Carla Turco (graphic designer), artistic affiliates with Safos Dance Theatre. Together, we are embarking on “Color the Mural: A Community Mural Project.” Safos is an emerging dance company in Tucson, AZ that creates modern dance unique to the U.S.-Mexico borderland experience. Safos is a multi-disciplinary company and committed to creating contemporary artistic forms that reflect the common experiences of our diverse community.

Color the Mural will highlight the 50+ year history of the House of Neighborly Service in South Tucson, including stories from local residents who grew up with HNS. We are utilizing a new mural technique where we trace the mural out on pellon, cut it into squares like a quilt and take it out into the community to paint. This enables us to reach more people in the community, from elders to youth, and paint the squares indoors without having to paint on the wall in the desert heat. We are very passionate about this project because the mural arts can bring communities together.

What We Need & What You Get

We need YOUR help!

Your generous contribution will help us purchase the supplies we need to paint the mural!!  We need everything from paint, pellon, sealant, glue, brushes, aprons and a utility sink (to wash those brushes!). 

We have exciting perks for every donation level!  Including:

·  A shout out on facebook and twitter

·  A Color the Mural package with Color the Mural post cards and tattoos!

·  Your very own Color the Mural T-shirt!

·  Greeting cards with photos by the amazing Dominic Arizona Bonuccelli, photographer for Rick Steves

·  A personalized sketch by Mel

·  A private class of your choice (yoga, salsa dance, modern dance, belly dance, paper making, IntenSati) from one of Safos dancers!

No matter how much we raise, all funds will go to purchasing supplies for the mural!

Safos is a recognized 501(c) (3) nonprofit organization #27-0232799. All contributions support Safos and are fully tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

The Impact

Your donation will make a huge difference!  Without paints and supplies, there is no mural and THAT is what you are giving to the South Tucson community and beyond. Your contribution is an integral part in bring beauty to the HNS campus and surrounding area and provide a safe space for artistic expression and empowerment through the arts. This project can serve as a starting point for discussions around clean and healthy communities and the role of youth and their parents in civic society. YOU can help make Safos and HNS’s shared vision of the City of South Tucson and surrounding areas as a healthier and vibrant community which benefits the public good.

Safos has successfully completed community-based arts education programs and crowd funded projects in the past.  We are confident that with your support, we will be successful in this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a two year project and we will in addition to cash donations for supplies!  Here are some other ways you can help! 

·  Donate items!  We need brushes (all sizes!), pellon (the thin one), plastic table cloths, aprons (all sizes so YOU won't get paint on your clothes), printing (fake tattoos, postcards, t-shirts, cards), we are looking for videographers and photographers to document the project and most importantly

·  PAINTING!! We will need YOU to help us paint. Sign up to our newsletter if you'd like to COLOR THE MURAL. We'll email you when and where we'll be stationed. To sign up just text the words COLORTHEMURAL to 22828.

Everyone, please help us get the word out about this project and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Resumen:

  • Hola mundo! soy Jose Carlos Rebimbas Quintero y la música es mi vida! no hay un día que no este presente en mi. impulsándome, inspirándome, dándome fuerzas! es mi mayor pasión y vengo desarrollándola desde que era un niño. desde siempre me he considerado un afortunado por este don que tengo de hacer canciones y sueño cada día con poder materializar cada vez mas y mas ideas y hacer mas colaboraciones con otros artistas.  A la fecha tengo mas de 300 canciones (de mi proyecto solista) listas para ser producidas! es por eso que hoy presento esta campaña Multi-Dream   El objetivo: la culminación de 7 obras fonográficas (En las que vengo trabajando arduamente y ya están casi listas) y de sobrepasar la meta tener la posibilidad de producir mucha mas música! te invito a ser parte de este sueño. Mi perfil en SoundCloud! d-.-b
    •  
  • Multi-Dream es una campaña pro fondos para terminar 7 proyectos discográficos que vengo desarrollando de manera independiente y simultánea. todos en avanzado estado de producción. proyectos de diferentes géneros y estilos (Rock, Reggae, Punk, Ska, Folk, Acústico, Baladas, Electrónica, experimental, entre otras sonoridades) estos últimos años he entregado mi cuerpo y alma al desarrollo de estos álbumes, hechos con todo el mucho cariño y amor del mundo, pero ahora necesito tu apoyo para terminarlos! súmate a la causa! apoya este Multi sueño sonoro!
    •  
  • Apoyando esta multi campaña apoyas a mas de 30 músicos y artistas (diseñadores y creativos) vinculados con el oficio de la creación de todo esto! con tu apoyo tendremos la posibilidad de finalizar (mezclas y masterizaciones de mas de 70 temas) y continuar creando, que es nuestra mas grande pasión! hacer mas música y compartirla con todos ustedes!

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
 
  • Necesitamos 12000 dólares para mezclar y masterizar mas de 70 canciones.
  • Los fondos serán utilizados equitativamente entre cada uno de los proyectos: Cielito Drive, Jose Reb, Los Monoplonicos, Son Broders, Monet, Language Troubles y Marte & Remolino. (por ejemplo:) hay algunos discos que aun tienen cositas pendientes por grabar para empezar el proceso de mezcla (en este caso los fondos serán para terminar la grabación) hay discos que ya están en proceso de mezcla (en este caso los fondos serán para terminar mezcla y masterización) 
  • De sobre pasar la meta, lo cual esperamos! esos fondos serán utilizados en promoción y la compra de equipos para mejorar el estudio donde gran parte de estos proyectos han sido gestados y en el que por supuesto nacerán muchos otros! hay muchos artistas en nuestras ciudad que queremos apoyar en la materialización sus ideas, haremos que el Multi-sueño se expanda y trascienda!
  • Lo que obtendrás a cambio de tu apoyo será la música y según tu aporte algunos detalles especiales.






 

El impacto!

  • Apoyar el arte es apoyar la vida! apoya los sueños de todos los que estamos vinculados en esto a seguir adelante! no es un camino facil, pero sin duda es el camino mas bello entre todos caminos ¿que seria de la vida sin la música? ¿sin el arte? 
  • Apoya el emprendimiento cultural! los deseos de hacer algo tan bello como lo es la música es contribuir hacer del mundo un lugar mejor.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayuda
  • Apoyamos compartiendo esta campaña con quien consideres que pueda sumarse a la materialización este gran sueño sonoro y QUE VIVA LA MÚSICA!
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Hello world, mi name is Jose Carlos Rebimbas Quintero and this is my story.       I was born in Caracas, Venezuela. My mom is from Colombia and my father from Portugal. Since I am a kid music and these multiple cultures have been part of my life. I grew up in love with music and art, breathing and feeling these since always. At age seven i had my first musical instrument, the “cuatro” a beautiful instrument from my homeland Venezuela. with it, I did my first compositions and since then I knew that the music and I would have a long journey together. at age ten I moved to Colombia, my second home, and at fourteen I transitioned to the guitar. A whole new world of possibilities arrived with it, I had my first bands and projects that didn’t leave the rehearsal room but that allowed me to experiment with sounds and to interact with other music that like me were empirics.

Years passed and brought Cielo Drive of Cielito which how i like to call it.cielito is the project in which i have created more music, I was able to I have my first concerts, record songs, records, we were played in the radio, made video clips. I saw the faces of many peoples feeling happy when we played for them.With Cielito I started my career in the world of music, this world that many call “the world of entertainment”or “the music business”and it was then when my headaches also started.

i begun to understand and learn how everything  happens within this world, how the business works. These ways has perturbed me since then. It makes me upset to see how power relations and money you might have to promote your project is more important than the talent itself. For me everything was about the creative and humanistic process of making music. I never saw it as a business so it was hard to face how vicious and manipulative the business can be. By not playing thses games many doors were closed, but being independent also opened many others. 

It’s been a long and hard road that I will continue to  walk…

in the last 4 years, day by day I breath and emanate music. I have been developing a lot of new ideas, songs, and right now I have about 300 songs ready to be produced. These is why, today, finally, I have decided to launch my first crowfunding campaign. I will call it “MULTI DREAM”

I had thought about it many times before, but I didn’t, perhaps because I was afraid not to reach the goal, or that my ideas weren’t attractive enough for my community of donors. This is the right moment, so I will tell you what this multi dream campaign is about. I already told you about Cielito Drive. my first and most loved project, not only for all it has represented in my life, also because of all I have learned quite a lot and I have produced the most music with them. But my passion and love for music have brought me to eight projects!!! I am devoted and inlove with each of them.

Jose Reb is my second project, my solo project. It was born from the need of singing and recording the songs that didn’t make it in Cielito! je! and for my surprise it has been well received. more than I expected. With this project I have recorded songs with two great producers and friends ..... . As today we have ten songs in process of recording and mixing. 

Los monoplonicos is my third project, and is a band i have with one of my lieftime friends Ricardo..... I started as a pianist and now I am the drummer. This is a power trio influenced by Latin-American and European rock. And it’s been a wonderful because of the freedom and magic we experience when we create and play music. We are finishing up our first EP with 5 songs.


Son brothers is my fourth project, is duo of alternative music I have with another great friend and music partner Oscar...This project was born because every time we got together it was inevitable to make music, so we create everything it occurs to us, without limitations or pretensions. We just let our bodies and spirits be the medium. We use synthesizer, beats, our rhythm machinery and a lot of humor when we make songs. We just came up with our EP, produced independently and now we are preparing our second album, much more risky and experimental than the first.  monet is my fifth project, a band with my friend Rene Mazilli. When Rene showed me his songs I just couldn’t resist to participate. I am the drummer and producer. I have to admit that I really like this project, as much as the previous ones, but the availability of the musicians and the resources are limited, which makes the processes  pretty slow. 

LT is my sixth project, is a due i have with a german friend I met in Barranquilla, and we need up making music together. he is like a twin soul that you don’t expect to find but that unexpectedly appear from nowhere. We have an album with 10 super energetic and fun songs already recorded, the album is in process of mixing. 

Marte y remolino is my seventh project and not for being seventh is the less important but is the one is paper and preproduction. it is a dream duo I have with my son, yes, I have a seven year old son with whom I have been creating.    I am teaching him to love music and art. He is super talented. it is beautiful thing i that he is a musician like me and his mother whom is also a musician. We support him to develop all of his talents.

This project is a result of thousands of ideas that we have when we are together. We start with the guitar, I give him melodies so he can improvise and from there everything becomes magic. The ideas is to record 10 of our best compositions and invite other children to participate. To conclude I want to share other collaboration I have been working on with other musicians and friends. Music is all to me and everytome i have the chance t make music with anyone who comes across my path I do it. without a doubt.

I am asking for your support so I can finish  all of these projects that inspire me so much and fill my spirit with life and love.  The resources will be used mostly for  mix and mastering, because everything is mostly recorded. I will acquire equipment I need for my home studio, where I will also develop the projects of other new artist artist that like me can make quality music but lack optimum resources and spaces to make their recording and move forward in their careers. this is basically my story and the propose of this campaign. Along the years making music I have learned to wear all hats; artist, manager, producer, pr, rodie, everything. I have a training in making albums with minimal budgets, to be resourceful. 

I love music. It is what move me, and inspires me. I desire with my whole being to be able  to live not just from making music, but to live IN the music. creating, developing, recording and sharing and collaborating with other musicians in an eternal multi dream. In this campaign, I offer you in exchange for your support all the music i have made and will make for free, in the format you want, digital, cd, vinyl, depending on the amount of the donation. 

Than you very much for listening and for supporting me!!! 

I will leave you with a saying used by the street merchants in my town: every single coin will be received with gratitude. 

I thank you infinitely, much light, hugs, love

Real talk.

story:
Video still from In Transit, intransitfilm.com

My Project

Thank you for considering a donation to help me develop innovative arts and cultural experiences on, around, and inspired by long distance trains!

I was accepted as a participant for a one-week long project incubator on a train and would be grateful for your support to make it happen. The Transit Center, a national public transportation advocacy organization, has generously offered to fund a portion of the project and I'm here to raise as much of the rest as I can. During the week-long journey and afterwards, I hope to:

  • Develop an organization that commissions and curates arts and cultural activities on America's underutilized passenger rail network
  • Partner with national transportation advocacy groups to build awareness and support for national rail infrastructure

Background

A few years ago I discovered the beauty of train travel. I became so entranced by the unique and humanizing qualities of the train -- perhaps America's most underappreciated public space -- that I made it the topic of my master's thesis at the MIT Department of Urban Studies & Planning last year. You can read more about that project here: https://nextcity.org/daily/entry/what-long-distance-trains-teach-us-about-public-space-in-america and here: http://danyasherman.tumblr.com/

Riding slowly through the beautiful and diverse geographies of America, with time to reflect and meet people from the landscapes you travel through, is an incredible experience and one that not enough people have. Long distance U.S. trains are designed to facilitate unique personal and social experiences while they move people from place to place. But financially, our passenger rail system was set up to fail, leaving transit riders (especially those away from the coasts and in rural areas) with few options for inter-city travel.

Given how underutilized and yet how special our national rail system is, I'd like to partner with artists and cultural organizers around the country to spark new work and promote public transit.

My Background

I am an urban planner, cultural programmer, organizer, and writer with over ten years of experience in urban development and community engagement. I founded and built the Department of Public Programs, Education, and Community Engagement for the High Line in New York, NY to ensure that the park was an an asset and platform for all New Yorkers, and then left to complete a master's degree at the MIT Department of Urban Studies & Planning. I am currently based at MIT, developing multimedia case studies about urban development that has a positive social impact. I've worked on projects with ArtPlace America, the San Francisco Public Utilities Commission, Project Row Houses -- all with a focus on building and supporting democratic cultural activity.

The Journey

With your support, I will be joining 25 other young civic entrepreneurs on a one-week journey from Los Angeles to Detroit by train this August. I will be stopping in cities along the way to meet with transit leaders, curators, and others to understand local transit dynamics and explore projects and partnerships. While on board, I will benefit from leaders and facilitated sessions that will help us all get our ideas to the next stage.

This is all possible thanks to the the Millenial Trains Project (MTP), an award-winning 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads transcontinental train journeys for young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers. This an officially-approved campaign for one of MTP's August 2016 journeys. More about MTP can be found here: http://www.millennialtrain.co/

    The Impact

    Your contributions will underwrite expenses associated with the journey (on-train accommodation, meals, and all MTP-related programming activities), and all are tax-deductible.

    I hope to create a new initiative that will engage artists, curators, transit riders, and transit officials around the country in developing innovative cultural experiences and raising awareness about the politics of public transit. I want this initiative to help create a culture of transit riders and promote policy shifts to support public infrastructure.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please spread the word to others who you think might contribute -- and thank you again for the consideration!

story:
THE PROJECT

As an animal lover I am proud to call Perth in Western Australia my home. I feel so fortunate to be able to drive only a short distance to be amongst native flora and fauna some would only see in books or film.

Almost 550 species of birds have been recorded in Western Australia. 387 species have been recorded breeding. 17 species are endemic to Western Australia. These are Carnaby's Black-Cockatoo, Baudin's Black-Cockatoo, Western Corella, Western Rosella, Red-capped Parrot, Noisy Scrub-bird, Red-winged Fairy-wren, Black Grasswren, Western Bristlebird, Dusky Gerygone, Western Thornbill, Western Wattlebird, Kimberley Honeyeater, Western Spinebill, White-breasted Robin, Western Ground Parrot and Red-eared Firetail. - Information supplied by Birdlife Australia.

A short time ago I was made aware of the current situation of the Western Ground Parrot. There are fewer than 150 of these birds left on our planet. These birds may no longer be around in the not so distant future. I began thinking about how I could possibly use my skills as an artist to help people become aware of the birds that are special to certain areas of Western Australia. If I could paint a mural of a bird on a wall close to where it is located than maybe people will start to take notice. If they were aware of it, maybe they would want to learn more about the species. If they learn more about the species maybe then they would realise how lucky we are to have a bird found nowhere else in Australia but our state.

I would like to think that in 100 years time we will still have all 17 of our endemic birds alive and well in their natural habitat....but we just don't know.

 

THE PROCESS

I will be collaborating with Western Australian photographers to create the murals I will be painting. The photographer will take a photo of the bird in the area it is known to frequent. I will then use the photograph as reference and, in my style, create a mural on the closest possible wall surface. Below the mural will be the name of the bird, the location, the photographer and my website. I am hoping that, with this project, I can share the special experience of collaborating with photographers and possibly create future possibilities for them by sharing their name. Each mural will be covered from start to finish on my website blog.

 

THE FIRST MURAL

To give you all a better idea of the project here is the first mural of the project which I completed at the start of July. The bird chosen was the Western Spinebill which was photographed by Gary Meredith in the Dryandra Woodlands near Narrogin.

Photo of Western Spinebill taken by Gary Meredith

Concept created on Photoshop with Gary's photo

Lions Village, Dryandra mural location (within 1km from where photo was taken)

The finished mural

WITH YOUR HELP

Your contributions to my fundraiser will help me paint three of the birds located in the north-west of Western Australia.

The money you help raise will pay for my artist rate, travel needed to reach locations, paint and materials and payment for the photographers.

With your help we can all educate the people of western Australia about the special birds we share our environment with.

These are the locations I will be looking at painting the murals.
story_txt:
THE PROJECT
As an animal lover I am proud to call Perth in Western Australia my home. I feel so fortunate to be able to drive only a short distance to be amongst native flora and fauna some would only see in books or film.
Almost 550 species of birds have been recorded in Western Australia. 387 species have been recorded breeding. 17 species are endemic to Western Australia. These are Carnaby's Black-Cockatoo, Baudin's Black-Cockatoo, Western Corella, Western Rosella, Red-capped Parrot, Noisy Scrub-bird, Red-winged Fairy-wren, Black Grasswren, Western Bristlebird, Dusky Gerygone, Western Thornbill, Western Wattlebird, Kimberley Honeyeater, Western Spinebill, White-breasted Robin, Western Ground Parrot and Red-eared Firetail. - Information supplied by Birdlife Australia.
A short time ago I was made aware of the current situation of the Western Ground Parrot. There are fewer than 150 of these birds left on our planet. These birds may no longer be around in the not so distant future. I began thinking about how I could possibly use my skills as an artist to help people become aware of the birds that are special to certain areas of Western Australia. If I could paint a mural of a bird on a wall close to where it is located than maybe people will start to take notice. If they were aware of it, maybe they would want to learn more about the species. If they learn more about the species maybe then they would realise how lucky we are to have a bird found nowhere else in Australia but our state.
I would like to think that in 100 years time we will still have all 17 of our endemic birds alive and well in their natural habitat....but we just don't know.
 
THE PROCESS
I will be collaborating with Western Australian photographers to create the murals I will be painting. The photographer will take a photo of the bird in the area it is known to frequent. I will then use the photograph as reference and, in my style, create a mural on the closest possible wall surface. Below the mural will be the name of the bird, the location, the photographer and my website. I am hoping that, with this project, I can share the special experience of collaborating with photographers and possibly create future possibilities for them by sharing their name. Each mural will be covered from start to finish on my website blog.
 
THE FIRST MURAL
To give you all a better idea of the project here is the first mural of the project which I completed at the start of July. The bird chosen was the Western Spinebill which was photographed by Gary Meredith in the Dryandra Woodlands near Narrogin.

Photo of Western Spinebill taken by Gary Meredith

Concept created on Photoshop with Gary's photo

Lions Village, Dryandra mural location (within 1km from where photo was taken)

The finished mural
WITH YOUR HELP
Your contributions to my fundraiser will help me paint three of the birds located in the north-west of Western Australia.
The money you help raise will pay for my artist rate, travel needed to reach locations, paint and materials and payment for the photographers.
With your help we can all educate the people of western Australia about the special birds we share our environment with.

These are the locations I will be looking at painting the murals.

story:
- Hello!  My name is Rae Vena I am 23 year old traveler and Visionary surrealist painter, from Cleveland Ohio . ---> A few days ago, it was announced,  I am selected as a supporting Live artist for ENVISION festival 2013 in Costa Rica!    I am excited for this huge opportunity to share my artwork along-side many Internationally renowned artists!   www.facebook.com/RAEVENAartist 

OMGOOSH WE DID IT!!!  BIG thank you to all my contributors , & my sponsor Garrett K.  for pre-purchasing my painting I will create LIVE at Envision!  Extra money donated past my goal will go toward my $100 airport shuttle, & food costs.

Your Contribution   - As a backer of this project , not only will you be supporting my travel costs to Costa Rica for my live art performance at ENVISION, but also to my artistic growth, and professional development.   I have spent the last 3 summers traveling with my live art  performance to festivals nationwide.   Below are photos of the 4 paintings I painted LIVE on my summer tour last year!  I call them the :: Evolution of expression series.  For the first time these works are featured as stickers and archival prints as my perks for this project!  

  

"Rainbows vs the elements"    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

               "Summer Self Expression"

"The hands that Inspire"

          "Little baby kitty in a shell in a bubble in outer space"

 

 For your donation

I have compiled this list of special gifts to send for your gracious donations!   Perks for contribution include limited painted sketches, and postcards that will be made during my stay in Costa Rica <3      

 $5- A surprise sticker, thank you message and email with photos of my trip , and Link to my facebook fan page so you can explore Costa Rica along-side me! 

$10- A personalized postcard  & thank you and sticker sent from Costa Rica!

$25- A mini Original! sketch (3.5 x5 inch) made during my trip to Costa Rica! ALL NEW 4 piece sticker set of paintings from my 2012 Evolution of expression series, & personalized postcard & thank you sent from Costa Rica!      (photo below shows my previous  sticker set, the gift set is ALL NEW images!)

$40-  Choice of one - ALL NEW 7x10 inch Archival Giclee print from my 2012 Evolution of expression series , A small original  sketch (5x6 inch) made during my trip to Costa Rica,  4 piece sticker pack and personalized postcard  & thank you sent from Costa Rica!          (photo below  features my all new UNRELEASED archival prints!)

$60-  One framed original painted sketch (8x 8  inch) made during my trip to Costa Rica!  , a 4 piece sticker pack, and a  personalized postcard & thank you sent from Costa Rica! (photo below shows the sizes of sketches available!)

$100+ One- 8 x10  Archival Giclee print from my 2012 Evoultion of expression series (your choice of print)   AND one framed original  5 x 8 inch painted sketch from my trip to Costa Rica!

$300+ My original painting, created LIVE at Envision festival in Costa Rica!               along with a mention on my website, a hand written letter of graditude along with all the other goodies above!

  Other Ways You Can Help

I know that I'm not the only one with financial problems, so if you can't donate financially, consider donating a few minutes of your time instead to help my project gain some exposure. - share on your facebook, twitter or other social media network!
 Thank you for taking the time to read my project 

love, Rae vena

www.RAEVENA.com   

www.facebook.com/RAEVENAartist

Link to the ENVISION live artist line-up::   www.2013.envisionfestival.com/index.php/experience/art-installations/itemlist/category/55-live-painters

 

Live art performance summer 2012! above photo by Brad Zickafoose

 

 

 



 

 

Check out more photos in my gallery!

story:
ImaginARTE: A Nationwide Paraguayan Art Camp

The Challenge:

As a fledgling democracy emerging from a long era of dictatorship, Paraguay’s sociopolitical climate often limits arts education, thereby resulting in inhibited individual expression and low self-esteem. In early 2007, CoCuMu (Compartiendo Cultura Mundial or Sharing World Culture) was formed, originally as a Peace Corps volunteer committee seeking to promote arts and culture within Paraguay and cross-cultural exchange between Paraguay and other countries. As a result, throughout the years, CoCuMu has been slowly evolving, along with community counterparts such as the Secretaría Nacional de Cultura and SENATUR (the cultural and tourism agencies of Paraguay), such as Ahecha Paraguay (“I see Paraguay”in Guaraní, Paraguay's official language along with Spanish) a participatory photography project, Ahendu Paraguay ("I listen Paraguay"), a music-exchange concert and Ascrivi Paraguay (“I write Paraguay”) a creative writing project that also promotes literacy.

However, connecting youth with ways of artistic expression is still a work in progress. The Camp ImaginARTE was created with the intention of broadening the horizon of Paraguayan youth about visual and performing arts as a way of life, of embracing their cultural identity and furthermore, of providing them skills of self assurance and empowerment, that later they will use in all aspects of their lives.

El Reto:

Con una democracia que recién emerge de una era dictatorial, el marco sociocpolítico del Paraguay aún enfrenta retos en la formación creativa y artística de las generaciones jóvenes, que de alguna manera se ve reflejado en la inhibición de expresión y baja autestima de éstos. A principios del 2007, el comité CoCuMu (Compartiendo Cultura Mundial) se formó como resultado de una iniciativa de voluntarios de Cuerpo de Paz para promover las artes y la cultura dentro del Paraguay y entre otros países. Como resultado, CoCuMu ha ido evolucionando, de la mano con contrapartes paraguayos como la Secretaría Nacional de Cultura y la SENATUR  (agencias de gubernamentales de cultura y turismo respectivamente) como Ahecha Paraguay ("Yo veo a Paraguay" en Guaraní, idioma oficial del Paraguay") un proyecto participativo de fotografía, Ahendu Paraguay ("Yo escucho a Paraguay), un proyecto de intercambio musical y cultural. y Ascrivi Paraguay ("Yo escribo a Paraguay") que consiste en talleres de escritura creativa. 

No obstante, la posibilidad de conectar a la juventud con maneras de expresión artística está aún paulatinamente progresando. El Campamento ImaginARTE fue creado con la intención de expandir los horizontes de jóvenes paraguayos sobre las artes visuales y performáticas, exponerles a actividades en donde exploren su capacidad como entes culturales y artísticos mientras conocen su propia cultura, y además, proveerles con herramientas de empoderamiento y seguridad en sí mismos, que luego utilizarán en su día a día. 

The Opportunity:

The Paraguayan youth make up more than half of the current population, thus, it is crucial to address this age group and provide them with a set of skills they will eventually use to steer the country's own future, and what a better way to do this than artistic expression? By providing the atmosphere for inspiration and creativity, we can also encourage the youth to use the arts as a tool to discover themselves. ImaginARTE will be the stage, the youth will be the artists. 

La Oportunidad:

La juventud paraguaya representa la mitad de la población del país. Por ende, es crucial atender a este grupo y proveerle herramientas que eventualmente usarán para dirigir el futuro del país, ¿y qué mejor manera de hacerlo que a través de la expresión artística? Al proveer la atmósfera que incentive la inspiración y creatividad, podemos también motivar a los jóvenes a utilizar las artes como una herramienta para descubrirse a sí mismos. ImaginARTE será el escenario, los jóvenes serán los artistas. 

The Plan:

After a very successful first edition of ImaginARTE on January 2013, SENATUR (Secretaria Nacional de Turismo) the agency responsible for tourism in Paraguay and Peace Corps Paraguay will host the second ImaginARTE National Youth Camp in February 2014. ImaginARTE is a three day, two night camp designed to foster creativity in Paraguayan youth. In furthering the idea of living an artful life--albeit professionally or in one’s free time--organizers will connect participants with the tools and ideas to incorporate creative activities into their daily lives, subsequently boosting their self-esteem and increasing their capacity for critical thinking and creative problem solving. Additionally, through workshop visits and activities led by local artists, ImaginARTE aspires to increase the youth’s exposure to other forms of art, role models, allies, and peers, thus encouraging collaboration.

El Plan:

Luego de una exitosa primera edición de ImaginARTE en enero 2013, SENATUR (Secretaría Nacional de Turismo) y Cuerpo de Paz Paraguay estarán llevando a cabo el segundo campamento nacional de ImaginARTE en febrero 2014. Durante tres días, el campamento está diseñado a incentivar la creativdad de los jóvenes paraguayos, conectándoles con herramientas e ideas para incorporar actividades creativas en su día a día, lo cual además proveerá la posibilidad de aumentar su autoestima y capacidad de pensamiento crítico y creativo. Adicional a ello, los jóvenes serán partícipes de charlas y talleres activos con artistas nacionales de distintas modalidades, como pintura, forografía, baile y teatro, con la intención de exponerles a modelos a seguir, e incentivando además la creación de colaboaciones y redes artísticas en el país. 

Successes:

The first edition of ImaginARTE camp was a whole success within itself! Around 50 Paraguayan youth from most departments of Paraguay were able to attend and profit from the incredible activities the camp offered, including art workshops made from recycled materials, conferences on visual and performing arts, creative collaborations including a Footloose-inspired dance video with slippers the youth painted themselves and a mural with the collaboration of a talented national muralist, Oz Montania, and walks around local galleries; all of this in the beautiful art capital of Paraguay, Areguá. Furthermore, these successes now travel with and are part of every single youth that was exposed to all these great experiences, and that is the greatest success of them all.

The first ImaginARTE Camp has allowed the great coordination flow of the second one. CoCuMu team members are currently working with community contacts to setup programming and logistical needs for the camp. The programming team, partnered with local artists and art agencies, are developing an agenda for the camp and enlisting speakers and activity leaders for designated events. The logistical team is working with gallery and workshop owners in Areguá to secure workshop visits and also arranging lodging and transportation for participants. All of this, just to make this fantastic opportunity possible for a new group of Paraguayan youth, the future artists and leaders of this great country. 

Éxitos:

¡La primera edición de ImaginARTE fue un éxito en sí mismo! Alrededor de 50 jóvenes paraguayos provenientes de la mayoría de los departamentos del Paraguay pudieron asistir y sacarle provecho a las magníficas actividades que el campamento ofreció, incluyendo talleres de arte con materiales reciclados, conferencias de artes visuales y performáticas, colaboraciones creativas que incluyeron un video de baile inspirado en la película Footloose usando zapatillas que los propios jóvenes pintaron y un mural en conjunto con un talentoso muralista paraguayo, Oz Montania, al igual que recorridos por galerías de arte; todo esto en la bella capital del arte en Paraguay, Areguá. Sin embargo, el mayo éxito de todos es que todas estas experiencias ahora son parte del bagaje cultural y artístico de cada joven que fue partícipe.

El primer campamento también ha dado pie en la fluida coordinación de esta nueva edición. El equipo de CoCuMu se encuentra actualmente trabajando mano a mano con contactos comunitarios para asegurar el éxito de esta iniciativa. El equipo de programación, en conjunto con artistas locales, están arduamente desarrollando el itinerario para esta edición, mientras que el equipo de logística está coordinando las visitas a las galerías locales de Areguá, además de los detalles de transportación y hospedaje para los jóvenes. Todo esto, sólo para hacer posible esta excelente oportunidad para un nuevo grupo de jóvenes paraguayos, los futuros artistas y líderes de este bello país.



How you can help:

The ImaginARTE Camp attracts aspiring youths from all walks of life from all over Paraguay and your support is needed to get them there! Your contribution will go directly towards funding the second ImaginARTE camp for the 50 youth expected to attend. It only takes $70 to sponsor one youth for the duration of the camp, help out a future Paraguayan artist achieve this goal!

 You can also help us by sharing this campaign on social media and with your family and friends.

Thank you for your support!

Cómo puedes ayudar:

El Campamento ImaginARTE recibirá a jóvenes de todos los rincones del Paraguay, ¡y tu apoyo es indispensable para hacer esto posible! Tu contribución irá directo a financiar la asistencia de los 50 jóvenes que tendrán la oportunidad de asistir a esta segunda edición de ImaginARTE. Sólo cuesta $70 dólares para auspiciar la participación de un joven, ¡ayuda a un futuro artista de Paraguay a cumplir esta meta! 

Nos puedes apoyar en esta inciativa compartiendo con todos tus contactos nuestra campaña.

¡Muchas gracias de antemano por tu apoyo!


Check out our photography project, Ahecha Paraguay, and more updates on ImaginARTE here:

Mira nuestro proyecto de fotografía, Ahecha Paraguay, y actualizaciones de ImaginARTE aquí:
----> https://www.facebook.com/ahechaparaguay?fref=ts <----

to sponsor one youth for the duration of the camp, help out a future Paraguayan artist achieve this goal! You can also help us by sharing this campaign on social media and with your family and friends. Thank you for your support! Cómo puedes ayudar:El Campamento ImaginARTE recibirá a jóvenes de todos los rincones del Paraguay, ¡y tu apoyo es indispensable para hacer esto posible! Tu contribución irá directo a financiar la asistencia de los 50 jóvenes que tendrán la oportunidad de asistir a esta segunda edición de ImaginARTE. Sólo cuesta $70 dólares para auspiciar la participación de un joven, ¡ayuda a un futuro artista de Paraguay a cumplir esta meta! Nos puedes apoyar en esta inciativa compartiendo con todos tus contactos nuestra campaña.¡Muchas gracias de antemano por tu apoyo!Check out our photography project, Ahecha Paraguay, and more updates on ImaginARTE here:
Mira nuestro proyecto de fotografía, Ahecha Paraguay, y actualizaciones de ImaginARTE aquí:
