story:
It is Simple and Unique:

This is one of the great opportunities for everybody to order their unique gift for their love, something no one on earth can have it or make it, you can have it for the rest of your life and depend on your taste and budget you can have it on Gold, Silver, Platinum, Wood, Stone or etc.

There is option to make it completely with your sign or make 50-50% with your love. (for example: your right hand and your love’s right hand or any other combination to compete your gift.)

This is sign of love, one of the most precious assets that everyone has it.

So you can make it incredibly unique and priceless.

Most of the time it is much easier to express your unique and valuable emotion to giving a gift to someone rather than explain it with words, but I know my products is best available gift to express your emotions to your Love.

As you see my products have limitless market all around world, but I started in the smallest scale to make it easier and increase my success to highest level. But as much as I have more financial support I can expand it more in short period of time.


About myself:

Many years of experiences in different countries made me expert in business industry. I was working in high end companies in Dubai as main business hub of Middle East. Then as result of our company’s expansion program, I went to Singapore to expand our company’s market in South East Asia. Now I am studying the CAD drafting and Design in college in Los Angeles, California and improving my capability for my projects. 


About this Campaign: 

This Campaign is great opportunity for both side, the person who has applicable vision and the contributors to support their favorite project and let it happen. Also this campaign also is the one of the best gateway for people who really think and believe similar to each other.


Your Contribution effect:

As you see our project has huge capacity and market, so in fact even your small contribution has huge effect for our project to become great product.


What we need & what you get:

What we need is your support as much as you can do; it is not all about the money, sometime even your support to refer our project to other potential individuals or organization and introduce us to them, can make the great support for us to become more successful.

All you can do is all you can do and all you can do is enough for us to become successful.

About the contribution as I mentioned and as you see our project has huge capacity, but to make it great, we need to do the project step by step.

To establish the small work shop and mini factory, we need to establish the company officially and then rent the small workshop, change the interior to become more attractive and related to our products, then buying the machinery. As you know and you can research the machine that can engrave the photo on metal (CNC) is very expensive, so our main fund will spend to purchase the CNC machine in the small scale and start our production. Meanwhile setup the website and prepare the minimum platform for the client to contact us and order what they want.



Depend on of amount of fund which we raise in this campaign we also have plan to develop our own mobile app and make easy access to our client.

We have local and international shipping method but for future we have plan to make our workshop as franchise company and duplicate our system as many as possible to increase our market and revenue.  

As you simply calculate this target amount is the minimum amount which we can start our project is the smallest possible scale, but because we believe in our project, we know as soon as we start our project, many more opportunities will come up to help us to go next level.

As I mentioned, your contribution and your referral to others are both very valuable for us and we are appreciate in advance.

You can also use your social media network to refer our project to the others as well as using of Indiegogo share tools. (One of most effective way)

story:
Conceptual Oregon Performance School 2014

C.O.P.S. (The Conceptual Oregon Performance School) is a free, artist-run, experimental summer school, with a focus on contemporary art and performance strategies. Its mandate is to engage participants in the methodologies, critical theory, and dialogue surrounding the discipline, while investigating its social and cultural role. Participants will experiment with a myriad of contemporary performance strategies, based upon formal and informal lectures, seminar-based dialogue, and structured group critique.

For more information about the 2014 sessions, visit http://conceptualoregonperformanceschool.com/

What We Need & What You Get

For the 2014 C.O.P.S. sessions, we would like to purchase folding chairs for participants, wood for the fire, beer, water, and weiners. Please help us make the C.O.P.S. sessions awesome by making a small donation, then come and join us this summer!

The Impact

C.O.P.S. is a free endeavor.
There are no fees for C.O.P.S.
There is no registration for C.O.P.S.
Everyone is welcome at C.O.P.S.
Attendance is mandatory for C.O.P.S.
You, we, all of us, are C.O.P.S.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a cash donation, but want to donate beer, firewood, bottled water, or snacks, email us at c.o.p.s.school@gmail.com

C.O.P.S. is funded by a generous grant from The Precipice Foundation through Portland Institute for Contemporary Art.

story:
Our Story

 

A teenager gives up drugs when he finds music.  A young boy finds peace through drawing as he battles with cancer.  A child confronts the gang-related death of his older brother through mixed media art.  A teenage girl faces her fear of the dark through photography.  These are the stories of individuals who have inspired me, while facilitating arts workshops in Guatemala City over the past three years.  In the midst of violence, drugs, gangs, and extreme poverty heightened by flooding, earthquakes, and landslides, art has motivated these youth and their families to rise up from the challenges of their daily lives with hope and perseverance.  Combined with self-reflection, art can give those in dire situations the confidence and determination to take important steps in their lives.

 

Their stories should be heard and they deserve the space to tell them.

 

Visions and Voices is a six month journey to compile self-portraits and monologues from women whose stories have not been told in Chile, Guatemala and the U. S. South.  They are women who are invisible to most of us: they may scavenge in the city dump; or sell their bodies; or spend their hours behind bars. Yet, their voices are powerful and we can learn from the wisdom of their lives.

 

Through Visions and Voices, I will partner with other artists, educators and organizations to facilitate workshops in which participants  use the arts and creative process to find their individual and group voices.  They will write poems, monologues and develop self-portraits that reflect upon their lives and futures.   

 

The first workshop will be in Talca, Chile with partner organization Telling My Story (www.tellingmystory.org) in February and March, 2012.  The workshop facilitators will be Artists/Educators Pati Hernandez, and Nell Pierce.  The second workshop will be in Guatemala City with mothers from the   Guatemala City garbage dump community, partnering with Safe Passage (www.safepassage.org), in March, 2012.  The third workshop will be with transgender sex workers in Guatemala City, Guatemala, partnering with an organization that works to protect sex workers from abuse, HIV/AIDS and to protect LGBT rights in Guatemala. Workshop four will work with Latino immigrants in Alabama, and workshop five will work with homeless mothers in North Carolina.

 

The final product will be an anthology in magazine or book form with a chapter focusing on each workshop.  Each chapter will include the stories of the women participants, and an informational section about ways you can support the participants or become involved in the partnering organization.  The anthology of stories will connect participants who have faced similar experiences of exclusion despite living in a different geographical location.  Each participant will keep their original artwork and receive a final copy of the book/magazine. 

 

 

The Impact

 

"I learned things about myself, where I am and where I am going.  I learned to appreciate the little things we have and how to enjoy these little things in life."

 

"I can show happiness, sadness, doubts, fears and the world in which we live."

 

"With [my artwork] I can express my emotions, I can share with other people what happens in the world and show the world from a different point of view."

 

- Student reflections on arts workshops in Guatemala

 

Based upon my experiences in Guatemala, I expect the workshops to provide participants with tools for healing and empowerment.  They will express their unique perspectives on the world, confront challenging past experiences, and envision a future full of creativity and possibility.  Many of my past students have been surprised and shocked at the talent they possess and their ability to create something that brings them pride.  They discovered a passion within themselves that allows them to find peace in the midst of chaos.


 

Approximately 15 women from each of the 5 communities will participate in workshops, reaching up to 75 participants.   Those of us who become witnesses to the art and stories of these women will be given the opportunity and the responsibility to ensure that their voices continue to be heard.  While they often do not have the mobility to travel outside of their communities, their artwork and writing can transcend social, economic and geographic barriers to create dialogue and reach new audiences.  With their stories, we can raise awareness of the discrimination and exclusion they face, as well as the inspiration they embody, and work together toward creating a global community united by compassion and equality.


 

What We Need & What You Get

 

With $8,000, we will conduct workshops in 5 communities and work with approximately 75 women.  Funding will provide for all the materials necessary to successfully implement the workshops and travel expenses (including transportation, room and board).  Funding also will cover costs involved in designing, printing and distributing the final book/magazine.  Just think - we only need 4 supporters at $2,000, 8 supporters at $1,000 or 80 supporters at $100.  Even a contribution of $10 or less gets us closer to our goal!

 

Here's how you can help!

 

With a $10 contribution...

You get a personal thank you on my blog for your help towards making these projects possible

 

With a $25 contribution...

You get a hand painted bookmark, and a personal thank you on my blog.

 

With a $75 contribution....

You get a set of 4 blank notecards, each featuring a unique portrait created during the arts workshops, a hand painted bookmark, and a thank you on my blog.

 

With a $100 contribution....

You get a soft cover copy of the final book/magazine!  This will include all the chapters, forwards by the artist/educators, and information on how to support partnering organizations.  You also get 4 blank portrait notecards, a hand painted bookmark, and a thank you on my blog.

 

With a $250 contribution....

You get a small piece of jewelry of your choice (this includes earrings or pendant).  My jewelry is made from Pure Silver PMC (precious metal clay) and comes with sterling silver chains / clasps.  You also get a soft cover copy of the final book/magazine, 4 blank portrait notecards, a hand painted bookmark, and a thank you on my blog.

 

With a $500 contribution...

You get a handmade journal.  My journals are have unlined white paper, come in various sizes, and are made with fabric and recycled rice papers.  You also get a small piece of jewelry of your choice, a soft cover copy of the final book/magazine, 4 blank portrait notecards, a hand painted bookmark, and a thank you on my blog.

 

With a $1,000 contribution...

You get an 8x10 painting on canvas.  My paintings are mixed media abstract landscapes using rice paper, acrylic paint, inks, charcoal and graphite.  You also get a handmade journal, a small piece of jewelry of your choice, a soft cover copy of the final book/magazine, 4 blank portrait notecards, a hand painted bookmark, and a thank you on my blog.

 

With a $2,000 contribution...

You get one of my large original sumi-e painting.  These are ink paintings with collage and drawings on archival rice paper from Japan.  Check out my website (www.carlynwrighteakes.com/painting) for more examples, or tell me what you like and I'll make one just for you!  You also get an 8x10 painting on canvas, a handmade journal, a small piece of jewelry of your choice, a soft cover copy of the final book/magazine, 4 blank portrait notecards, a hand painted bookmark, and a thank you on my blog.

 

(NOTE: Perks will be sent out in Summer 2012)

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Do you have ideas of partner organizations or possible participants?  Would you like to bring these workshops to a community or organization near you?  Are you an artist or educator that would like to be involved in this process?  Share your ideas!

 

Share this project with your friends and family.  How you can support other organizations working towards empowerment in your hometown and abroad?  Help spread the word and share the stories of these women!

 

 

Thank you!!

story:
Since 2001 I have self funded my visits, and the supplies needed to teaching and collaborate with Cuba artists. Last year with the support of friends like you I raised a $1000 towards the expenses for the 2010 trip. 

I am asking for your help this spring to continue teaching and opening the doors of dialog betweens our two countries.

 

I will return to Havana in March 2011 for six weeks to start the 2nd book in the trilogy, PRIVACY and to continue presenting book arts to students at San Alejandro Academy of Art and at ISA- Institute of Superior Art.


Will you help by making a contribution? 

In 2010 Red Trillium Press/ Aqui en la lucha, with the support of friends like you:

  • Taught two weeklong book arts workshops at San Alejandro and ISA art schools in Havana.

  • Presented a three-day book arts workshop with children’s book illustrators at Edicion Nueva, the children’s book publishing house in Cuba.
  • Published PODER, the first book of 3 on themes common to all Cubans: Power, Privacy and Waiting
  • Developed the Mis Amigos web page to help represent Cuban artists who have limited web access.
  • Published Cuban Book Arts Collaborations, in The Bonefolder, Vol. 7, an e-journal for the book arts community.

Will you donate on- line  $50 or more today, so Red Trillium Press can continue developing a dialog for the future with these amazing Cuban artists? I offer as perks a variety of prints, books and ephemera from past trips and collaborations.


Daiber's selfless and energetic commitment to making artists books that  empower both the artist and the reader has made him somewhat of a cultural hero in Cuba, it's time to give him and his crew that same status here in the USA.

Marshall Weber- Booklyn Artist Alliance


Daiber’s workshops in Cuba have contributed to the creation and dissemination of a vibrant body of work that excites and challenges expectations. Please consider supporting this incredible grassroots effort at building bridges and creating great work.

Peter D. Verheyen, Bookbinder and publisher of The Bonefolder.

story:
Hello everybody,
My name is Martijn Crowe, and for the last few years, I have travelled the world to explore the world of Drag Queens. I interviewed them, went to their clubs, and made photos before and after their transformation. Now, I want to show the world my photos and my research because it will contribute to the understanding and tolerance of diversity world wide. In many countries, society tries to hide Drag Queens away, and I will help them by making them visible. Therefore, I am raising funds to publish the very first book about Drag Queens from all over the world.


I became interested in Drag Queens a late night in Sao Paulo, Brazil. I was standing outside a nightclub when the doors opened. People were pouring out of the club, among them two enormous Drag Queens. I felt like I was looking into the gates of hell, watching two devils leading doomed souls. Then I became curious: Who are these men behind their wigs and their make-up?


I went from Sao Paulo to Cambodia, from Bolivia to Amsterdam, and met over 100 Drag Queens, and we are continuing our trip. The project already resulted in a popular website, a Facebook site, and a number of events where we attract attention to gender and diversity. Now it is time to round off the project with a great celebration of diversity: A book of the highest quality of design. 


I ask you to make this possible with us because finanzing this book woth crowdfunding is a statement itself: There are a lot of people out there (you!) that understands that this is an important task, and that wants to support the LGBTQ community in their struggles by showing the humans behind the labels to the world. Crowdfunding will also make it sure that the book will remain independent, uncensored, and true. 

The funds will be used for three purposes:

1. To travel to Shanghai and explore the drag environment there in June 2014

2. To go to New York and meet the drag scene there in September 2014. We go to these two cities because a worldwide research about Drag Queens will not be complete without visiting the world's biggest country, China, and the power centre of drag culture, New York.

3. To print the book and to give it a world wide distribution. It will be ready in December 2014. A book of the highest quality of design is the best way to present this project - the Drag Queens deserve to get their photos and stories printed on paper.

             

I, Martijn Crowe, am a famous artist and recognized anthropologist of undefined age and have done similar projects with elderly, homeless people and adolescents. Together with my wife Sabya, and our children, we travel the world to produce stories, photography and art, especially of groups that are invisible in this world. As professional wanderers, we live between teenagers, homeless, elderly and drag queens in Brazil, Bolivia, Cambodia, New York and Amsterdam. Always looking for like minded artists, and working with local energetic people. In our project with adolescents, Doing Dreams, we worked with children worldwide to help them empower themselves and influence their own life: learn how to dream, how to create an inspiring learning environment, and how to be visible in and connected with the rest of the world. The project resulted in a book that can be viewed here. 

Two times every week, we will post stories about the different Drag Queens we have met around the world here, under 'updates'. Check them out to get a glimpse of the world - more will come in the book!
As you can see, our youngest son, Sét, had already met more Drag Queens before he was 3 years old than most people will ever do...


With the book Drag Queens of the World we make visible the people that society tries to hide. The gay community experience backlashes worldwide, from Russia to India, from Uganda to Arizona. Drag Queens of the World makes a difference because our project increases the visibility and the understanding of alternative ways of doing gender, an important tasks these days when governments and mobs are doing the opposite. Our project has gotten a lot of attention in the press, from Brazil to the US to Norway - you can see an overview here



                   

  

Drag Queens of the World is awareness-raising of social issues and a celebration of diversity we hope you are willing to help us accomplish. 

Support Drag Queens of the World - Make diversity visible!

http://dragqueens-oftheworld.com/
https://www.facebook.com/dragqueensoftheworld
@_oftheworld

story:
Why Partner with us? 

The 2014 Detroit Poetry Slam team, brought to you by the Neo Minds Poetry Slam Series,  is a team of poets selected through competition to represent Detroit at the week long National Poetry Slam Competition in Oakland, CA this year.   

It is very important to highlight and create value for the arts and literature in Urban areas such as Detroit where economy and education has taken such a major blow.  We intend to just that while bringing major excitement to the artist community through competitions, live poetry events and supporting a unit that represents the community on a national stage. 

Your contribution would mean an opportunity for a group of artists to not only live their dream and possibly win the highest honor a performance poet could win on a team level.  



What We Need & What You Get

In traveling to Oakland, CA, we will incur significant airfare fees estimated around $400 per person for a 6 person crew.  In addition, the two hotel rooms are $189.00 per room, per night with a required $50 deposit per night.  Finally, the costs of ground transportation from the airport and from hotels to venue is estimated at an average of $50 per day.  Outside of travel costs, we are required to pay $500 to Poetry Slam International (www.poetryslam.com) for registration for the event along with other miscellaneous costs.  We have already raised a portion of our needs and will be doing additional, local fundraising to help satisfy our total costs, however, the remaining amount we hope to raise here on indiegogo will help us to fully reach our goal.

Everyone likes a token of partnership, you deserve that much as we could never provide enough gifts to serve as a sufficient thank you but we do have perks!  Included in our perks are things such as downloadable cds from team members, dvd of our 2014 Detroit Poetry Slam Competition, team T-shirts, personalized performance dvds, and more.  These tokens are gifts that we believe will continuously remind you of our partnership and relationship for years to come. 


The Impact

As you review our campaign and what it means to Detroit, a city fighting its way out of turmoil, please keep in mind that the picture is even bigger than our great city.  The National Poetry Slam is an event that galvanizes poets/artists from around the country and beyond which helps each region network and share ideas to enhance the entertainment and educational aspects of the cities we represent. 

As the slam coordinator in Detroit Omari King Wise has successfully sent two teams to the National Poetry Slam and has been a team member on 7 teams representing Detroit.  This is key because his leadership has a proven track record at performing as well as managing and finding the necessary funds to get his team to this great and historic festival. 

This is the 25th Anniversary of the National Poetry Slam and Detroit hopes to help celebrate this amazing history along side all other teams from around the country. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Understanding that everyone does not have the resources and means to contribute to this or any other campaign, we at the 2014 Detroit Poetry Slam Team request that you copy and paste the link to our campaign and any other campaign that draws your passion, directly to your social media pages, text message and or email.   We respect the exact reality that each and every person that reads this message exists within and we would never want to exclude your support be it financial or positive vibes and marketing support.   

With all of that being said, thank you for taking your time to view our campaign. We wish you much prosperity and success in all of your personal endeavors.   

~ 2014 Detroit Poetry Slam Team

story:
Lydiane autour du monde c'est…

Des voyages, de l’aventure, des rencontres, une ouverture sur le monde, c’est une invitation à donner à la communauté, des anecdotes, des photos et des vidéos à couper le souffle et surtout, une façon de voir la vie qui unit déjà plus de 43 000 personnes! www.lydianeautourdumonde.com


Mon histoire

Je me présente, Lydiane, j'ai 27 ans, je suis une nomade-née et citoyenne du monde. Il y a un an, j'ai quitté le Québec pour amorcer le plus grand changement de ma vie : faire le tour du monde pour une durée indéterminée. J'ai décidé de quitter ma carrière prometteuse de courtier immobilier, de vendre ma maison et mes biens en laissant tout derrière, pour accomplir mon plus grand rêve : vivre ma vie à ma façon, y mordre à pleines dents, découvrir, rencontrer, apprendre, suivre mon cœur, mes passions et mon intuition. C'est donc en octobre 2013 que j’entamais la première étape de mon aventure, en atterrissant en Asie sans billet de retour. J'ai alors lancé la page Facebook « Lydiane autour du monde » pour tenir informés ma famille et mes amis. Après à peine une semaine, cette page était déjà suivie par plus de 10 000 personnes. J'ai compris qu'une nouvelle passion était née, celle de partager mes voyages avec des récits, des photos et des vidéos.

Après un an, c'est plus de 43 000 personnes qui me suivent quotidiennement sur ma page Facebook. Je comprends que j'ai la possibilité de devenir une ambassadrice et que j'ai le pouvoir de sensibiliser les gens à s'ouvrir sur le monde. Je souhaite maintenant faire une différence et donner une dimension plus profonde à mon projet.


Mon objectif
  • Éveiller la curiosité et le désir de visiter notre belle planète pour conscientiser aux enjeux qui nous entourent et démontrer que la bonté humaine et la compassion n’ont pas de frontières.
  • Être un exemple d'ouverture sur les cultures et les peuples pour encourager le tourisme responsable et engagé.

Mon projet - 20 000 $ pour la fondation Virlanie!

Aux Philippines, j'ai eu le déclic. En visitant un bidonville avec l’organisme Virlanie, j'ai fait la rencontre d’une famille extraordinaire qui m'a accueillie à bras ouverts malgré leur grande pauvreté. Leur générosité m'a profondément touchée. J’ai compris que je pouvais à mon tour, donner au suivant.

Suite au typhon Hagupit qui a dévasté les Philippines récemment, j’ai été ébranlée par l’ampleur des dégâts. Vous serez sûrement d’accord avec moi, il y a présentement un besoin urgent et criant d’apporter un soutien aux sinistrés. Ceux qui me suivent depuis quelques mois savent à quel point j’ai été touchée par mon passage à la fondation Virlanie qui œuvre auprès des enfants de la rue aux Philippines. Cette expérience m’a fait comprendre que je pouvais être plus qu’une simple touriste et que je peux faire une différence, aussi infime soit-elle. C’est d’ailleurs ce moment précis qui a inspiré l’objectif de mon prochain voyage et la campagne Donnez autour du monde.

Donc, j’aimerais remettre 100% des dons versés à la fondation Virlanie. Il ne s’agit peut être pas d’un organisme situé en Amérique du Sud, mais j’ai eu l’occasion de voir l’impact direct qu’ils peuvent avoir sur le terrain et j'ai constaté sur place les bienfaits de leurs actions sur la communauté. Grâce à vous, ces dons serviront à offrir un toit, de la nourriture, une éducation aux enfants de la rue et aider à la reconstruction, suite au passage du typhon. Il y a un besoin urgent de les aider et j'aimerais que l'ont puisse tous se mobiliser pour eux!


Si l’objectif est dépassé, un plus grand nombre de personnes dans le besoin seront aidées directement par cette campagne.

Donnez autour du monde, c'est donner au suivant et aider les personnes dans le besoin, peu importe leurs origines, cultures, langues. La première édition de la campagne Donnez autour du monde a choisi d'aider les enfants de la rue aux Philippines à cause de l'urgence du besoin et espère, dans les prochaines années, pouvoir aider encore plus de gens un peu partout dans le monde par le biais d'organismes locaux!



D'autres façons de donner autour du monde

En parlant haut et fort de la campagne autour de vous... mais aussi en dansant, en souriant aux étrangers, en faisant un bon geste, en donnant au suivant de la façon qui vous plaît, en manifestant dans les rues pour les causes qui vous tiennent à cœur.

En partageant les liens suivants, PARTOUT :

  • Page de la campagne :
    www.donnezautourdumonde.com
  • Vidéo de la campagne :
    www.vimeo.com/lydianeautourdumonde/donnez
  • Page Facebook :
    www.facebook.com/lydianeautourdumonde

Si vous êtes journaliste

Votre aide pourrait permettre à cette campagne d'atteindre le succès qu'elle mérite. N'hésitez pas à me contacter si vous avez des questions ou désirez faire une entrevue.


Me contacter

Par courriel : lydiane@lydianeautourdumonde.com

Merci du plus profond de mon cœur pour votre aide. Ensemble nous ferons une différence!


Quelques informations sur la fondation Virlanie
La Fondation Virlanie aux Philippines a été d’abord le combat et l’engagement d’un homme, Dominique Lemay. En février 1992, révolté par le sort des enfants des rues, il crée Virlanie Foundation Inc. et trois mois plus tard, une première maison est ouverte. En moins de quinze ans, la Fondation ouvre ainsi douze maisons. Virlanie Foundation inc. est un organisme de protection à l’enfance de droit philippin, agréé par le Département des affaires sociales.

L’objectif est de donner les moyens aux enfants de sortir de la rue et d’échapper ainsi à la violence, à la drogue, à la prostitution, aux réseaux de pédophilie, ainsi qu’aux trafics d’organes, en leur permettant de s’insérer au mieux dans la société et de devenir des citoyens actifs grâce à nos maisons familiales d’accueil.

Virlanie s’est donné pour mission d’accueillir en priorité ceux dont « personne ne veut ! ». Aujourd’hui, environ 300 enfants et jeunes âgés de 0 à 22 ans vivent en résidences familiales dans ses dix maisons. De plus, l’équipe, composée de près de 200 salariés philippins, secondés par environ 50 bénévoles philippins et étrangers, gère quatorze programmes.



Virlanie accompagne ainsi plus de 1200 enfants et jeunes directement dans les rues, dans les centres de détention et au sein des familles très pauvres qui vivent dans les bidonvilles.

Venus des rues, de centres de rétention, adressés par d’autres structures, les enfants sont d’abord accueillis dans deux centres de transition, d’accueil et d’écoute (Drop-in center pour les enfants de plus de sept ans, Marco Polo care center pour les plus petits) ; puis ils sont intégrés dans une maison familiale d’accueil.


S’appropriant eux-mêmes le projet, les enfants n’en intègrent que mieux les règles de base (ne pas voler, ne pas se droguer, ne pas se vendre...). Dans chacune des maisons, tout est mis en œuvre pour aider l’enfant à retrouver le cadre sécurisant et structurant qu’offre une vraie famille. Un couple de Philippins fait office de parents adoptifs, et est aidé par une personne symbolisant la tante. Une assistante sociale assure le suivi psychologique des enfants et les projets d’activités mis en place. Dans ces maisons, la Fondation offre des réponses diversifiées : scolarisation normale, apprentissage d’un métier, activités d’éveil et de loisirs, sport... 

Pour plus d'infos:

http://www.virlanie.org


Quelques chiffres

959 enfants bénéficiaires en 2013
16 000 bénéficiaires depuis 1992

10 maisons et 14 programmes
281 enfants dans les maisons
678 bénéficiaires dans les programmes

137 salariés Philippins
121 Volontaires: 39 locaux & 82 étrangers 
54 Etudiants locaux


Alors, redonnons tous ensemble le sourire à ces enfants :)
Donnons autour du monde!

rétention, adressés par d’autres structures, les enfants sont
d’abord accueillis dans deux centres de transition, d’accueil et
d’écoute (Drop-in center pour les enfants de plus de sept ans,
Marco Polo care center pour les plus petits) ; puis ils sont
intégrés dans une maison familiale d’accueil.



S’appropriant eux-mêmes le
projet, les enfants n’en intègrent que mieux les règles de base
(ne pas voler, ne pas se droguer, ne pas se vendre...). Dans chacune
des maisons, tout est mis en œuvre pour aider l’enfant
à retrouver le cadre sécurisant et structurant qu’offre une
vraie famille. Un couple de Philippins fait office de parents
adoptifs, et est aidé par une personne symbolisant la tante. Une
assistante sociale assure le suivi psychologique des enfants et les
projets d’activités mis en place. Dans ces maisons, la Fondation
offre des réponses diversifiées : scolarisation normale,
apprentissage d’un métier, activités d’éveil et de loisirs,
sport... 
Pour plus d'infos:
http://www.virlanie.org

Quelques chiffres
959 enfants bénéficiaires en 201316 000 bénéficiaires depuis 1992
10 maisons et 14 programmes281 enfants dans les maisons678 bénéficiaires dans les programmes
137 salariés Philippins121 Volontaires: 39 locaux & 82 étrangers 54 Etudiants locaux

Alors, redonnons tous ensemble le sourire à ces enfants :)Donnons autour du monde!

story:
Short Summary

Arthaus Greenville is a community based, and artist run initiative that seeks to awaken a passion within the art community by creating easily accessible gallery and studio space, creating a "home" for artists  to come together for dialogue and collaboration, and offering opportunities for learning and knowledge sharing.  

We have recently embarked on developing exhibitions for both artists and the community and have begun building collaborations with other art collectives.  "Pivot" is our first internationally curated exhibition and we want to do many more.  As it turns out we had a fantastic free venue lined  up through our partnership with Greenville, SC's The Film House, but at the last minute the venue dropped  out leaving us in a bit of a lurch and causing us to spend more money on another venue, going over budget. Sometimes these types of things unfortunately happen in event planning. Now we are asking for your help to get us over the bubble.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 to cover the remaining balance for our new venue rental. We are asking for $600 to cover Indiegogo  fees.  If we earn more donations , they  will go directly toward  our fund to develop more exhibitions and to open our first community art space in 2015.  In return for your pledge we are offering a lot of cool gifts as a thank you, including Arthaus T-shirts, silkscreens, and original paintings on canvas.  


The Impact

Greenville, SC is a city that frequently makes the lists of best places to live in the United States. However, two things sorely missing  are a community arts space  and an independent film theatre. "Pivot: Embrace the Unconventional" is an experimental film exhibit featuring  featuring many works by visual artists, and exemplifying the need for a community art space and  indie film theater in Greenville. 

Your pledge will help us in creating an event that the upstate has never seen before and grow a larger audience for  public art in the community which directly feeds into our cause and goal of developing a community art center not just for artists , but for everyone.  Your pledge will also bring our friends at  The Film House a step closer to their goal of opening an Independent film theatre. 

Finally your pledge really furthers synergy in the  visual arts and helps build toward a stronger sustainable arts movement nationwide during a time when  federal funding is diminished.

Please visit www.arthausgreenville.com for more info about The Arthaus.



Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by giving whatever you can ,by sharing this page and sharing the Arthaus web link.

If you are in town during Artisphere  you can by tickets to  attend  "Pivot". For more info on "Pivot" and our friends at The Film House please visit  http://www.greenvillefilmhouse.com/pivot.html

story:
Short Summary

Soulcraft Gallery is a gallery of furniture by Cleveland-based designers and makers which we aim (with your help!) to open in the newly renamed 5th Street (was Colonial) Arcade in downtown Cleveland.  It is an outgrowth of Soulcraft Woodshop; the burgeoning Cleveland design scene and a promising revitalization of Cleveland's downtown.

In July of 2012, we opened Soulcraft Woodshop, a community shop wherein the public can use our space for the own projects or take classes.  Furthermore, the Woodshop is home to a number of furniture designers and makers who are growing their businesses out of the shop. 

We wanted to create a gallery to showcase the best of the work coming out of the shop, but also to display the tremendous work that has been generated in the growing furniture design scene in Cleveland.

When we open, will have 12 furniture designers from all over the Cleveland metropolitan area, many of whose work has been displayed nationally and occasionally internationally.  We want to give them a local gallery home. At present, the designers who will show include A Piece of Cleveland, Bomb Factory Furniture, 44 Steel, Forrest City Fabricators, Rust Belt Welding, Sawhorse Woodworks, Northend Woodworks, 2nd Shift Studio, Steve Yusko, Domenic Fiorello Studio, Shelley Mendenhall, and Peter Debelak.

What We Need & What You Get

We are running this exciting campaign in parallel with our participation in a grant competition held by the Downtown Cleveland Alliance and the Charter One Foundation.  We are pleased to have been chosen as one of five finalists in that competition, and now we are asking the public to help make this vision a reality. 

We will use the funds raised, in short, in order to get our doors open and to get the word out about each and every designer we showcase.  Our goal is to have a successful gallery, but moreso to enable each designer access to a broader audience:  the audience this Cleveland talent deserves.

We will use funds toward built out of the beautiful space at the 5th Street Arcade; initial marketing and events; website creation with an e-store; and to enable as many designers as possible to bring their products to a broader market.

The Impact

The concept behind "Soulcraft" - both the Woodshop and the Gallery - is really just to enable. We feel we benefit from, but also will contribute to the success of a number of larger growth efforts:  1) The revitalization of downtown generally, and of the 5th Street Arcade specifically;  and 2) The growing furniture design scene in Cleveland.

There has been a robust discussion about Cleveland being a good "fit" for furniture design and production.  There is still tremendous interest in creating a Design District in Cleveland; and the furniture designers in Cleveland are beginning to get wide-spread recognition.  This has been boosted by such things as the annual F*Sho, a one-night contemporary furniture fair, as well as the remarkable reception Clevleand designers have received at international furniture fairs, such as ICFF in New York.

By launching a successful furniture and design gallery - indeed, a successful retail business - in downtown Cleveland, we are excited to benefit from and to contribute to the success of furniture design in Cleveland and the revitalization of Cleveland's downtown.

Other Ways You Can Help

As we said, we feel a part of something bigger than just a stand-alone retail business.  You can help by spreading the word about our campaign and our larger efforts.  You can help by coming downtown and supporting us as we host events and openings.  And you can help by starting to MAKE!  CREATE!

story:
Who I Am And What This Campaign Is About

My name is Joseph Karwacki. I am a fine artist, currently working in Queens, New York. I am self taught, honing my skills from many talented artists i've met and worked with combined with my thirst for knowledge and experimentation. I've wanted to make art since I was very young, and I feel blessed to have made it to this point so far.

I was making art from my home (paintstakingly) before I started working in studio 338B, a place that became more of a home to me than anywhere else. For almost four years I've worked, discovered, and pushed myself relentlessly to grow as an artist. I've made many friends, colleagues, and tremendous memories that no one can take away. Well the time has come that I have to leave this place. There is a new home out there for me, and with a little support from all of you, I can make a beginning payment on a new space to keep the dream alive. 

This campaign is very important to me because art is the thing that matters more than anything in this world to me. It is one of the only things that makes me feel happy, alive, and energized about life and it's many wonders. It is also my way of being able to share my world with you. 

What I Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to raise two thousand dollars. This money will help me pay for a deposit on a new space, transportation for my works, as well as new materials for the new body of work I eagerly wait to embark upon. 

In exchange for your help. I am offering a range of original pieces of art work by my self. Each piece offered here as a perk is part of a limited edition set, being completely exclusive to you and this campaign. 

If in the event I do not reach my entire goal, I will use what ever funds you all have graciously given me to continue to make work somehow, while producing affordable prints that are accessible to everyone. I will also be able to fund some of the materials that I will need for new works to come. 

The Impact

This project is very important because it will help the growth and survival of the art world. I know a lot of people who have had to stop making art before outlets like this existed, because they could not afford to continue to push their career. This will prove to many future, and current artists, that it's possible to keep doing what they are doing. It will also help to make art more open and accessible to people. 

 It has been a hard, but wonderful time getting to this point. I really never thought I'd have this opportunity and it welcomed me with open arms. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not all of you can contribute, but there are other great ways you can help! You can help spread the word about my campaign, and share it with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools. If have you a friend that's an artist you can show them a new way of continuing to work.

story:
My Community: Bristol, Vermont                                                        Reed Prescott, artist

A New Model; supporting the partnership between artists and non-profits.

1) Artist creates work that fits non-profits mission
2) non-profit uses images for that years promotional materials
3) together marketable pieces are created and sold by both parties with profits split 50/50
Goal: non-profit has quality artwork, creates additional revenue stream, and artist is compensated.... win.....win.....win.....


Who we are:

Artist Reed Prescott. I am a Vermont landscape painter with over 30 years of professional experience. I have won numerous awards for my paintings and have seen most sides of the creative economy.

I'm interested in strengthening the creative economy and supporting the community through my work as an artist. I am asked regularly to donated work to non-profits with the goal of supporting their mission while gaining exposure for the contribution. However, over time I and other artists have found that this model can be challenging and difficult to sustain.  When Vermont's United Way of Addison County asked  if I was interested in being a part of a new model, one that equally supports the organization and artist, I jumped on board. This partnership is a result of that conversation.

To see more of my work go to www.prescottgalleries.com

The United Way of Addison County provides support to individuals and families- with special consideration to low and moderate income families so that they can live independent, productive and healthy lives. They work with local organizations and community-based programs to:

  • Improve the financial stability of individuals and families-affordable housing, quality childcare, reliable transportation, career mentoring, financial training, tax preparation assistance.
  • Increased access to health care and healthy life choices for individuals and families- access to quality health care, support for independent living, reducing substance abuse, child abuse, and domestic violence.
  • Increased access to educational opportunities that promote personal success in school, work, and life - school readiness, reading mentoring, after school programs, alternative education programs, mentoring for at-risk youth.

For more information go to www.unitedwayaddisoncounty.org


The Model

The goal of this model is to create an equitable and sustainable partnership that equally supports the artist and the non-profit. This progressive model values the artists work, time and talent and their need to make a living at their craft. It also values the work of non-profits and their impact on the community.

This gives the organization access to quality artwork, generates an additional source of revenue, and compensates the artist. This is a win... win... model.

The Impact

By donating to the project, contributors:

  • strengthen the health, education, and financial stability of our communities.
  • support the work of a local Vermont artist.
  • invest in a new model which can positively affect the creative economy.
  • will become part of a cutting edge movement that equally values the artist and the non-profit community.

"Like the strokes on a canvas, each of us has a place. It is through all the strokes coming together that we create a larger image or purpose, one that fosters a sense of community and connectedness". 


What the painting "My Community" means to me - Artist Reed A. Prescott III

This is my world, one that I love and that inspires me daily. This is the Vermont Village where I grew up, worked, and played for over 5 decades and still inspires what I create. It seemed like a perfect subject for this project as it shows many aspects of our town. Residential, business and town government are represented by the buildings that have stood for well over 100 years. It includes a veteran's monument on a traditional New England town green with commemorative brick paving with a brick for my father who served in the Air Force for 20 years. I remember the house on the corner of the park, once owned by Dr. Bosworth displaying flags for each country. In the painting I thought it would be appropriate to show the connections of this fine community to the world, so I chose flags from 3 countries where I know people from the area have, and are still volunteering. I decided to paint the image in that fresh, early spring, morning light that signifies hope and a new beginning after a long gray winter. Like the hope that the United Way of Addison County brings to the community through programs involving education, health and financial stability. Small communities can, and do have impact on the larger canvas of our world and I am proud to be a part of this ground breaking project.


The Bottom Line

We are excited about this model and hope you are too. We need your support NOW to show both the art and non-profit worlds that this is the way of the future and at the same time provide critical services to our friends and neighbors in need. 


And, you will receive some great items as a thank you!


Other Ways you can help

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who We Are:  

We are 25 creative individuals brought together by the CSULB BFA graphic design program. For the past two years we have followed the same path but have been challenged to approach our practice from different perspectives. There were demanding deadlines, countless late nights, and tough critiques. We each contributed a unique set of skills but collectively came together as a support system for each other through this experience. This show not only marks the end of this program and our time together as student designers, it is also a celebration of what is yet to come.

 

Our Manifesto:

We are opposite extremes that met in the middle. Here we’ve encountered sleepless nights, joyous times, and memorable travels. As a result, we find growth and inspiration in each other to become better individuals. From the small memories to the grand milestones we have achieved, everything led us to this point. This show is an embodiment of who we are as graphic designers - now and in the future. To all that we have learned and been through, this is our response. This is how we resonate.

 

Your Contribution: 

Our senior show is entirely self-funded by the 25 students in our class. With your help we can create a meaningful production worthy of your support. This program has developed us into the collaborative and thoughtful designers we are today. While exploring our passion we have given our own dollars into this production; now we turn to you for help. Every contribution received will help cover the expenses of construction, printing, and marketing our show. As our days at CSULB come to an end your donation will give us the momentum we need to cross the finish line. With your help, we will be proud to call ourselves BFAM alumni.

We thank you for your support and appreciate any amount!  We hope to see you at our show on December 13th- 14th at 224 E 111th St #501 Los Angeles Ca.  All are welcome, help us spread the word!

 

What's In It For You:

Pledge US$ 25 or more

As a way to thank you for your donation, your name will be placed on the show program that will be dispersed at our show. Every donation name will be recognized on our website. You will also receive one gift only available through attendance at our show and based on supply.

Includes:

  • One piece of Resonate merchandise
  • Featured on program and website

 

Pledge US$ 50 or more

Not only will you be recognized at our show but you will also receive two free gifts. Gifts will only be available through attendance at our show and while supplies last.

Includes:

  • Two pieces of Resonate merchandise
  • Featured on program and website

 

Pledge US$ 100 or more

You will receive recognition at our show and receive three gifts of our Resonate merchandise. These gifts will only be available through attendance at our show and while supplies last.

You will also be featured on our sponsor wall that will include corporate sponsors and major donors–including you!

Includes:

  • Three pieces of Resonate merchandise
  • Featured on program and website
  • Featured on sponsor wall

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand a donation may not always be possible. Any bit of support would help us in furthering our goals

Share this page. By sharing this donation page or our website, on your social media, you'll be helping us to spread the word.

Come to the show. Hang out with us and help us celebrate this moment.

Sponsor us. We are actively seeking corporate sponsors. If you have a lead, please email us at Bfam.f19@gmail.com

Volunteer. Have a passion for volunteering? Good with people or behind the scenes? Have an extra ladder, power drill or folding table? Many tasks, supplies and materials are needed. Please email us at Bfam.f19@gmail.com

Keep in touch! We are building our mailing list and would love to know what you're up to.

Here we’ve encountered sleepless nights, joyous times, and memorable travels. As a result, we find growth and inspiration in each other to become better individuals. From the small memories to the grand milestones we have achieved, everything led us to this point. This show is an embodiment of who we are as graphic designers - now and in the future. To all that we have learned and been through, this is our response. This is how we resonate. 
Your Contribution: Our senior show is entirely self-funded by the 25 students in our class. With your help we can create a meaningful production worthy of your support. This program has developed us into the collaborative and thoughtful designers we are today. While exploring our passion we have given our own dollars into this production; now we turn to you for help. Every contribution received will help cover the expenses of construction, printing, and marketing our show. As our days at CSULB come to an end your donation will give us the momentum we need to cross the finish line. With your help, we will be proud to call ourselves BFAM alumni.We thank you for your support and appreciate any amount!  We hope to see you at our show on December 13th- 14th at 224 E 111th St #501 Los Angeles Ca.  All are welcome, help us spread the word! What's In It For You:Pledge US$ 25 or moreAs a way to thank you for your donation, your name will be placed on the show program that will be dispersed at our show. Every donation name will be recognized on our website. You will also receive one gift only available through attendance at our show and based on supply.Includes:
One piece of Resonate merchandise
Featured on program and website
 Pledge US$ 50 or moreNot only will you be recognized at our show but you will also receive two free gifts. Gifts will only be available through attendance at our show and while supplies last.Includes:
Two pieces of Resonate merchandise
Featured on program and website
 Pledge US$ 100 or moreYou will receive recognition at our show and receive three gifts of our Resonate merchandise. These gifts will only be available through attendance at our show and while supplies last.You will also be featured on our sponsor wall that will include corporate sponsors and major donors–including you!Includes:
Three pieces of Resonate merchandise
Featured on program and website
Featured on sponsor wall
 Other Ways You Can Help:We understand a donation may not always be possible. Any bit of support would help us in furthering our goalsShare this page. By sharing this donation page or our website, on your social media, you'll be helping us to spread the word.Come to the show. Hang out with us and help us celebrate this moment.Sponsor us. We are actively seeking corporate sponsors. If you have a lead, please email us at Bfam.f19@gmail.comVolunteer. Have a passion for volunteering? Good with people or behind the scenes? Have an extra ladder, power drill or folding table? Many tasks, supplies and materials are needed. Please email us at Bfam.f19@gmail.comKeep in touch! We are building our mailing list and would love to know what you're up to.

story:
Our Lady of Fatima Triptych

 

Zelo zelatus sum pro Domino Deo exercituum (1 Kings 19:10;14)
"With zeal have I been zealous for the Lord God of hosts"

 

OVERVIEW

This Our Lady of Fatima Triptych is an original work by Michael Corsini.  The image is painted on solid oak!  It is a landmark image, as there has not been a painting of Our Lady of Fatima portrayed as she appeared to the seers as Our Lady of Mount Carmel like this before! The miracle of the Sun is also depicted here.   It is witnessed by thousands of angels and saints, as well as the onlookers in the ground.  Elijah and St. Simon Stock adorn the flanks of the triptych, mystically viewing the miracle. I am overjoyed that the original painting will be installed in the newly constructed St. Albert friary chapel in Middletown NY, and will be a center of prayer for the friars.  Please join in the mission to get this image finished up and installed!  May God bless you abundantly! 

 

BIO

My name is Michael Corsini and I am a painter.  I am a husband, to my beautiful wife Jessie, and father of five little ones.  I have been creating works of art for healing and renewal for nearly two decades.  I have a BFA from Ringling School of Art and Design as well as a MTS from the John Paul Institute for Studies on Marriage and Family.  I also spent 5 years in temporary vows as a member of the Franciscan Friars of the Renewal, in discernment of religious life.  Accordingly I have a deep love of the religious life… I believe that in this time, bringing new beauty to the chapel of a contemplative religious community like the Carmelites, is an essential work!    

 

GOAL

I have a personal goal of raising $5,000 for the project as it is so large!  But any contribution amount is very much appreciated!  

 

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is that I am doing this on my own… (well with lots of moral support from my kids!) I will be handling all the prints and fulfilling orders myself. I’ll be personally working with the printers, doing the packaging, and in some form, delivering them to you. This will extend the timeline on delivery, but I will personally vouch for each patrons’ order! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:

Share the project on Facebook and Instagram

Share my artwork found on Facebook and Instagram

Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it

www.michaelcorsini.com

Thank you for your support!

 

Samples of Recent Work

story:
BORN TO BE BONE!

Hey Everyone! My name is Juston and I'm a cartoonist who publishes and doodles & art under the name Uppermind Ink!

If you want to check out more of my art here's some links:

  • INSTAGRAM.COM/UPPERMINDINK
  • TWITTER.COM/UPPERMINDINK
  • PATREON.COM/UPPERMINDINK
  • SHOP.UPPERMIND.INK

I've loved bold lines, bright colors, and cartoony aesthetics for as long as I can remember, which is why Gitaroo Man has been one of my favorite rhythm games to this day. Jamming out on the PS2, soaking in the visuals, and head banging to the music. 

I've been craving a metal style t-shirt of Gitaroo Man for awhile, so I said HEY! Let's make on ourselves and see if others would want in on the action! So here we are! I want to make a shirt that shows my love for Gitaroo Man while also looking raddd!

  • I want to keep it simple: Black shirt, one color screen print (white). With your help we can make this shirt a reality!

This is no way tied to KOEI. I'm a huge fan of the games they've made and want to make something for fans!

THE GOAL:

  • $500 or 20 pre-orders. 
  • You get a shirt in the size you want and a bonus sticker for backing the campaign!
  • All funds will go directly into getting the shirts printed and shipped to your door.

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

  • UPPERMIND INK has run successful campaigns on other platforms. Items were delivered on time, with minimal issues. I've successfully ran a Patreon with physical rewards shipped monthly as well as a store. 
  • Covid may play a role in getting items made and shipped in a timely manner. I have already talked to a shop the can handle the print job. I'm also looking into global shipping costs and will try to keep this low as possible.

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT:

You can support by sharing the campaign or following me on social media!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Peggy Muddles. I work in a genome center by day, but by night I assume my alter-ego The Vexed Muddler to create beautiful, unique fashion accessories and decor for science geeks.

I've been making ceramic jewelry since 2012, and started adding clothing and other items made from my digital designs in 2016.

Recently, I started working with a local company called The Maker Bean. They're these really cool people who have a laser cutter, and use it to make beautiful, intricately etched wood accessories. They also make extremely good coffee. But not with the laser cutter. 

We worked together to produce a first beautiful limited run of biology-themed keychains and earrings.

Now, I want to do more, but I need your help! I've designed a set of five super cool viruses, and I want to give you the first chance to get your own necklace or keychain featuring one of these designs:

 

    What We Need & What You Get

    If we successfully reach our goal, I'll use the money to MAKE MORE NERDY GOODNESS! I'll stock my shop, and will take the Viral Good Word to the masses by offering these and other fun microbial accessories at art shows and science conferences. Beautiful pieces like these are where some of the best science outreach starts! I'll also be able to keep working with The Maker Bean to create more fun and unique new designs for you :D

    The Perks: (postage is included for rewards shipped to the US and Canada)

    $1 - I'll email you an exclusive photo of one of my cats, taken just for you. They're really cute cats, so this will be totally worth it, especially if you're a graduate student who needs cute animal photos to get you through long days in the lab.

    $5 - you'll get an awesome sticker pack featuring all 5 new designs in fun colors. I'll pay the postage even if you're overseas, because I love you.

    $25 - you'll get one keychain or necklace of your choice.

    $40 (early bird) - you'll get two keychains or necklaces of your choice.

    $55 (early bird) - you'll get three keychains or necklaces of your choice.

    $90 (early bird) - you'll get FIVE (!!!) keychains or necklaces of your choice.

    If (when!) the early bird perks run out, the following perks will become available:

    $45 - you'll get two keychains or necklaces of your choice.

    $65 - you'll get three keychains or necklaces of your choice.

    $100 - you'll get FIVE (!!!) keychains or necklaces of your choice.

    If all goes well, I expect to be able to start sending out rewards in early July.

    If I don't reach my goal, you'll still get your perks for supporting this campaign, but I'll be very sad and won't be able to afford to make as many awesome new designs, and then everybody else will be sad too. 

    Risks & Challenges

    I don't anticipate any significant risks or challenges for this project. The designs are already finished and I've sent them to my partners at The Maker Bean for prototyping. They have been doing this stuff for years, and have already proven their ability to make amazing products in a very reasonable timeline. They're also adept at troubleshooting design flaws, as I found out with my first batch! On the distribution end, I've been selling similar items in my Etsy shop for years, so I have established packaging and shipping processes already in place. 

    If the response to this campaign is really over the top, it's possible that I or The Maker Bean will get swamped with work. If that happens, it may mean some slight delays in getting out your rewards. In that case we'll prioritize the Early Bird backers, then get out the rest in batches. If necessary, I'm prepared to take on a temporary employee to help expedite reward delivery. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Whether you're backing the campaign or not, one of the best ways to help is to spread the word! You can use the IndieGoGo sharing tools, tell your friends around the free grad student pizza lunch table, tweet it, instagram it, facebook it, or leave sticky notes on the autoclave door. Help make this campaign go...viral (groan).

    Tag me on Twitter @VexedMuddler or Instagram @TheVexedMuddler

story:
Hi there!

I am THE FLYING IRON. However, I was born in a different body. I used to be a school bus. It was a pretty rewarding life, carting kids to and from school for 10 years. But I had dreams, you know? It may sound weird, but I had always wanted to be an iron. I mean, after putting up with so many potholes for all those years, gliding over a swath of fabric and leaving my path smooth behind me seemed so, just, cool. And then I heard about Burning Man. The fabric of reality can get pretty warped out on the playa. I had finally found my calling. But I couldn’t just show up and BE an Iron. Good news is, I had a plan. And some friends to help me out in my transformation.

My first burn was great fun. In fact, some of you may have ridden on my balcony and helped me to smooth out the playa. We had a fantastic time, and I’m planning on going back this year. And that’s where you can help. I can’t wear the same skirt as last year, especially after the condition it was in from Saturday’s dust storm. I’m thinking something in silver.

Of course I want to be safe out on the playa, so I’m going to need an upgrade to my lights so I can meet the new regulations.

I learned some important lessons about aerodynamics last year. And that’s why I need a new set of wings. Bigger ones. That flap. And light up.

Of course, I also want to bring more friends with me when I’m out permanent pressing the playa. And for that, I’m going to need new tires so I can carry more of you around.

All that stuff comes to ~ $2000. And that’s where you guys can help. Your gift is your money, mine is a nice flat playa. Help us get the word out, like us on Facebook. See you in August. Cheers!

story:
Short Summary

Artemis is an intersectional, feminist, creative community which produces art and media to promote the stories, experiences and perspectives of underrepresented communities at the University of Southern California. Artemis became an official organization this fall, and is working to produce its first ever production to inaugurate its presence at USC. 

This December we bring to life an all-women rehearsed reading of The Tempest. Many of Shakespearean plays toy with, and are fundamentally about, gender. Every play examines the power imbalance in a gendered society - and an all-women production keeps this notion of gender at the front of the audience's minds. This helps realise there are many things brought to light about Shakespeare's plays when performed in such a manner. Furthermore, in doing so we hope to celebrate Shakespeare's 400th anniversary and show how his work is still relevant and accessible today. 

This campaign will help fund The Tempest, and kick off Artemis's campaign to establish itself on campus. Your contribution means the world to our young organization and will contribute to an amazing legacy of inclusive productions.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations go a long way to helping making this show the best that it can be. Funds will go to paying for the space, costumes, lighting equipment, and instruments for sound, all vital to our production. 

The Impact

Artemis hopes to continue to produce and promote creative endeavour and to develop a  community for students of all races, genders, and sexual orientations to engage in artistic exploration. The Tempest is the first project produced by Artemis, and is incredibly important for establishing ourselves as on campus. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While we appreciate any donation of any quantity, we respect and understand that not everyone can afford to donate. You can always help by sharing the link to our show, moral support is always welcome. And of course, more than anything, we just want you to come and enjoy this amazing production with us so don't forget to reserve your tickets!

December 2nd at 7:30 PM 

Link to Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/artemis-at-usc-pre...
Artemis Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/ArtemisatUSC
